original: Note from Urag gro-Shub
string: 乌拉格·格洛-舒布的笔记

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18">
I don't know what your friend could be interested about, but the most eventful period of the Third Era should pique her curiosirty. I'll give you a selection of the four books that should give her an idea. Sadly, half of them are vague at best.

1: A BRIEF STORY OF THE EMPIRE, V4
This book narrates the late members of the Septim dynasty right after Uriel V's death in Akavir. Most events are minutiae, but the interesting part comes in the chapters of Uriel Septim VII, which narrates the crisis of the Imperial Simulacrum. It's a fairly informative read.
I'm certain that BIRNA, right here in WINTERHOLD, should have a copy. It's literally at the exit of the college.

2: WHERE WERE YOU WHEN THE DRAGON BROKE
Now, if it were up to me, I'd recommend "The Warp in the West", which can be acquired in Cyrodiil, but sadly, it wasn't imported into Skyrim and, consequently, I don't have it in the Arcanaeum either. I guess someone upstairs forgot about it...
This book is written in verse and has little information of what happened in four Dragon Breaks, so I wouldn't call it very informative, but it's the best we've got.
REVYN SADRI from WINDHELM should have it. Just turn right as you enter the city and you'll find yourself in the Grey Quarter. His shop should be around there.

3: BATTLE OF THE RED MOUNTAIN
Your friend would be interested in a book that narrates the history of the Nerevarine Prophecy and the Tribunal's fall. For some reason though, nobody wrote anything about it. No, really. The most important event in Morrowind's recent history and no one writes a damn book about it!
So the best I can come up with is a book that describes the events that preceeded the prophecy. Just tell her that "the bad guys lost" and call it a day.
I'd wager BRAND-SHEI should have a copy. You'll find him in a market stall in RIFTEN.

4: THE OBLIVION CRISIS
A book that descrives the events in detail for a change! No complaints here. I think your friend will enjoy the read.
It's a popular book too, so I bet BELETHOR from WHITERUN has it in his store.

And that is all. I hope your friend finds these books informative, despite not all of them being an ideal source of information. Safe travels!
- Urag gro-Shub


PS: While you're at it, I'd be much appreciated if you could ask these merchants if they have a copy of "The Lusty Argonian Maid v4" and bring it to me.

NOT FOR MY PERSONAL USE OF COURSE!
It's just for the library! Yes, all books have a place in the library. For posterity.
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="19">
我不知道你的朋友会对什么感兴趣，但第三纪元最动荡的时期应该会激起她的好奇心。我给你选了四本书，应该能让她有所了解。遗憾的是，其中一半充其量只是含糊其辞。

1：《帝国简史·卷4》
这本书叙述了尤瑞尔五世在阿卡维尔去世后，塞普汀王朝晚期成员的故事。大部分事件都是细枝末节，但有趣的部分出现在尤瑞尔·塞普汀七世的章节中，叙述了帝国的篡位危机。这本书内容相当丰富。
我确信，冬堡的比尔娜处应该有一本。它就在学院的出口处。

2: 《龙破时你在何方》
如果可以，我宁愿推荐《西方扭曲》，这本书能够在希罗帝尔获得，但遗憾的是，天际并没有引进这本书，因此，我的秘藏馆中也没有这本书。我猜楼上有人把它给忘了……
《龙破时你在何方》是用诗歌写成的，关于四次 “龙破 ”所发生的事情的信息很少，所以我不会称它为信息量很大的书，但它是我们所能得到的最好的书了。
风舵城的瑞温·萨德利应该有这本书。进城后右转，就会发现自己到灰民区了。他的店应该就在附近。

3: 《红山之战》
你的朋友可能会对一本讲述尼瑞瓦因预言和审判席覆灭历史的书感兴趣。但不知何故，没人写过这方面的内容。不，是真的。这是晨风近代史上最重要的事件，却没有人为此写一本该死的书！
所以我能想到的最好的办法就是写一本书，描述预言之前发生的事情。只要告诉她 “坏人输了 ”就可以了。
我敢打赌，布兰德-谢应该有一本。你可以在裂谷城的市场摊位上找到他。

4：《湮灭危机》
这是一本详细描述事件的书！这个没得吹。我想你的朋友会喜欢这本书的。
这也是一本很受欢迎的书，所以我敢打赌，白漫城的贝莱托尔的杂货铺一定有这本书。

就这些吧。我希望你的朋友能从这些书中获取信息，尽管它们不都是理想的信息来源。一路顺风！
——乌拉格·格洛-舒布


附注：如果你能问问这些商人是否有《元气满满的阿尔贡女仆·卷4》，并把它带给我，我将不胜感激。

当然不是给我个人用的！
只是为了图书馆！是的，所有的书在图书馆里都有一席之地。为了子孙后代。
</font>

string: 如果你觉得有帮助的话。

original: All right, let's see what you have.
string: 好吧，来看看你有什么。

original: Why don't you keep your things, and I'll keep mine.
string: 这样吧，你的东西你自己留着，我的东西我也留着。

string: 我不会替你做这件事。

original: Not happening.
string: 什么都没有发生。

original: That's it? All right.
string: 就这样吗？好吧。

original: Nothing else?
string: 没别的事了？

original: Finished?
string: 办妥了？

original: Done then?
string: 做完了？

original: I don't think so.
string: 我不这么认为。

original: I can't do everything for you.
string: 我不能什么都帮你处理。

original: No. Bad idea.
string: 不。这主意太糟了。

original: I'm on it.
string: 马上处理。

original: Got it.
string: 了解。

original: On it.
string: 了解。

original: What do you need?
string: 你需要什么？

original: What is it?
string: 怎么了？

original: What now?
string: 现在呢？

original: What's the plan?
string: 计划是什么？

original: Come with me.
string: 跟我走。

original: Another adventure.
string: 新的冒险。

original: Let's make some more stories.
string: 一同创造新的故事。

original: Thought you'd never ask.
string: 还以为你永远不会开口呢。

original: Whenever you're ready.
string: 你好了就出发吧。

original: I knew you'd miss me.
string: 我就知道你会想我。

original: Let's go.
string: 出发吧。

original: Good. Let's go.
string: 好的，让我们出发吧。

original: Wait here.
string: 在这等一会。

original: I'll hang back for a bit, but you're not leaving me behind. This is too important.
string: 我愿意跟你保持一段距离，但是你不能把我丢下。这事太重大了。

original: If you think I'm going to let you have all the fun, you're crazy. I'll let you lead ahead, but I'll be keeping an eye on you.
string: 你要是以为我会让你自己一个人玩得开心，那你就傻了。我会让你开路，但是我可是会一直盯着你。

original: Sorry, I'm not that easy to get rid of. If you want to run ahead, I won't stop you, but I'll be following.
string: 抱歉，我没那么容易被摆脱。你如果想要先走就走吧。我不会阻止你，但是我会跟上。

original: Oh, you're off on your own for a while? All right.
string: 喔，你想要自己去探险吗？好吧。

original: I'll be here.
string: 我会在这里等着。

original: If you say so.
string: 如果你这么说的话…….

original: Alright. But don't take long.
string: 好的，但不要去太久。

original: So now that we're stuck together, shouldn't we start getting to know one another?
string: 既然我们现在绑在一块了，是不是该开始互相了解下呢？

original: Having just a business-like relationship feels a little dull if you ask me.
string: 要我说，只维持交易似的往来未免也太严肃了。

original: So now that we're stuck together, shouldn't we start getting to know one another?
string: 既然我们现在绑在一块了，是不是该开始互相了解下呢？

original: Having just a business-like relationship feels a little dull if you ask me.
string: 要我说，只维持交易似的往来未免也太严肃了。

original: Okay. How old are you?
string: 行吧，那么你多大了？

original: That's not something you're supposed to ask a lady, you know?
string: 这可不是个该向女士提出的问题，你知道吗？

original: Look, just... Tell me something about you.
string: 听着，这样吧……随便给我说点你的事。

original: I'm the Dragonborn.
string: 我是龙裔。

original: Wait, like... The Nord legend about a mortal with the blood and soul of a Dragon?
string: 等等，就是……诺德传说里那个拥有龙血和龙魂的凡人吗？

original: I knew that Dragons had returned to Skyrim and a Dragonborn was out there hunting them, but that was you? Talk about coincidence!
string: 我知道龙族回到了天际，也知道龙裔正在狩猎它们，但那就是你？这也太巧了！

original: I'm pretty sure you don't get paid for it but... It's still pretty interesting.
string: 我敢肯定你没从这事上拿到报酬，但……还挺有意思的。

original: Speaking of which, what do you do to earn a living?
string: 说到这个，你做着什么行当？

original: I'm with the Dawnguard.
string: 我和黎明守卫在一块。

original: Yeah, I can tell.
string: 确实，我看得出来。

original: I'll assume you didn't do much before joining them, but it sounds kind of boring, to be honest.
string: 我猜你在加入他们之前没做过什么，但说实话，这听起来有点没意思。

original: No offense, of course. But you have to go out more often. See the world and all that.
string: 当然，我无意冒犯。但你真得多出去走走见见世面什么的。

original: You have a fish out of the water to take care of after all.
string: 毕竟，你还有条“离水之鱼”要照料呢。

original: Yeah, no kidding.
string: 当然，没开玩笑。

original: I'll assume you didn't do much before joining them, but it sounds kind of boring, to be honest.
string: 我猜你在加入他们之前没做过什么，但说实话，这听起来有点没意思。

original: No offense, of course. But you have to go out more often. See the world and all that.
string: 当然，我无意冒犯。但你真得多出去走走见见世面什么的。

original: You have a fish out of the water to take care of after all.
string: 毕竟，你还有条“离水之鱼”要照料呢。

original: I work for your father.
string: 我为你父亲工作。

original: I'm an officer of the Imperial Legion.
string: 我是帝国军团的军官。

original: Right. You did tell me about a civil war, but I didn't know you were actually involved in it.
string: 对哦。你确实提过内战的事，但我没想到你真的参与了。

original: I honestly didn't take you for the military type. Especially considering you're acting outside your army right now.
string: 老实说，我没觉得你是军人那种类型。尤其是考虑到你现在的行为已经脱离了军队。

original: I suppose you've been given a bit more freedom, being the Dragonborn and all.
string: 既然你是龙裔，想必行动上能多些自由吧。

original: I'm a Stormcloak fighting for Skyrim's independence.
string: 我是风暴斗篷的一员，我为天际的独立而战。

original: Right. You did tell me about a civil war, but I didn't know you were actually involved in it.
string: 对哦。你确实提过内战的事，但我没想到你真的参与了。

original: I honestly didn't take you for the military type. Especially considering you're acting outside your army right now.
string: 老实说，我没觉得你是军人那种类型。尤其是考虑到你现在的行为已经脱离了军队。

original: I suppose you've been given a bit more freedom, being the Dragonborn and all.
string: 既然你是龙裔，想必行动上能多些自由吧。

original: I'm with the Companions.
string: 我来自战友团。

original: The mercenaries from Jorrvaskr? They're still around?
string: 月瓦斯卡的佣兵？他们还存在吗？

original: Not bad. I thought that they would have disbanded long ago, but to think they held up until now...
string: 不错嘛。我还以为他们早都解散了，没想到居然撑到了现在……

original: It's rather impressive. Good for them!
string: 这很了不起。真为他们高兴！

original: I'm with the College of Winterhold.
string: 我来自冬堡学院。

original: Oh. A fellow magician, huh?
string: 哦？你也是个魔法师，嗯？

original: I've been there a few times myself back in my age. Not that I was a pupil or anything, but... I enjoyed the library.
string: 早年我也去过那儿几次。倒不是说我是学生什么的，而是……我很喜欢图书馆。

original: I'm relieved that they're still active. I'd appreciate it if you let me do some sightseeing next time you go there.
string: 幸好他们还在活动。如果你下次能带我也去观光一下，我会很感激的。

original: I'm with the Thieves Guild.
string: 我来自盗贼公会。

original: There's a... Guild made out of thieves? How is that even possible?
string: 有一个……盗贼组成的公会？这真的可能吗？

original: I'm not judging you or anything, of course. It's rather interesting, actually.
string: 当然，我并不是在批评你什么。实际上，这还挺有趣的。

original: I'm not asking to get involved in that, but I would like to see how it works. I'm way too curious to let it slide.
string: 我并不是想掺和进去，但我很想了解它的运作方式。我对这事真挺好奇的。

original: Don't worry. I won't report you to the guards or anything. I know how to keep my mouth shut.
string: 别担心，我不会向守卫告密什么的。我懂得守口如瓶。

original: I serve the will of Sithis in the Dark Brotherhood.
string: 我于黑暗兄弟会侍奉西帝斯之意志。

original: I'm not familiar with that organization, but the fact that you pledge yourself to the personification of the Void gives me an idea of what you do.
string: 我不熟悉那个组织，但你向“虚无”的化身宣示忠诚，我对你做的事也多少有些了解了。

original: I understand it's something rather clandestine, so I won't pry.
string: 我知道这是很秘密的事，所以我就不打听了。

original: I travel from city to city looking for jobs I can do.
string: 我在城市之间旅行，寻找我可以做的工作。

original: Like a bounty hunter? Interesting. You must have been in so many places!
string: 像赏金猎人一样？真有意思，你一定去过很多地方。

original: As someone who's been living in the same place most of her life, I must admit I find your life sort of exciting!
string: 作为一个大半辈子都生活在同一个地方的人，我必须承认，我觉得你的生活还挺让人兴奋的！

original: I know we just met and all, but if you don't mind, I'd like to tag along for your jobs. It's the perfect excuse to explore the province.
string: 我知道我们才刚认识，但如果你不介意，我想跟着你一起去工作。这可是游览这个省份的绝佳机会。

original: You know? I've never been to the Throat of the World before. I read once that aurora borealis are common at the top. Always wanted to see them.
string: 你知道吗？我以前从没去过世界之喉。我曾经读到过极光在山顶很常见。我一直想去看看。

original: We're not going that high, Serana.
string: 我们不会去那么高的地方，瑟拉娜。

original: Why? Because it's cold? That's not stopping me, that's for sure!
string: 为什么？因为冷？那是肯定不能阻止我的。

original: Although hiking is no fun if you're not doing it with friends.
string: 不过，如果徒步旅行不是和朋友一起，那就没意思了。

original: I guess we'll have to wait until next year when summer comes back. It's a bummer we just missed it.
string: 我想我们只能等到明年夏天再来了。真遗憾，我们就这么错过了。

original: But if your only problem is the cold, then... Why don't you just borrow a coat from the old men?
string: 但如果你唯一的问题是寒冷，那么……你为什么不对着空气吼个火焰之类的暖和一下呢？

original: We're not climbing the 7000 steps for the sake of tourism, Serana!
string: 我们爬这七千级台阶可不是为了观光，瑟拉娜！

original: Fine, fine. We'll wait... A YEAR!
string: 好吧，好吧。我们等……等一整年！

original: Alright... Off we go.
string: 好的…… 我们出发吧。

original: You seem a little tense.
string: 你看起来有点紧张。

original: Well, I haven't seen my mother since she locked me away, so... Yes.
string: 嗯，自从我妈妈把我锁起来之后我就没见过她，所以……是的。

original: I don't even know what to say to her. As time went on, it was harder for me to talk to her. She just... Changed, you know?
string: 我甚至不知道该对她说什么。随着时间的推移，我和她说话变得越来越困难。她只是……变了，你知道吗？

original: I guess it's what happens when you gain eternal life. The older you get, the more pragmatic you become.
string: 我想这就是当你获得永生时会发生的事情。年纪越大，就越务实。

original: And there's the age gap too. It's always harder to approach someone older than you, isn't it?
string: 而且还有年龄代沟。接近比你年长的人总是比较困难，不是吗？

original: You are pretty easy to approach if you ask me.
string: 要我说，你很容易接近。

original: True. But then again, I've been sleeping for who knows how long, so maybe I haven't reached that point yet.
string: 说得对。不过话又说回来，我已经睡了不知多久，或许还没到那个地步吧。

original: Speaking of which, how old are you?
string: 说到这里，你多大了？

original: I'm in my early twenties.
string: 我二十岁出头。

original: I figured as much. I almost took you for a teenager when we first met.
string: 我看出来了。我们第一次见面的时候，我差点把你当成一个十几岁的孩子了。

original: I think you're even younger than I was when I became a vampire. At least I can act like the supervising adult without people finding it weird.
string: 我想你比我成为吸血鬼时还年轻。至少我可以像一个监护人一样行动，人们也不会觉得奇怪。

original: I just made it to my thirties.
string: 我刚刚年过三十。

original: That's actually pretty close to the age I had when I became a vampire.
string: 这实际上非常接近我成为吸血鬼时的年龄。

original: That somehow makes me feel more comfortable around you. I guess it's because I can think of you as someone of my generation.
string: 这在某种程度上让我在你身边感觉更舒服。我想这是因为我可以把你看成同年龄段的人。

original: Although... Maybe I was a bit younger? I don't remember anymore.
string: 虽然……也许我还年轻一点？我不记得了。

original: Almost fifty, actually.
string: 实际上快五十了。

original: Oh dear...! You're closer to the age my parents appear to have than mine!
string: 哦，亲爱的……！你比我的年龄更接近我父母的年龄！

original: Not that it makes me feel uncomfortable around you but... I don't know.
string: 并不是说这让我在你身边感到不舒服，而是……我不知道。

original: I guess it's the age gap thing I said earlier, but don't take this personally. You're actually easier to approach than most people of your age.
string: 我想这是我之前所说的年龄代沟问题，但不要觉得我是针对你。事实上，你比大多数同龄人更容易接近。

original: What about you? When were you born?
string: 你呢？你是什么时候出生的？

original: During the first era, in the year--
string: 在第一纪元，就那一年-

original: Didn't I tell you not to ask me that?
string: 我不是告诉过你别问我这个吗？

original: Relax, I just wanted you to loosen up.
string: 别紧张，我只是想让你放松一下。

original: Huh. Is that so?
string: 哦？是这样吗？

original: Well, I actually do feel less tense, so I guess it worked out after all.
string: 好吧，我确实感觉不那么紧张了，所以我想这还是起作用了。

original: But seriously, don't bring up my age ever again.
string: 但说真的，不要再提起我的年龄了。

original: Oh, so now you're my big sister?
string: 哦，现在你是我的大姐姐了？

original: I mean it! You're barely an adult when it comes to experience. You need someone responsible to tell you when you're making a terrible decision.
string: 我是认真的！就经验而言，你作为成年人还很勉强。当你做出糟糕的决定时，需要有人负责任地告诉你。

original: You've got to admit, as far as pranks go, this is a good one.
string: 你得承认，对于恶作剧来说，这个不错。

original: I'm not laughing, Serana!
string: 我没笑，瑟拉娜。

original: I know. That's what makes it so funny!
string: 我知道。就是这一点有意思！

original: Relax, I'm only joking! Don't get so worked up about it.
string: 别紧张，我只是开玩笑！别这么激动。

original: The letter says that I have to go all the way back to the south!
string: 信上说，我必须大老远的回去南方！

original: Which is where the mountain we were planning to return the horn is located, isn't it?
string: 这不就是我们打算取号角的那个台座的位置吗？

original: Whoever took it could have waited for you in Ivarstead or right here, but instead they went out of their way to travel north and then back south.
string: 拿走它的人本可以在伊瓦尔镇或者就在这里等你，但他们却不辞辛苦地往北又往南走。

original: I mean, if they knew you were after the horn, then I'm sure they knew you would deliver it to the Greybeards eventually.
string: 我的意思是，如果他们知道你在找号角，那么我肯定，他们知道你最终会把它交给灰胡子。

original: So you may have been made a fool of, but... Who's the actual idiot who went through unnecessary lengths just to contact you?
string: 所以你可能被愚弄了，但是……那个为了联系你而大费周章的白痴到底是谁？

original: Now quit complaining and let's get out of this tomb already, okay?
string: 现在别抱怨了，让我们离开这个坟墓，好吗？

original: Well, at least she gave us the horn right away. I guess it won't hurt to listen to what she has to say.
string: 好吧，至少她立刻就把号角给我们了。我想听听她怎么说也无妨。

original: What if it's a trap?
string: 万一是陷阱怎么办？

original: Well, there's two of us, and I could always seduce her if she tries anything.
string: 好吧，我们有两个人，如果她有什么企图，我随时可以诱惑她。

original: Well, there's two of us. If she tries anything, we can gang up on her.
string: 好吧，我们两个人。如果她想耍什么花样，我们可以联手对付她。

original: One way or another, she'll tell us what her deal is.
string: 无论如何，她都会告诉我们她打算干什么。

original: Afterwards, we can just go to High Hrothgar and deliver the horn.
string: 之后，我们就可以去霍斯加修道院，递交号角。

original: You... What?!
string: 你……什么？

original: With Vampiric Seduction, you idiot!
string: 用吸血鬼诱惑，你个白痴！

original: One way or another, she'll tell us what her deal is.
string: 无论如何，她都会告诉我们她打算干什么。

original: Afterwards, we can just go to High Hrothgar and deliver the horn.
string: 之后，我们就可以去霍斯加修道院，递交号角。

original: Well, that was... Certainly a ritual. My ears are still ringing. Are you okay?
string: 刚才那个仪式真是…够呛。我现在耳朵还在嗡嗡作响，你还好吗？

original: Whaaat?!
Oh, great...
string: 哦，太好了……

original: Just let me know when your hearing is restored so that we can continue. Those Dragons aren't gonna kill themselves.
string: 等你的听力恢复了告诉我一声，咱们再继续。那些龙可不会自己送死。

original: The flagons are gonna kiss their shelves?!
string: 酒壶要亲吻他们的架子了吗？！

original: Ha ha! Oh, that's too precious!
string: 哈哈！哦，这可太有意思了。

original: My ears are still ringing, but I'll get better.
string: 我的耳朵仍然嗡嗡作响，但我会好起来的。

original: I'm having a hard time understanding what their deal is. Honestly... Was that really necessary?
string: 我很难理解他们在干什么。老实说……这真的有必要吗？

original: In any case, you'll get stronger the more word walls you read, right? It's gonna be quite a trek, and not a pleasant one at that.
string: 无论如何，你读的龙语之墙越多，你就会越强大，对吗？这将是一次苦行，一点都不愉快的那种。

original: You'd rather stay behind while I explore ruins?
string: 你宁愿在我探索废墟时待在后面吗？

original: No, it's fine, as long as we're quick about it. I just think I spent too much time in caves, you know.
string: 不，没关系，只要我们速战速决。我只是觉得我在山洞里待得太久了，你懂的。

original: But then you complain about the weather! What does it take to make you happy?!
string: 但你又抱怨天气！到底要怎么才能让你开心呢？！

original: Oh, shut up!
string: 哦，闭嘴！

original: I guess you're almost ready to infiltrate the party. All that's left is finding you a nice attire. I guess Delphine's got that covered.
string: 我猜你已经准备好潜入聚会了。剩下的就是给你找一套漂亮的衣服了。我猜戴尔芬已经帮你准备好了。

original: You were royalty, right? Could you give me some advice?
string: 你是皇室成员，对吧？你能给我一些建议吗？

original: I thought you'd never ask. I've been to dozens of parties hosted by my parents, so you're right to assume this is my area of expertise.
string: 我还以为你不会问呢。我参加过几十次我父母举办的聚会，所以你可以认为这是我的专长。

original: If you want to blend in, you're going to have to spend a lot of time in the party itself before beginning the infiltration.
string: 如果你想混入其中，在开始潜入之前，你必须在聚会本身上花费大量时间。

original: That means you're going to have to talk with the other guests, including the host.
string: 这意味着你必须与其他客人，包括主人交谈。

original: The host is a Thalmor. Wouldn't that be dangerous?
string: 主人是梭默。那不会很危险吗？

original: Trust me. Every guest wants to be friends of the host if they have political power, and you must be no different if you want to blend in.
string: 相信我。如果主人拥有政治权力，每个客人都希望成为主人的朋友，如果你想融入其中，也必须如此。

original: If you start avoiding them, they'll get suspicious, so make sure to do some boot-licking so that they let their guard down around you.
string: 如果你开始躲避他们，他们就会起疑心，所以一定要做一些拍马屁的事，让他们对你放松警惕。

original: Then, once you blend in, try figuring out the guests themselves. Find the right strings to pull so that they can cause a good distraction.
string: 然后，一旦你混入其中，尝试去了解客人自身。只要拉动正确的的线，他们就能帮你分散注意力。

original: Alternatively, if you have friends in high places, and they happen to attend the party, maybe you can ask them for a favor.
string: 或者，如果你有高官朋友，而他们又恰好参加了聚会，也许你可以请他们帮个忙。

original: Then, once you get your distraction and everyone's focused on it, you walk away. Slowly.
string: 然后，一旦你分散了大家的注意力，你就可以走开了。慢慢的。

original: And that's pretty much everything. I really wish I could go with you, but I don't think Delphine can pull an invitation for me.
string: 差不多就这些了。我真希望能和你一起去，但我觉得戴尔芬没法帮我弄到邀请函。

original: Unless you can find a way to get me into the party as your date or something. In which case, do make sure I wear something nice, okay?
string: 除非你能想办法让我作为你的女伴什么的，把我弄进派对里。如果这样的话，一定要给我穿得漂亮点，好吗？

original: Nice ambience. It's even more upbeat than the parties I'm used to.
string: 氛围不错。比我习惯的聚会要更欢快。

original: Any ideas on how to proceed?
string: 有什么好办法吗？

original: What? Oh, right! Let's see...
string: 什么？哦，对了！让我看看……

original: That Yokudan sitting there-- Sorry, the Redguard I mean, doesn't seem to be enjoying himself. That's something worth looking into.
string: 坐在那儿的尤库达人——抱歉我是说红卫人，看起来不太开心。这值得留意。

original: Though it's risky, and he doesn't sound sober. He may end up exploding on your face and bringing attention to you.
string: 虽然这很冒险，而且他听起来也不清醒。说不定他会在你面前爆发，把周围的注意力都引过来。

original: Have you talked to the other guests? Pay attention to what they're doing. That Erikur, for example, seems drooling over something.
string: 你和其他客人聊过吗？注意他们在做什么。比如那个艾瑞库尔，好像在对什么流口水。

original: Although it would be easier if you had a friend here. And less risky.
string: 不过，如果你有朋友在这里，那就容易多了。风险也更小。

original: Are you having fun?
string: 玩得开心吗？

original: Absolutely! I missed going to parties like this. All that's left is for someone to take this lady for a dance, don't you think?
string: 当然！我很怀念参加这样的派对。现在就差有人带这位女士去跳舞了，你觉得呢？

original: So now that the party's over, how would you describe your experience?
string: 现在聚会结束了，你觉得这段经历怎么样？

original: Tense. I felt I had a dagger pointed at me at all times.
string: 紧张。我觉得自己一直都被匕首指着。

original: Quite an adventure, huh? It's a shame we can't go there anymore, considering they put you on their black list, and by extension, me.
string: 很刺激吧？真遗憾我们不能再去那里了，考虑到他们把你列入了黑名单，当然还有我。

original: Even I felt tense at my family's parties sometimes. The guests often approached me to "get to know me better".
string: 在家里的聚会上，我有时也会感到紧张。客人们经常来找我 "进一步了解我"。

original: And it got really awkward when they started introducing me to their sons. I often would sneak out of the parties whenever I was fed up with them.
string: 当他们开始把我介绍给他们的儿子时，气氛就变得非常尴尬。每当我对他们感到厌烦时，我就会偷偷溜出聚会。

original: So your advice was based on personal experience?
string: 所以你的建议是基于个人经验？

original: Absolutely! And you passed with flying colors! Good job!
string: 当然！并且你优秀的通过了考验！干得好。

original: Come on. Let's tell Delphine what you found out.
string: 走吧。让我们告诉戴尔芬你发现了什么吧。

original: It was sort of fun, actually!
string: 实际上，这还挺有趣的！

original: Quite an adventure, huh? It's a shame we can't go there anymore, considering they put you on their black list, and by extension, me.
string: 很刺激吧？真遗憾我们不能再去那里了，考虑到他们把你列入了黑名单，当然还有我。

original: Even I felt tense at my family's parties sometimes. The guests often approached me to "get to know me better".
string: 在家里的聚会上，我有时也会感到紧张。客人们经常来找我 "进一步了解我"。

original: And it got really awkward when they started introducing me to their sons. I often would sneak out of the parties whenever I was fed up with them.
string: 当他们开始把我介绍给他们的儿子时，气氛就变得非常尴尬。每当我对他们感到厌烦时，我就会偷偷溜出聚会。

original: The party? Boring. Killing Thalmor? Amusing.
string: 派对？无聊。杀梭默？很有趣。

original: Okay? Well, it was certainly an adventure, if you're into that sort of thing. Shame we won't get to attend their parties anymore.
string: 呃...如果你喜欢这种经历的话，这倒也算得上冒险。可惜我们以后再也参加不了他们的派对了。

original: Even I felt tense at my family's parties sometimes. The guests often approached me to "get to know me better".
string: 在家里的聚会上，我有时也会感到紧张。客人们经常来找我 "进一步了解我"。

original: And it got really awkward when they started introducing me to their sons. I often would sneak out of the parties whenever I was fed up with them.
string: 当他们开始把我介绍给他们的儿子时，气氛就变得非常尴尬。每当我对他们感到厌烦时，我就会偷偷溜出聚会。

original: What do you think about Delphine?
string: 你觉得戴尔芬怎么样？

original: Honestly? I value her as an ally, but I don't like her as a person.
string: 说实话？我看重她作为盟友的价值，但我不喜欢她这个人。

original: She's resourceful, skillful, and has plenty of experience in combat, tactics and maybe even politics. A war veteran is always a must-have in our team
string: 她机智过人，技艺精湛，在战斗、战术乃至政治领域都经验丰富。像这样经历过战争洗礼的老兵，正是我们团队急需的人才。

original: However... I don't know, she seems stubborn and closed-minded. I don't think she's the type to admit when she's wrong.
string: 不过……总觉得她固执己见，不愿接受不同看法。恐怕不是那种会轻易承认错误的人。

original: I'd also point out her paranoia, but the fact that she jokes about it gives me a little hope. So I guess it's just war related traumas.
string: 我本打算指出她的偏执，但她居然还能拿这个自嘲，这倒让我看到些许希望。我猜这大概都是战争创伤留下的后遗症吧。

original: With all that in mind, I'd say I'm glad she's on our side, but I don't think we should follow her blindly.
string: 考虑到这些，我很高兴她站在我们这边，但我认为我们不应该盲目追随她。

original: Just because she's older than you doesn't mean she's necessarily wiser. Stand up to her if you feel that she's making the wrong choices.
string: 她比你年长并不意味着她一定更聪明。如果你觉得她做出了错误的选择，就站出来反对她。

original: I know I should have expected a sewer to smell this bad, but you're telling me that Esbern has been living here for more than a decade?
string: 我早该料到下水道会这么臭，但你告诉我伊思本居然在这里住了十多年？

original: I can't even imagine what it must be like living with this stench for that long. It is already killing me.
string: 难以想象常年住在这种恶臭里会是什么感受，光是现在就快把我熏死了。

original: Me too, but we have to find him.
string: 我也是，但我们必须找到他。

original: Something tells me that Delphine knew exactly where she was sending us to. She and I are gonna have a talk when we get back!
string: 直觉告诉我戴尔芬很清楚她要把我们送到哪里去。等我们回去后，我要跟她好好谈谈。

original: Anyway, let's do this quickly. And... Watch where you step. Remember that everything that people throw down their privy chambers winds up here.
string: 不管怎么说，我们还是快点吧。还有……小心脚下。记住，人们扔进马桶里的所有东西，最后都会到这里来。

original: I think you get used to it with time. Bear it with me.
string: 我想时间长了你就会习惯的。和我一起承受吧。

original: I'm gonna pretend you didn't say that.
string: 我就当你没说过这句话。

original: Anyway, let's do this quickly. And... Watch where you step. Remember that everything that people throw down their privy chambers winds up here.
string: 不管怎么说，我们还是快点吧。还有……小心脚下。记住，人们扔进马桶里的所有东西，最后都会到这里来。

original: And you think the sewers from your castle smelled any better?
string: 你觉得你城堡里的下水道会更好闻吗？

original: I won't pretend that the castle's sewers were the pinnacle of hygiene, but at least it didn't smell like... I don't even want to describe this smell!
string: 我不会假装城堡的下水道很干净，但至少它闻起来不像……我都不想形容这种味道了！

original: Anyway, let's do this quickly. And... Watch where you step. Remember that everything that people throw down their privy chambers winds up here.
string: 不管怎么说，我们还是快点吧。还有……小心脚下。记住，人们扔进马桶里的所有东西，最后都会到这里来。

original: Well... That took an interesting turn. But at least we found Esbern alive.
string: 嗯……真是个有趣的转折。但至少我们发现伊思本还活着。

original: Let's get out of this sewer and, if possible, never come back. I couldn't take another dose of this stench even if my life depended on it.
string: 让我们离开这个下水道吧，如果可能的话，再也不要回来了。就算我的性命就靠它了，我也忍受不了这股恶臭了。

original: So... How are you holding up?
string: 那么……你还好吗？

original: Your body just went through an intense transformation! Isn't it taking its toll on you?
string: 你的身体刚刚经历了一场激烈的转变。这难道不会对你造成影响吗？

original: Are you kidding? I feel amazing!
string: 你在开玩笑吗？我感觉棒极了！

original: Well, good to know not everyone gets a scar out of this.
string: 好吧，很高兴知道不是每个人都会因此留下创伤。

original: I still feel pain, but I'm getting used to it.
string: 我仍然感到疼痛，但我已经习惯了。

original: Well, that's a good sign. After all, you haven't gone through what I did, so you should be fine soon.
string: 嗯，这是个好兆头。毕竟，你没有经历过我所经历的一切，所以你应该很快就会没事的。

original: I guess you're lucky...
string: 我想你很幸运……

original: I feel like I'm burning on the inside! It hurts so much!
string: 我感觉我的身体里在燃烧！疼得厉害！

original: I... I know that feeling too well. I should have warned you about it.
string: 我……我太了解这种感觉了。我应该提醒你的。

original: Even now I still feel that pain from time to time. But don't worry, I'm sure it'll go away. You're not like me after all.
string: 直到现在，我还时不时会感到疼痛。不过别担心，我相信它会消失的。毕竟你和我不一样。

original: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to open your old wounds.
string: 对不起。我不是有意要揭你的旧伤疤。

original: It's fine. I'm the one who brought it up. I was concerned about you, but I guess you'll be alright.
string: 没关系。是我提起来的。我很担心你，但我想你会没事的。

original: Come to think about it, the fact that it was me who turned you into a Vampire may have made you different from the rest.
string: 仔细想想，是我把你变成吸血鬼的，这可能让你跟其他人不一样。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你什么意思？

original: Think about it as a family tree. I was turned directly by Molag Bal, the father of all Vampires. That would make you a "second generation".
string: 你可以理解为家谱。我是直接被莫拉格·巴尔转化的，他是所有吸血鬼的源头。这样算来你就属于“第二代”。

original: In theory, this should grant you the same power that the one my father offered to you as a reward when you brought me home.
string: 理论上来说，这应该能赋予你与我父亲当初作为奖励赐予你相同的力量——就在你带我回家的时候。

original: The abilities of the Vampire Lord may come in handy, so I guess this isn't so bad.
string: 吸血鬼领主的能力可能会派上用场，所以我想这还不算太糟。

original: Isran may not think so.
string: 伊士冉可能不这么认为。

original: Oh yeah... He's gonna be pissed when we get back...
string: 哦，是啊……我们回去的时候他会很生气的……

original: Anyway, we should get going. Start putting your new powers to the test while we're at it. You're going to need them.
string: 总之，我们该走了。开始测试你的新能力吧。你会需要它们的。

original: So... How are you holding up?
string: 那么……你还好吗？

original: It's not the first time I've partially soul trapped a creature, but I never tried it on a mortal.
string: 这不是我第一次禁锢一个生物部分的灵魂，但我从没在凡人身上试过。

original: It's not so bad. You did a good job.
string: 还不错。你做得很好。

original: Really? What a relief! I thought it would take its toll on you.
string: 真的吗？那我就放心了！我还以为你会承受不了呢。

original: To be honest, I thought turning you into a Vampire was the better option, but this worked out better than I thought.
string: 老实说，我以为把你变成吸血鬼是更好的选择，但结果比我想象的要好。

original: I still feel dizzy, but I'm getting used to it.
string: 我仍然感到头晕，但我已经习惯了。

original: Good. I was afraid you'd faint after a while, but if you're getting better, then I was needlessly worrying.
string: 那就好。我还担心你过段时间会晕倒呢，不过如果你已经好起来了，那我就没必要担心了。

original: To be honest, I thought turning you into a Vampire was the better option, but this worked out better than I thought.
string: 老实说，我以为把你变成吸血鬼是更好的选择，但结果比我想象的要好。

original: Would you have preferred me to become a vampire?
string: 你希望我变成吸血鬼吗？

original: Well, I... I don't know.
string: 不！我不是这个意思！我永远不会想为你做这种事！

original: I mean... As adventageous as it is, sometimes the price isn't worth it. I guess it depends on the individual.
string: 我的意思是，尽管这很有优势，但有时并不值得付出那样的代价。我想这取决于个人。

original: Was it worth it for you?
string: 你觉得值得吗？

original: Well, I learned to appreciate it, so yes. But I also realized that if something lasts too much, it ends up deteriorating.
string: 嗯，我学会了欣赏它，所以是的。但我也意识到，如果某件事持续太久，它最终会变质。

original: Just look at how my family ended up. Even our friendship would end up falling apart if we both lived forever.
string: 看看我家人的结局就知道了。如果我们都能永生，就连我们的友谊也会分崩离析。

original: So, when I die... Will you be ready to let go?
string: 那么，当我死后……你准备好放手了吗？

original: I-I don't know... Maybe that's why part of me was hoping you'd agree to become a Vampire.
string: 我--我不知道……也许这就是为什么我内心希望你同意成为一名吸血鬼。

original: But that was selfish. Nobody should make a choice of this magnitude for you.
string: 但这是自私的。没有人应该为你做出如此重大的选择。

original: I should just cherish whatever time we have together.
string: 我应该珍惜我们在一起的时光。

original: I didn't expect you'd get so emotional.
string: 我没想到你会这么激动。

original: Well... You're the first true friend I ever had. I never had anyone to open up to, or just talk about normal stuff and have fun.
string: 嗯……你是我第一个真正的朋友。我从来没有人可以跟我敞开心扉，聊聊家常，找找乐子。

original: I'm glad you're the one who woke me up that day.
string: 这感觉...很不错。谢谢。

original: I'm glad you feel that way.
string: 我很高兴你有这样的感觉。

original: Yeah, although maybe this isn't the best place to talk about this. Let's get going.
string: 是啊，不过也许这里不是谈这个的好地方。我们走吧。

original: So... How are you holding up?
string: 那么……你还好吗？

original: I'm fine. Why?
string: 我很好。为什么？

original: Well, the reason we can pass through that portal is because we Vampires no longer count among the living.
string: 我们之所以能通过那个入口，是因为我们吸血鬼不再是活人了。

original: However, as far as I'm concerned, you only turned into one recently, so I just wanted to be sure if you were okay.
string: 不过，在我看来，你只是刚刚才转变的，所以我只想确定你是否有事。

original: As you can see, I'm perfectly fine.
string: 正如你所看到的，我很好。

original: Yeah, I guess I was needlessly worried. Had you crossed as a mortal... You probably don't want to know.
string: 是啊 我想我是杞人忧天了。如果你作为一个凡人穿越……你可能不想知道。

original: It's a good thing I accepted Harkon's gift, then.
string: 那么，我接受哈孔的礼物是件好事。

original: Yes, I guess it is.
string: 是的，我想是的。

original: Now that we're on the subject, there's something I wanted to ask you about.
string: 既然说到这个话题，我想问你一件事。

original: How did it feel to lose your mortality? I don't remember anymore, so I was hoping you could share your experience with me.
string: 失去凡人之躯的感觉如何？我已经不记得了，所以我希望你能和我分享你的经历。

original: You're not missing much. Being Mortal or Vampire doesn't feel different to me.
string: 你并没有错过什么。在我看来，凡人和吸血鬼并没有什么不同。

original: Really? I thought the difference would be abysmal.
string: 真的吗？我以为差别会非常大。

original: I guess I've been thinking about it too much, but there's no reason to look back.
string: 我想我想得太多了，但没有理由回头看。

original: It feels like I lost the ability to breathe, and yet be able to live without it.
string: 这种感觉就像我失去了呼吸的能力，但又能在不用呼吸的情况下生活。

original: Yeah... That sounds about right.
string: 是啊……听起来差不多。

original: There's always a price to be paid for immortality. I don't regret it, but sometimes I can't help but look back.
string: 永生总是要付出代价的。我并不后悔，但有时会忍不住回首往事。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你什么意思？

original: It's not easy to explain.
string: 这不好解释。

original: When my family decided to do the ritual... I didn't feel like I had a choice. I felt a lot of pressure in the days leading up to that moment.
string: 当我的家人决定举行仪式时……我觉得我别无选择。在那个时刻到来之前，我感觉压力很大。

original: Don't get me wrong. I don't regret becoming a vampire, but... The transformation left a lasting mark on me.
string: 别误会我的意思。我不后悔成为吸血鬼，但我被迫放弃了正常的人生。

original: I remember I struggled a lot with this change for decades, so I know how difficult it must have been for you.
string: 我记得自己几十年来一直在为这种变化而挣扎，所以我知道这对你来说有多难。

original: But, to be honest, I'm glad you chose to join us. You're the only one in the castle that is actually fun to talk to.
string: 不过，说实话，我很高兴你选择加入我们。你是城堡里唯一一个真正有趣的人。

original: That's reassuring. Thanks, Serana.
string: 那我就放心了。谢谢，瑟拉娜。

original: No, thank you for talking to me about it. Come on, let's get going.
string: 不，谢谢你跟我说这些。来吧，我们走。

original: Are you alright? You seem distracted.
string: 你还好吗？你看起来心不在焉。

original: Well, yes, but... I just had a lot on my mind lately. Thanks for asking.
string: 是的，不过……最近心里装着太多事了。谢谢你的关心。

original: I know I was reluctant to tell you about my age before, but that was only because I barely knew you.
string: 之前我不愿告诉你我的年龄，只是因为我们还不够熟悉。

original: Now I think there's enough trust between us to talk about it, so you can ask if you want. I won't get mad.
string: 现在我们之间有了足够的信任，你可以问了。我不会生气。

original: You okay?
string: 你还好吗？

original: Yeah. I just wanted to ask you something. About your childhood. What was it like?
string: 还好。我只是想问你点事。关于你的童年。那是什么样的？

original: I was fortunate. My family loved me and supported me.
string: 我很幸运。我的家人爱我并支持我。

original: I'm happy for you. And I'm glad that you learned to appreciate it.
string: 我为你感到高兴。我很高兴你懂得感激这样的生活。

original: It was depressing. I felt unwanted.
string: 我感到很压抑。我觉得自己不受欢迎。

original: I'm so sorry. I can't say I know what that feels like, but I can understand what you went through
string: 我很抱歉。我不能说我知道那是什么感觉，但我能理解你所经历的一切。

original: Tough. I lost too many people too soon.
string: 艰难。我早早地失去了太多的人。

original: I'm sorry to hear that. I hope you don't have to live through that ever again.
string: 听到这个消息我很遗憾。我希望你再也不用经历这些了。

original: Lonely. I had to survive on my own from a very young age.
string: 孤独。我从小就不得不独自生存。

original: It must have been hard. I can hardly call that a childhood. You must have been forced to grow up fast, did you?
string: 那一定很艰难。我很难说那是童年。你一定是被迫快速长大的，对吧？

original: I was a noble, just like you.
string: 我曾是个贵族，就像你一样。

original: Really? And when were you planning on telling me?
string: 真的吗？你打算什么时候告诉我？

original: And don't say "you didn't ask". Especially since I did ask you to tell me about yourself the other day.
string: 并且不要说“你没有问”。尤其是那天我确实要求你介绍一下你自己。

original: My family was poor, but we were happy.
string: 我家很穷，但我们很快乐。

original: That's... Kind of sweet, actually.
string: 这……实际上挺甜的。

original: I mean, I know it was hard to live under those conditions, but finding happiness in spite of that sounds like a fairytale.
string: 我的意思是，我知道在那种条件下生活很困难，但在这样的条件下还能找到幸福，听起来就像童话故事一样。

original: But then again, I was born rich, so maybe I'm not one to talk.
string: 但话又说回来，我出身富裕，所以也许我不应该说这样的话。

original: I barely had a childhood. I grew up during the Great War.
string: 我几乎没有童年。我是在大战期间长大的。

original: I guess that makes sense. The war must have taken away everything from you.
string: 我想这是有道理的。战争一定夺走了你的一切。

original: I'm sorry you were born during that time. Under better circumstances, you may have had a chance to be a kid.
string: 很遗憾你出生在那个年代。在更好的环境下，你也许有机会成为一个孩子。

original: Sorry. I don't feel comfortable talking about it.
string: 对不起。我不太愿意谈论这件事。

original: It's alright. I'm not forcing you to open up. You should talk about it whenever you feel ready.
string: 没事的，我不会强迫你敞开心扉。你应该在准备好之后再说出来。

original: Why did you ask?
string: 你为什么这么问？

original: Well... It's something I was hoping we could talk about. Do you mind?
string: 嗯……我希望我们能谈谈这些事。你介意吗？

original: Sure. What's wrong?
string: 当然，怎么了？

original: Well, when you brought me back home, I asked my father if my stuff was still there. Surprisingly, he hadn't discarded it like he did with my mother's
string: 好吧，你带我回家的时候，我问父亲我的东西还在不在。出乎意料的是，他并没有像处理我母亲的东西那样，把我的东西丢掉。

original: Among other things, I found a small portrait of a little girl embracing a dog. I thought it had been misplaced.
string: 其中，我发现了一幅小女孩拥抱小狗的小画像。我以为是放错了地方。

original: So I started asking some of the castle staff if it was theirs, until Garan pointed out that the girl looked just like me when I was little.
string: 于是我询问了城堡里的仆人们是不是他们的孩子，直到加兰指出这女孩和我小时候长得一模一样。

original: And he was right! That girl was me! That means that I had a dog once!
string: 他说得对！那女孩就是我！这意味着我曾经养过狗！

original: So what's the big deal? Everyone can have pets.
string: 有什么大不了的？每个人都可以养宠物。

original: Yeah. And everyone remembers them even long after they pass away.
string: 是啊，即使在他们去世很久之后，每个人也还都会记得他们。

original: But I had no idea! I don't even remember having a dog.
string: 可我完全没印象！连养过狗这件事都不记得了。

original: And that's not all. I also had a tray containing 20 dissected specimens of butterflies. I don't remember ever collecting them.
string: 还不止这些。我还有个装着20只解剖蝴蝶标本的托盘。我不记得自己曾经收集过它们。

original: There was so much stuff there... And none of that seemed familiar.
string: 那里有很多东西……没有一样是熟悉的。

original: So it bothers you that you don't remember your childhood.
string: 所以你不记得自己的童年让你很烦恼。

original: Exactly. I feel like I've lost a fragment of my identity.
string: 没错。我觉得失去了一部分自我。

original: Even if I moved on from those things... I should still remember that they were a part of my life.
string: 即使我从那些事情中走出来……我也应该记得它们曾是我生命的一部分。

original: You think it's because you lived for too long?
string: 你觉得是因为你活得太久了吗？

original: I'd been thinking about it for a while. I'm glad I'm immortal, but the passage of time is starting to weigh on me.
string: 我已经考虑了一段时间了。我很高兴我是永生的，但时间的流逝开始给我带来压力。

original: I'm just wondering if that's what happened to my father. Maybe he just stopped caring for the past.
string: 我只是在想我父亲是不是也这样。也许他只是不再关心过去了。

original: What if I end up doing what he did?
string: 如果我最终也像他一样怎么办？

original: Maybe you forgot because you simply had no one to share these things with.
string: 也许只是因为没有人可以跟你分享这些事情，你才忘记的。

original: You think so? I'm not so sure. The more I think about it, the more I believe that the passage of time is... Weighing on me, you know?
string: 你这么认为？我不确定。我越想越觉得时间的流逝……在拖累我，你知道吗？

original: I'm just wondering if that's what happened to my father. Maybe he just stopped caring for the past.
string: 我只是在想我父亲是不是也这样。也许他只是不再关心过去了。

original: What if I end up doing what he did?
string: 如果我最终也像他一样怎么办？

original: It's not about how long you live, but whether or not you forget who you are.
string: 关键不在于你活了多久，而在于你是否忘记了自己是谁。

original: Right, I... Sorry. You're right.
string: 好吧，我……抱歉。你说得对。

original: I can't live in fear of what I may become just because it happened to my father.
string: 我不能因为发生在父亲身上的事，而整日担心自己也会变成那样。

original: No. It didn't "happen". He chose this! And I won't follow in his footsteps!
string: 不，这不是“发生”的。是他自己选择的，我不会步他的后尘！

original: If you ever need to talk about it, I'm here.
string: 如果你需要倾诉，我随时都在。

original: I know you are. Thank you.
string: 我知道你会的。谢谢。

original: Stop it. You're not like him.
string: 别说了。你一点都不像他。

original: I know, but... For how long?
string: 我知道，但……又能多久呢？

original: You don't know what he was like when I was younger. It's true he was distant, but deep down he cared about me.
string: 你不知道我小时候的他是什么样子。虽然确实疏离，但他心底是在乎我的。

original: Now he's willing to kill me to achieve his goals! How long will I be me until my identity erodes like his did?
string: 现在，他为了达到目的不惜杀了我！在我像他一样被侵蚀之前，我还能做我自己多久？

original: Well, now I've seen everything!
string: 好吧，这下可算开了眼界！

original: Though it's nice to meet a friendly dragon for a change.
string: 虽然偶尔遇到友善的龙也挺好的。

original: I almost had a heart attack when I saw him!
string: 看到他时，我差点心脏病发作！

original: Well, good thing he knew some manners and introduced himself, am I right? I like him already.
string: 好在他懂礼貌，做了自我介绍，对吧？我已经喜欢上他了。

original: Anyway, that Elder Scroll isn't gonna find itself. We should get going.
string: 总之，上古卷轴不会自己找自己的。我们该走了。

original: Well, good thing he knew some manners and introduced himself, am I right? I like him already.
string: 好在他懂礼貌，做了自我介绍，对吧？我已经喜欢上他了。

original: And we already had the Elder Scroll you needed! Who would have thought it would be related to your prophecy too?
string: 而且我们早已拥有你需要的上古卷轴！谁会想到它也和你的预言有关呢？

original: I swear, if he hadn't greeted me, he'd be dead.
string: 我发誓，要不是他跟我打招呼，他早就死了。

original: Well, good thing he knew some manners and introduced himself, am I right? I like him already.
string: 好在他懂礼貌，做了自我介绍，对吧？我已经喜欢上他了。

original: Anyway, that Elder Scroll isn't gonna find itself. We should get going.
string: 总之，上古卷轴不会自己找自己的。我们该走了。

original: Well, good thing he knew some manners and introduced himself, am I right? I like him already.
string: 好在他懂礼貌，做了自我介绍，对吧？我已经喜欢上他了。

original: And we already had the Elder Scroll you needed! Who would have thought it would be related to your prophecy too?
string: 而且我们早已拥有你需要的上古卷轴！谁会想到它也和你的预言有关呢？

original: Never thought I'd see more than one Elder Scroll in my life.
string: 从来没想过我这辈子会看到不止一部上古卷轴。

original: You're right! These things seem to have taken a liking to us. Or rather, to make our lives more complicated. Prophecies are such a hassle...
string: 你说得对！这些东西似乎很喜欢我们。或者说，让我们的生活更复杂了。预言真是麻烦……

original: We do have prophecies in common, now that you mention it.
string: 既然你提到了，我们确实都有一个预言。

original: Yeah, although your prophecy brings hope, while mine brings doom.
string: 是啊，不过你的预言带来了希望，而我的预言带来了厄运。

original: But enough about that, Let's get to business.
string: 不说这些了，让我们干正事吧。

original: You wouldn't happen to know who these "Akaviri" people that Esbern mentioned are, would you?
string: 你不会碰巧知道伊思本提到的“阿卡维尔”人是谁吧？

original: I think they're a race from another continent?
string: 我认为他们是来自另一个大陆的种族？

original: There's another continent besides Tamriel? When did our civilizations make contact with each other?
string: 除了泰姆瑞尔，还有别的大陆？我们的文明是什么时候相互接触的？

original: Nope. History isn't my strong suit. Sorry.
string: 不知道。历史不是我的强项。对不起。

original: Then I guess I'll have to ask Esbern later. He seems well versed in the subject.
string: 那我想我之后得问问伊思本了。他似乎对这些事情很精通。

original: I'm not sure. Sometime before the Second Era I think.
string: 我不确定。我想应该是第二纪元之前的某个时候。

original: Then I guess I was sleeping when that happened. I'll have to ask Esbern once we get there.
string: 那我想是我在睡觉时发生的。等我们到了那里，我得问问伊思本。

original: I think the Nerevarine went on an expedition there in the late Third Era.
string: 我想，第三纪元末期，尼瑞瓦因曾去那里探险。

original: Who? You mean the Chimer king?
string: 谁？你是说那个凯莫国王？

original: Nevermind. I'll ask Esbern when I get the chance.
string: 算了。有机会我会问问伊思本。

original: How come they caught your interest?
string: 它们怎么会引起你的兴趣？

original: Shortly after you brought me back home, I tried to mend my relationship with my father. The result... Was as depressing as you might expect.
string: 你带我回家后不久，我试图修复与父亲的关系。结果……正如你所想象的那样令人沮丧。

original: During the conversation, however, the curved blade he was carrying caught my attention. I had never seen it before, so I asked him about it.
string: 然而，在谈话过程中，他携带的弯刀引起了我的注意。我以前从未见过，所以我向他询问。

original: He told me he had gone to several auctions to buy "Akaviri artifacts" over the years. There was something captivating about their aesthetic, he said.
string: 他告诉我，这些年来他去过几个拍卖会购买“阿卡维尔文物”。他说，他们的审美有一些迷人的地方。

original: I was genuinely interested, so I asked him more about the Akaviri. Besides, it seemed like the perfect excuse to spend some quality time together.
string: 我真的很感兴趣，所以我向他询问了更多有关阿卡维尔的信息。此外，这似乎是一起度过美好时光的完美借口。

original: And that's when he told me to stop wasting his time. Even his own daughter wasn't worth sharing his hobbies with!
string: 就在那时，他告诉我不要再浪费他的时间了。连自己的女儿都不值得跟他分享爱好！

original: Don't be so hard on yourself. At least you made an effort to talk with him.
string: 别对自己太苛刻。至少你努力和他交谈了。

original: Yeah. But as usual, he was selfish with the things he possessed.
string: 是啊。但一如既往，他对自己拥有的东西总是吝啬得很。

original: Anyway, enough about family dramas. Let's get to Karthspire.
string: 总之，家庭闹剧就到此为止吧。让我们去卡斯之矛吧。

original: Oh... Dammit!
string: 哦……可恶！

original: I wonder what happened here.
string: 不知道这里发生了什么事。

original: The views up here are incredible!
string: 这里的景色美不胜收！

original: These old men should bathe. Or at least open the windows.
string: 这些老头子应该洗个澡。或者至少打开窗户。

original: So we're just assuming none of the bandits stationed here ever pillaged this tomb, right? The horn was buried here long ago. I'm just saying.
string: 那我们就假设驻扎在这里的强盗都没有掠夺过这座坟墓，对吗？号角很久以前就埋在这里了。我只是说说。

original: Ugh... And here I thought the Greybeards smelled bad. I owe them an apology.
string: 唉……我还以为灰胡子很难闻呢。我应该向他们道歉。

original: What happened to this place?
string: 这个地方发生了什么？

original: What happened to this place?
string: 这个地方发生了什么？

original: By the blood of my ancestors...!
string: 以我先人的血……！

original: By the blood of my ancestors...!
string: 以我先人的血……！

original: Don't lie. You were just randomly pressing buttons, were you?
string: 别骗我，你只是随便按了几个按钮，是吗？

original: So... What are we supposed to do here?
string: 那么……我们该怎么办？

original: You better not end up like Septimus...
string: 你最好不要像赛普蒂莫斯一样……

original: Wake up! He's here!
string: 醒醒！他来了！

original: Let's hope the Jarl is in a good mood...
string: 希望领主心情还愉快……

original: Do we really have to climb back the Throat of the World?
string: 唉...我们真的要爬回世界之喉吗？

original: Do we really need to travel to the two furthest cities in Skyrim just to deliver a message? Couriers exist for a reason, you know?
string: 我们真的需要跑到天际最远的两个城市，只为了送信吗？信使的存在是有原因的，你知道吗？

original: We're never gonna get there...
string: 我们永远到不了那里……

original: We're never gonna get there...
string: 我们永远到不了那里……

original: Ugh... Why would you even bring me here?
string: 额……你为什么要带我来这里？

original: "Sure, let's put a bar in a literal sewer".
string: “当然，咱们就把酒吧开在下水道里吧”。

original: Alright. Let's do this.
string: 好吧。我们开始吧。

original: Ha ha! Oh, that's too precious...
string: 哈哈！哦，这太有意思了……

original: This is incredible! It's like a whole other world!
string: 太不可思议了！这就像是另一个世界！

original: Nice place to raise a family.
string: 养家糊口的好地方。

original: I wonder if I could see the island if I were to climb at the top of the mountain.
string: 我很好奇，如果我爬上山顶，能否看到这座小岛。

original: Time to find some answers.
string: 是时候找到答案了。

original: Oh great...
string: 哦，太好了……

original: Not much of a plan, but it can work.
string: 这不是什么好计划，但可以行得通。

original: No one will ever know.
string: 永远不会有人知道。

original: Alright. Here goes...
string: 好吧。开始了……

original: Do you... Know what you're doing?
string: 你知道……你在干什么吗？

original: Wow! I think that's the biggest statue I've ever seen! I mean... I know I haven't seen many, but still...
string: 哇！这绝对是我见过最宏伟的雕像！虽然……我确实没见过多少，但这座真的……

original: This place stinks like wet dog.
string: 这地方臭得像只湿了的狗。

original: So the legendary mead hall of the Companions is... A boat turned upside down.
string: 因此，传说中的战友团蜜酒大厅是……一艘颠倒的船。

original: "Yeah, I wanted to build a hideout, so I decided to put a sinister door in the open. No one will suspect anything".
string: “是啊，我想建个藏身之处，所以决定在露天的地方安一扇阴险的门。没有人会怀疑什么”。

original: This place has seen better days. I should know.
string: 这地方的日子比以前好过多了。我应该知道的。

original: And I thought the Soul Cairn was creepy...
string: 我还以为灵魂石冢就够让人毛骨悚然的了……

original: Um... Hello?
string: 额……你好？

original: Do you... Know what you're doing?
string: 你知道……你在干什么吗？

original: Frea... I'm so sorry.
string: 芙瑞雅……我很抱歉。

original: Wait, they... They actually live in mushrooms?
string: 等等，他们真的住在蘑菇里？

original: Um... Does that look like a map to you?
string: 嗯……你觉得这像地图吗？

original: Ugh... I really didn't need a bath right now...
string: 额……我现在真的不需要洗澡……

original: I swear, the Dwemer didn't give the automatons a shut-down button just to screw over us.
string: 我发誓，锻莫不会只是为了耍我们，就给机器一个关闭按钮。

original: Please, let's leave. I-I don't... I can't be here.
string: 求你了，我们走吧。我……我不能待在这里。

original: I like it! Not a fan of small dorms, but it seems to have all the needs of a mage covered.
string: 我喜欢这里！虽然不太喜欢小宿舍，但看起来法师需要的东西这里都有。

original: I should have applied when I had the chance...
string: 我应该在有机会的时候申请入学的……

original: Nothing but the best for the Arch-Mage, huh?
string: 大法师就是享有最好的待遇，是吧？

original: You can't seriously be doing this right now...
string: 你不可能真这么做……

original: Smells good. What are you cooking?
string: 闻着很香。你在煮什么？

original: No one will ever know.
string: 永远不会有人知道。

original: The buying and selling of poisons is legal, right? I'd rather be sure before the apothecary thinks I'm a sociopath.
string: 买卖毒药是合法的，对吗？我得在药剂师认为我是法外狂徒之前确认一下。

original: The library looks exactly as I remembered it. I liked the old carpet better though.
string: 图书馆看起来和我记忆中的一模一样。不过我更喜欢以前的地毯。

original: Look at him go! He reallt needed the fresh air.
string: 瞧他撒欢的样子！他真得呼吸新鲜空气了。

original: The court mage has very beautiful eyes. Almost as if... Yeah, I'm gonna avoid her from now on.
string: 宫廷法师的眼睛很漂亮。几乎就像……是的，从现在起我要避开她。

original: Who makes a field laboratory in a Falmer-infested cave? I mean no disrespect, but this poor soul had it coming.
string: 谁会在有伐莫出没的山洞里建造野外实验室？我无意冒犯，但这个可怜人罪有应得。

original: Wait... Is that a dragon skull? Oh yeah, "Dragonsreach"! I get it!
string: 等一下……那是龙头骨吗？哦，对了，“龙临宫”！我懂了！

original: I wish the castle was like this palace. It's beautiful!
string: 我真希望城堡能够就像这里的宫殿一样。它太美了！

original: I thought this was a palace, not an excavation site! Seriously, they didn't even bother to add a proper ventilation system!
string: 我以为这是一座宫殿，而不是一个挖掘现场！说真的，他们甚至懒得添加适当的通风口！

original: Do you mind if we take a break here to read? I'll take your silence as a "no".
string: 你介意我们在这里休息一下看书吗？我会将你的沉默视为“不”。

original: If I ever get a room, I want it to be just like this one.
string: 如果我能订到一个房间，我希望它和这个一样。

original: The architecture is pretty and all, but... What do people do for fun here?
string: 建筑很漂亮，但是……人们在这里做什么好玩呢？

original: Okay, the city may not be as big as I expected, but the palace? Yep! You pass!
string: 好吧，这座城市可能没有我想象的那么大，但宫殿呢？没错！你通过了！

original: Even the Jarl's residence looks depressing... Reminds me of my own castle.
string: 甚至连领主的住所看起来都令人沮丧……让我想起了我自己的城堡。

original: Is there... Something interesting to do here?
string: 这里………有什么好玩的事可以做吗？

original: I'm impressed someone would want to settle in the marshes. Even the air vacitinates danger.
string: 真让人惊讶有人想在沼泽地安家。连空气里都飘着危险的气息。

original: I don't think this settlement existed when I was born. It's insane how much the world has changed.
string: 我出生时这个定居点应该还不存在。世界变化之快真是令人难以置信。

original: I'd rather not be here. Meridia is a sworn enemy of the undead. And Molag Bal. I carry a bit of the two, so...
string: 说真的我不该来这。美瑞蒂亚可是亡灵的天敌，莫拉格·巴尔也是。我身上恰好带着这两位的痕迹，所以…

original: I'd rather not be here. I may no longer be a vampire, but this temple makes me feel like I'm walking into enemy territory.
string: 说真的我不想待在这儿。虽然我已不再是吸血鬼，但这座神殿让我觉得自己正步入敌营。

original: I won't deny it's cozy, but... Don't you think this town could use a larger wall? I wouldn't feel safe living here.
string: 我不否认这里很舒适，但……你不觉得这个镇子该筑更高的城墙吗？住在这儿实在没安全感。

original: This place is gorgeous! Especially for a mine.
string: 这地方太美了！尤其还是个矿坑。

original: Really? An inn? Here?
string: 真的吗？这种地方居然有旅馆？

original: I can't believe I'm saying this, but I'll take a sunbath before having volcanic ash stuck all over my body. It'll take me forever to get it off!
string: 真不敢相信我会这么说，但我宁愿先晒个日光浴，也不想让火山灰沾满全身。那些灰根本弄不干净！

original: Is it difficult for you to be here? I don't want to imagine what the dragon attack must have been like.
string: 待在这里会让你难受吗？我简直不敢想象当初龙袭时是什么惨状。

original: There was a time I used to call Orcs "the elven Nords". In retrospective, I'm not sure I want to compare my people with theirs anymore.
string: 曾几何时，我总把兽人族称作"精灵族的诺德人"。如今回想起来，我已不愿再将我族与他们相提并论。

original: So this is the grand tour of Skyrim's caves that you're showing me?
string: 所以这就是你要带我游览的天际洞穴盛大巡礼？

original: I wonder if the Draugr are as gullible as they were when I was a girl.
string: 不知尸鬼们是否仍像我少女时代那般容易上当受骗。

original: I always wondered what the dwarves actually looked like...
string: 我一直很好奇矮人们真正的模样……

original: You're one of those stealth archer types?
string: 你是那种潜行的弓箭手类型吗？

original: Do you get to the Cloud District very often? Oh, what am I saying - of course you don't.
string: 你常去云顶区吗？哦，我在说什么呀——你当然不常去了。

original: Who in Oblivion starts a conversation like that?! I just got here!
string: 究竟有谁会这样开场白？！我才刚到这儿！

original: Yes?
string: 嗯？

original: I don't know why, but... I feel nostalgic whenever I look at Meeko. It's strange, but I like it.
string: 我不知道为什么，但……每当我看到米科，都有种怀念的感觉。这有些奇怪，但我不讨厌。

original: Meeko! Don't get too far!
string: 米科！别跑太远！

original: Most pet owners bathe their dogs, you know? Just saying.
string: 你知道吗？大多数宠物主人都会给狗洗澡。随便说说。

original: Oh.
string: 噢。

original: And now the dog's wet. Brilliant...
string: 狗湿了……绝了……

original: I wish the castle had more normal dogs like you, Meeko. CuSith and Garmr are straight up horrifying!
string: 我希望城堡里有更多像你这样的好狗狗，米科。库西斯和加莫尔简直太吓人了！

original: Um... Maybe we should keep Meeko under check. He's been drooling over the food on that table for a while now.
string: 嗯…也许我们应该看看米科。他馋桌子上那些食物很久了。

original: I know you dogs like to chew on bones, Meeko, but... Try to show some restraint with the Draugr, please.
string: 我知道狗都喜欢啃骨头，米科，但是……龙骨还是算了吧？

original: You think I can get Meeko into a bath if I bait him with a treat?
string: 你觉得如果我多喂喂米科，能让它乖乖洗澡吗？

original: I wonder what became of Saint Jiub. I met him once, you know?
string: 我想知道圣鸠步怎么样了？我见过他一面，知道吧。

original: That long?!
string: 这么久？

original: Shocking, isn't it? And then I began thinking about the story that preceded the Dragonborn Prophecy.
string: 令人震惊吧？然后我开始思考龙裔预言之前的故事。

original: These events... All these turning points in history... All of this transpired while I was sleeping.
string: 这些事件……所有这些历史转折点……这一切都是在我睡觉时发生的。

original: I just realized that I missed all of this. It's just... I don't know. It feels like a vacuum. You know what I mean?
string: 突然意识到我错过了所有这一切。就是……难以言喻。仿佛置身真空，你明白这种感觉吗？

original: I guess I hadn't really thought about the passage of time until recently. I just felt overwhelmed, is all.
string: 我想直到最近我才真正考虑过时间的流逝。我只是感到不知所措，仅此而已。

original: You know all that history is recorded in books, right?
string: 你知道所有的历史都记录在书中，对吗？

original: Yeah, I guess that makes sense. But I wouldn't even know where to start.
string: 是的，我想这也有道理。但我甚至不知道从哪里开始。

original: I could find those books for you.
string: 我可以帮你找到那些书。

original: You'd do that for me?
string: 你愿意为我这么做？

original: Tell you what. For each book that you bring me, I'll give you a special lesson on one of my specialties. You won't learn this in any modern school.
string: 这样吧，你每给我带一本书，我就教你一招我的特长。你在任何现代学校都学不到的。

original: You got a deal!
string: 成交！

original: Thanks! I'll leave it up to you.
string: 谢谢！那就拜托你了。

original: I found a book about the later decades of the Septim Empire.
string: 我找到了一本关于塞普汀帝国后期几十年的书。

original: Alright. Let's see what you have.
string: 好吧。让我们看看你拿到了什么。

original: So an emperor died in a failed conquest of Akavir, and the council took power and didn't want to give it back to the imperial family...
string: 所以一位皇帝在征服阿卡维尔的失败中死去，议会夺取了权力，却不想将其还给皇室……

original: Open revolts... Political assassinations... Falling off horses... Yadda yadda...
string: 公开叛乱……政治暗杀……坠马事故……诸如此类……

original: Oh. This is interesting. This emperor, Uriel Septim, was betrayed by his battlemage and imprisoned in a pocket dimension. I kinda relate to that.
string: 哦。这个有点意思。这位皇帝，尤瑞尔·塞普汀，被他的战斗法师背叛，并被囚禁在一个口袋空间中。我有点感同身受。

original: Then the battlemage impersonated him and ruled with the political efficiency of a mudcrab. The empire was thrown into chaos.
string: 然后这位战斗法师冒充他，以泥沼蟹般的政治效率进行统治。帝国陷入混乱。

original: Seriously, you're the Emperor's right hand man! You had all the power you wanted! What's the point of having more responsibilities, you moron?
string: 说实话，你可是皇帝的左膀右臂啊！你拥有你想要的一切力量！你这个白痴，承担更多的责任有什么意义？

original: But then a hero killed the battlemage and rescued the emperor. Considering his family's mortality record, he got off easy.
string: 但后来一位英雄杀死了战斗法师，救出了皇帝。考虑到他家族的死亡记录，他算是解脱的很轻松了。

original: I suppose this book covers the "misrule at the eight corners of the world" part of the prophecy. Thank you.
string: 我想这本书应该涵盖了预言中“暴政充斥世界八方”的部分。谢谢。

original: Now, let me teach you how to move light on your feet so that they don't see you coming.
string: 现在，让我教你如何脚步轻盈地移动，让别人看不到你接近。

original: I found a book somewhat related to the Warp in the West.
string: 我在西方找到了一本与西方扭曲有点关联的书。

original: "Somewhat"? Couldn't you find anything more specific to the subject?
string: "有点"？关于这个主题，你找不到更具体的了吗？

original: Trust me, Serana, I tried. It exists, but not in Skyrim.
string: 相信我，瑟拉娜，我试过了。它存在，但天际没有。

original: Oh well... I guess it will have to do.
string: 唉……看来只能将就了。

original: I don't think this book could be more vague if it tried. All I can take away from it is that some giant "broke a dragon" in Daggerfall.
string: 我敢说这本书要再模糊些都难了。我只能勉强读懂有个巨人在匕落“击溃了龙族”。

original: Do you know what that means?
string: 你明白这意味着什么吗？

original: I'm sorry I couldn't find anything useful.
string: 很抱歉，我找不到任何有用的信息。

original: Don't be. This isn't your fault. I can tell you searched very hard for a better book. I appreciate that.
string: 别这样。这不是你的错。我能看得出来，你很努力地想找一本更好的书。我很感激。

original: Here. I'll teach you how to make better use of your light armor. Just for the effort you put in.
string: 来，我来教你如何更好地使用你的轻甲。只为补偿你所付出的努力。

original: I found a book about the rise of the Tribunal.
string: 我找到本讲述审判席崛起的典籍。

original: "The Tribunal"? You mean the gods of Morrowind, do you? Garan told me about them.
string: “审判席”？你说的是晨风省那些神吧？加兰跟我提过他们。

original: Wait, they were originally mortals under the service of Saint Nerevar? Garan never told me this!
string: 等等，他们原本是侍奉圣者尼瑞瓦因的凡人？加兰从未提起过这段！

original: Okay, I already knew about the battle of the Red Mountain, the disappearance of the Dwemer, Nerevar's death, et cetera et cetera...
string: 红山之战、锻莫消失、尼瑞瓦因之死这些我都知道……

original: I didn't know about the heart of Lhorkan or that the Dunmer used to worship Azura though. How did the Tribunal even become gods?
string: 不过洛克汗之心和丹莫曾崇拜阿祖拉这些我确实不知情。审判席究竟如何成为神祇的？

original: Ohhh, so they betrayed their oath to Azura to never use the heart, and she gave the Dunmer their current appearance.
string: 啊，原来他们背弃了对阿祖拉的誓言，违背了永不启用心脏的约定，于是她赋予了丹莫如今的容貌。

original: Also, this Dagoth Ur guy survived and prevented the Tribunal from accessing their source of power. Why would they even leave it there?
string: 而且这个达格斯·乌尔居然幸存下来，阻断了审判席的力量源泉。他们为何不把心脏转移走呢？

original: And so, their only hope was to wait for Nerevar's reincarnation to save the Dunmer and punish the false gods.
string: 于是他们唯一的希望就是等待尼瑞瓦因转世来拯救丹莫，并惩罚这些伪神。

original: If your prophecy said "when the thrice-blessed fail" referring to the Tribunal, I can assume Nerevar came back and defeated the gods.
string: 如果你的预言所说的“当三神陨落”指向审判席，那我便可断定尼瑞瓦因确实归来击败了诸神。

original: I found a book about the Oblivion Crisis.
string: 我找到一本关于湮灭危机的书。

original: "The Oblivion Crisis"? This'll be good.
string: “湮灭危机”？这应该很有意思。

original: Emperor Uriel Septim gave his "Amulet of Kings" to a prisoner he encountered before his assassination? I wouldn't be so trusting.
string: 皇帝尤瑞尔·塞普汀把他的“诸王护符”送给了他在被刺杀前遇到的一名囚犯？我不会那么信任别人。

original: Oh, this was the work of a Daedric Cult? Of Mehrunes Dagon of all princes? And here I thought subtlety was beneath him.
string: 哦，这是迪德拉邪教的杰作？梅鲁涅斯·大衮？我还以为他不屑于用计谋呢。

original: At least the prisoner obeyed the Emperor and found Martin, his secret son. He also closed a few Oblivion Gates by himself. Not bad.
string: 至少囚犯遵守了了跟皇帝约定，找到了他的秘密儿子马丁。他还独自关闭了几扇湮灭之门。干得还不错。

original: Here it says that Dagon actually made it into Tamriel before Martin could light the dragonfires. How did they manage to expel him?
string: 这里说，在马丁点燃龙火之前，大衮实际上已经进入了泰姆瑞尔。他们是怎么把他驱逐出去的？

original: Oh. I see. Martin sacrificed himself by shattering the Amulet and became an aspect of Akatosh to banish Dagon. Poor man.
string: 哦，我明白了。马丁牺牲了自己，打碎了护符，成为了阿卡托什的化身，来驱逐大衮。真是个可怜的家伙。

original: Someone willing to die to save the world would have made an excellent Emperor. I'm almost sorry I never got to meet him.
string: 一个愿意为拯救世界而死的人本来能成为一位优秀的皇帝。我都有点遗憾没见过他了。

original: Even the prisoner became a hero in his own right. And unlike someone I know, he was just a regular mortal. With no divine powers.
string: 就连那个囚犯也凭自身成为了英雄。不像我认识的某位，他不过是个普通凡人。毫无神力可言。

original: What's that supposed to mean?
string: 这话是什么意思？

original: I'm just saying. How far would you go without your shouting?
string: 我只是说说而已。如果没有龙吼，你能走多远？

original: Oh, don't look at me like that, I'm just kidding! Your abilities more than make up for your powers.
string: 哎，别用那种眼神看我，开个玩笑啦！你的能力远远不止你的龙吼啦。

original: Speaking of which, I think you earned a few swordplay lessons. You'll make a much better use of your blade when we're done. Trust me.
string: 说来正好，我觉得该教你几招剑术了。等我教你之后，你就能更好地驾驭这把剑了。相信我。

original: You want me to find any more books for you?
string: 要我再帮你找几本书吗？

original: No, I'm good. I think I have enough information about the latest events for now. If I want a specific book, I'll know where to look for it.
string: 不用来，我很好。关于最近的事件，我想我现在已经掌握了足够的信息。如果我想要某本书，我知道该去哪里找。

original: Besides, I ran out of lessons to teach, so I don't think I have anything else to trade for your help. I'd say our business is concluded.
string: 另外，我已经没有东西可以教你了，所以我想我没有什么能来交换你的帮助了。要我说我们的交易已经结束了。

original: I'm glad I was helpful.
string: 很高兴我能帮上忙。

original: You know what? I want to give you something else. You probably had to spend money on these books, after all.
string: 你知道吗？我想给你一些别的东西。毕竟，你可能不得在这些书上花了钱。

original: I have this ring my father crafted for me when I was born. It's antiquity at this point, so... It should cost a fortune.
string: 这枚戒指，是我出生时父亲为我制作的。现在已经是个古董了，所以……应该值不少钱。

original: And you're giving it to me? Are you sure?
string: 你要把它给我？你确定？

original: Yeah. With all that's happened lately, looking at it feels more like a burden than a memento. I've been wanting to get rid of it for a while now.
string: 是啊。最近发生了这么多事，看着它更像是一种负担，而不是纪念。我已经有一阵子想把它扔掉了。

original: You can gain a great sum of gold if you sell it. Or you can wear it. Or give it to a friend. I don't care anymore.
string: 如果卖掉它，你可以获得一大笔金币。或者你可以戴着它，或者送给朋友。我已经不在乎了。

original: I'm going to focus on the future instead of looking back. All I've read has taught me that the world will keep moving on, with or without me.
string: 我要着眼于未来，而不是回顾过去。我所读到的一切告诉我，无论有没有我，世界都将继续前进。

original: And I for one am not gonna stay behind anymore. So take this darn thing already, and let's make some more stories.
string: 我可不想再沉溺于过去了。那就把这该死的东西拿走吧，让我们一同创造新的故事。

original: Everything you do just has to do with dungeon delving, does it? You may as well be the "Dwemerborn".
string: 你做的每件事都和地牢探险有关，对吧？你简直就是“锻莫裔”了。

original: Now, I can't claim to understand most of his hogwash, but he did mention Blackreach. You know what that is?
string: 说实话，他那些胡言乱语我大多没听懂，不过他确实提到了黑境。你知道那是什么地方吗？

original: Yeah, he said something like a Dwemer city or something?
string: 是啊，他说过什么锻莫城市之类的？

original: It's more than just a city. It's an entire underground cavity with its very own ecosystem. Property of the Dwemer, of course.
string: 它不仅仅是一座城市。它是一个拥有自己生态系统的地下洞穴。锻莫的手笔，当然。

original: Please explain! He's driving me crazy!
string: 请解释一下！他快把我逼疯了！

original: Don't worry. I got you covered.
string: 别担心，我来帮你解释。

original: Blackreach is a massive layer below Skyrim's soil. Think of it as an underground bubble, with its own ecosystem and everything.
string: 黑境是天际地下的一个巨大地层。把它想象成一个地下气泡，拥有自己的生态系统和一切。

original: Yeah, I read all about it in "The Falmer: a Study".
string: 是的，我在《伐莫研究报告》中读到了这一切。

original: Look at you, all literate.
string: 看看你，一个小学究。

original: I guess I don't need to tell you anything about it, then.
string: 那我想我就没必要给你讲了。

original: Have you been there?
string: 你去过那里吗？

original: I wish. I only heard stories of that place.
string: 我倒想去。我只听说过那个地方的故事。

original: Sadly, Blackreach was the territory of other Vampire clans, so venturing there would have been a declaration of war.
string: 遗憾的是，黑境是其他吸血鬼部族的领地，因此冒险前往那里就等于宣战。

original: However, when I asked the court when you brought me back home, they told me that they had been dealt with long ago. It should be safe now.
string: 但是，当你带我回家时我问过宫廷里的人，他们告诉我，那些人早就被处理掉了。现在应该安全了。

original: So in case you didn't get the hint, I want to go with you. You know I'm not a fan of caves, but Blackreach must be truly something to behold.
string: 以免你没明白我的意思，我想和你一起去。你知道我不喜欢洞穴，但黑境一定很壮观。

original: Incredible... Simply incredible!
string: 难以置信……简直难以置信!

original: I know. It's beautiful too!
string: 我知道。它也很美！

original: I'm glad we're on the same page here.
string: 我很高兴我们在这件事上意见一致。

original: It's kind of tragic that the Falmer can't appreciate its beauty because of their blindness.
string: 伐莫因为眼瞎而无法欣赏它的美，这真是一种悲哀。

original: It's kind of terrifying, to be honest.
string: 说实话，这有点可怕。

original: Pfft! Only if you're afraid of the dark.
string: 噗！除非你怕黑。

original: Though... I guess you can't appreciate its beauty if everything down here wants to kill you.
string: 不过……我想如果这里的一切都想杀了你，你就无法欣赏它的美了。

original: Not that the surface is any different in that regard.
string: 在这方面，地表也并没有什么不同。

original: Did this place meet your expectations?
string: 这里符合你的期望吗？

original: Absolutely! No wonder the Nighthollow Clan was based here.
string: 必须的！难怪夜空氏族会在这里生活。

original: It's exotic, well hidden, and best of all: no sunlight!
string: 它充满异国情调，隐蔽性好，最重要的是：没有阳光！

original: Though the ambience is too humid for my taste.
string: 虽然对我来说这环境太潮湿了。

original: All caves are, Serana. You should know.
string: 所有洞穴都这样，瑟拉娜。你应该知道的。

original: Yeah. Very funny.
string: 是啊。非常有趣。

original: Is there any weather in Nirn that suits your delicate taste, princess?
string: 整个奈恩有任何天气适合你的精致品味吗，公主？

original: Oh, shut up.
string: 哦，闭嘴。

original: How in Oblivion did he get up?! We had him on his knees!
string: 他究竟怎么站起来的？我们明明把他打跪下了！

original: I think he was serious when he said he couldn't be slain here.
string: 当他说他不能在这里被杀时，我觉得他是认真的。

original: I guess that's the firstborn of Akatosh for you. Makes sense he'd be far beyond any dragon we encountered.
string: 毕竟这可是阿卡托什的长子。难怪他比我们遭遇过的任何巨龙都要强大得多。

original: If I remember this right, a "ghost" of Alduin was summoned to threaten the reign of Ysmir Wulfharth during the sixth century.
string: 如果我没记错的话，在第六世纪，奥杜因的一个“鬼魂”被召唤来威胁“伊斯米尔”武夫哈斯的统治。

original: Eventually he was defeated by Shor's own ghost in Sovngarde. Maybe that's the only place he can be killed.
string: 最后，他在松加德被舒尔自己的鬼魂打败了。也许只有在那里才能杀死他。

original: I don't know how credible my source is, though. It's from a legend from a thousand years ago.
string: 我其实不太确定这个消息的可信度。毕竟是千年前的古老传说。

original: Just "a thousand"? Try four thousand!
string: 才“一千”年？少说也有四千年！

original: Right...
string: 好吧……

original: Anyway, I don't think I can be of much help to you in this matter. Sorry.
string: 总之，在这件事上，我想我帮不上什么忙。对不起。

original: You heard the old man. Get yourself a seat. You got this!
string: 你听到那个老头说的了。自己找个位子坐下。你能做到的！

original: Any advice?
string: 有什么建议吗？

original: Sorry to disappoint, but we nobles don't necessarily make good politicians. Just look at my father.
string: 抱歉让你失望了，我们贵族不一定能成为优秀的政治家。看看我的父亲。

original: Honestly, I'd say use your new authority as you see fit. You won't get another chance to be the most powerful man in Skyrim.
string: 老实说，我想说的是，你要好好使用你的新权力。你不会有另一个机会成为天际最有权威的人了。

original: Sorry to disappoint, but we nobles don't necessarily make good politicians. Just look at my father.
string: 抱歉让你失望了，我们贵族不一定能成为优秀的政治家。看看我的父亲。

original: Honestly, I'd say use your new authority as you see fit. You won't get another chance to be the most powerful woman in Skyrim.
string: 老实说，我想说的是，你要好好使用你的新权力。你不会有另一个机会成为天际最有权威的女人了。

original: What if I leave one side dissatisfied?
string: 如果有一方不满意怎么办？

original: I hate to break it to you, but you're not going to make everyone happy. So just focus on picking out who gets the short end of the stick.
string: 我也不想这么告诉你，但你无法让每个人都高兴。因此，只需专注挑一个吃亏的人。

original: Now don't keep them waiting. You got this!
string: 别让他们久等了。你能行的！

original: So how did the weight of Skyrim's politics feel on your shoulders?
string: 那么，天际政治的重担落在你肩上有何感受？

original: This was the most stressful day in my life.
string: 这是我一生中压力最大的一天。

original: So I thought. Did the pressure make you sweat?
string: 我想也是，压力让你出汗了吗？

original: Because if it did, you should probably bathe.
string: 因为如果是这样，你也许应该洗个澡。

original: Now let's capture ourselves a Dragon.
string: 现在，让去抓条龙吧。

original: Pulling strings feels good, honestly.
string: 说实话，操控事件的感觉很好。

original: I could tell. You barely tried to be impartial.
string: 我看得出来。你几乎没有尝试做到公正。

original: I would have handled it differently in your shoes, but I'd say you did a decent job.
string: 如果我是你，处理方式会有所不同，但我认为你做得很好。

original: Now let's capture ourselves a Dragon.
string: 现在，让去抓条龙吧。

original: What do you think I should do about Paarthurnax?
string: 你认为我应该对帕图纳克斯做什么？

original: Honestly... I don't know. You've been put in a very difficult position.
string: 老实说……我也不知道。你处在一个很艰难的处境。

original: I can't say Delphine's arguments are sound, but there's a chance she's right, even if it's for different reasons.
string: 我不能说戴尔芬的论点是正确的，但她也许是对的，即使是出于不同的理由。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你什么意思？

original: Well... I like Paarthurnax, and I appreciate his wisdom. He's proven to be an invaluable ally.
string: 嗯……我喜欢帕图纳克斯，也欣赏他的智慧，事实证明，他是个宝贵的盟友。

original: However... What if it's all just an act? What if he only sided with us to further his own agenda?
string: 然而……如果这只是一场戏呢？如果他站在我们这边只是为了达到自己的目的呢？

original: And let's not forget you're the only being in all Tamriel who can permanently kill a dragon. He may have been waiting for someone like you.
string: 别忘了，你是泰姆瑞尔唯一能永远杀死龙的人。他可能一直在等你这样的人。

original: What if he needed you to kill Alduin so that he could become the new Dragon overlord? And who knows what he'll do once you pass away?
string: 如果他需要你杀死奥杜因，这样他就能成为新的龙族霸主呢？谁知道你死后他会做什么？

original: Look, I... I don't want you to suspect him. Even I don't believe what I'm saying, but no one can really know what someone's truly thinking.
string: 听着，我……我不想让你怀疑他。连我自己都不相信我说的话，但没人能知道一个人的真实想法。

original: I believe you should confront him directly. See what he has to say for himself.
string: 我认为你应该直接跟他对峙。看看他自己怎么说。

original: And then, whatever choice you make, I'll support you.
string: 然后，无论你做出什么选择，我都会支持你。

original: So... You went through with it after all.
string: 所以……你还是做了。

original: I don't know what consequences this will bring in the near future, but I think you made the right choice here.
string: 我不知道这在不久的将来会带来什么后果，但我认为你在这里做出了正确的选择。

original: It had to be done.
string: 必须这样做。

original: Good. It's probably best if you don't have any regrets about it. I'm glad you actually thought this through.
string: 很好。你最好不要后悔。我很高兴你真的考虑清楚了。

original: It's likely the Greybeards already know what happened here. We should... I don't want to imagine how they'll react once we pass by.
string: 灰胡子很可能已经知道这里发生的事了。我们应该……我不想想象我们过去之，他们会有什么反应。

original: I hope this was worth it...
string: 希望这一切都是值得的……

original: He didn't fight back when I attacked him! What have I done?!
string: 我攻击他时，他没有还手！我做了什么？

original: Don't!
string: 不要！

original: What's done is done. Don't torture yourself with regrets. It will only make things worse.
string: 过去的就过去了。不要用遗憾折磨自己。它只会让事情变得更糟。

original: You made your choice. And I helped you go through with it.
string: 你做出了你的选择。我帮助你完成了这一切。

original: Now we have to live with it.
string: 现在我们必须带着这一切活下去。

original: I guess you'll be leaving now, won't you?
string: 我猜你现在就要走了，是吗？

original: Are you worried?
string: 你担心吗？

original: Well... Yeah, I mean, you're going to fight Alduin where he's at his most powerful. Your previous clash might pale in comparison.
string: 嗯……是的，我的意思是，你将在奥杜因最强大的时候与他战斗。相比之下，你们之前的冲突可能会显得微不足道。

original: But what worries me the most is this place the Dragon mentioned. Skuldafn.
string: 但最让我担心的是那头龙提到的这个地方，斯库达芬。

original: If that's the gateway between our world and Sovngarde, then there's a chance Alduin has it heavily guarded.
string: 如果那是我们的世界和松加德之间的通道，那奥杜因很有可能对它严加防守。

original: Even if you manage to fight your way to the gate, you'll be exhausted once you cross it. Alduin may have an edge if you fight him in that state.
string: 即使你能杀到门口，一旦跨过大门，你也会筋疲力尽。如果你在那种状态下与奥杜因战斗，他可能会占据优势。

original: What do you propose I do?
string: 你建议我怎么做？

original: Well, if you die in battle you'll go to Sovngarde anyway, so there's your plan B.
string: 好吧，如果你战死了，无论如何你都会去松加德，所以这就是你的B计划。

original: Why do I even ask?
string: 我为什么要问来着？

original: Aw, come now, you know I'm just kidding!
string: 噢，别这样，你知道我只是在开玩笑！

original: To be fair, you've pushed through anything the world has thrown at you, so maybe I'm just needlessly worried.
string: 平心而论，你已经克服了世界上任何困难，所以也许我只是杞人忧天。

original: Though I would be less worried about you if I could come along, assuming it's possible.
string: 不过，如果我能一起去，我就不会那么担心你了，前提是有可能的话。

original: Look, I'll leave it up to you. If you want to do this alone, then I'll wait for you to return.
string: 听着，我让你自己决定。如果你想一个人去，那我就等你回来。

original: And if you find a way to bring me with you, then we'll face the World-Eater together.
string: 如果你找到方法带我一起去，我们就能一起面对世界吞噬者。

original: Either way, I know you'll be victorious in the end.
string: 不管怎样，我知道你最终会取得胜利。

original: Thank you for bringing me along. I'll feel better now that I can help you fight your way through.
string: 谢谢你带我一起来。现在我可以帮你一起战斗了，我感觉好得多。

original: You're the one who wanted to tag along.
string: 是你想跟着我的。

original: Obviously. Someone's gotta watch your back.
string: 那当然，总得有人替你盯着背后。

original: Come on! We can do this.
string: 加把劲！我们能行的。

original: There's no way I'm letting you miss the showdown!
string: 我不会让你错过这场对决的！

original: Me neither! The more the merrier, am I right?
string: 我也不会！人手越多越好，不是吗？

original: Come on! We can do this!
string: 加把劲！我们能行的！

original: I don't think I could do this without you.
string: 要是没有你，我想我做不到。

original: Aww... Do you want me to hold your hand too?
string: 噢……你想让我握住你的手吗？

original: Ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈！

original: Come on! We can do this!
string: 加把劲！我们能行的！

original: We did it... We... We actually won!
string: 我们做到了…我们…我们真的赢了！

original: Is it really you? I can't believe it!
string: 真的是你吗？不敢相信！

original: I couldn't have done it without you.
string: 没有你，我做不到。

original: Oh, shut up. We both know you did the heavy lifting back there.
string: 哦，闭嘴吧。我们都知道刚才的重活都是你干的。

original: Really, I don't think we won just because you had prophecy on your side. This was the result of your choice to step in when no one else could.
string: 说真的，我觉得我们能赢并非只因预言眷顾你。而是当无人能挺身而出时，你选择了干预。

original: You gave our world another chance! And you did it of your own free will!
string: 你给了我们的世界另一次机会！这是出于你的自由意志！

original: Did I worry you?
string: 我让你担心了吗？

original: Yeah! I was afraid something might have gone wrong and I couldn't do anything to prevent it! I felt so powerless...
string: 是的，我担心会出什么差错，而我却无能为力。我感到很无力……

original: I guess I underestimated you. You were more than ready to fight for our future! And that merit is yours. Not the prophecy's.
string: 看来我低估你了。你早已准备好为我们共同的未来而战！这份荣耀属于你，而非预言。

original: Nobody forced you to go there and face Alduin. You did this on your own volition. For all of us!
string: 没有人强迫你去那里面对奥杜因。你是自愿这么做的。为了我们所有人！

original: You actually doubted I could do it? Gee, thanks!
string: 你真的觉得我做不到吗？我可真是谢谢你了！

original: Hey, I was worried, you know? I haven't heard from you in almost a day!
string: 嘿，我很担心，你知道吗？我都快一天没你的消息了

original: I guess I underestimated you. You were more than ready to fight for our future, and that merit is yours. Not the prophecy's.
string: 看来我低估你了。你早已准备好为我们共同的未来而战！这份荣耀属于你，而非预言。

original: Nobody forced you to go there and face Alduin. You did this on your own volition. For all of us!
string: 没有人强迫你去那里面对奥杜因。你是自愿这么做的。为了我们所有人！

original: I didn't absorb Alduin's soul though.
string: 但我没有吸收奥杜因的灵魂。

original: You didn't? That's strange.
string: 你没有？真奇怪。

original: Unless...
string: 除非……

original: Go on.
string: 继续。

original: Well, some cultures consider Akatosh and Alduin opposite aspects of the God of Time. The former represents the beginning, and the latter the end.
string: 有些文化认为阿卡托什和奥杜因是时间之神的对立面。前者代表开始，后者代表结束。

original: Maybe your purpose wasn't actually to kill him, but rather to destroy his physical form so that his essence could return to the Dragon God of Time.
string: 也许你的目的并不是真杀死他，而是要毁掉他的物理存在，让他的精华回到时间龙神那里。

original: Which might mean that the world wasn't meant to end today, but that doesn't mean that it will last forever.
string: 这可能意味着世界本不应该在今天终结，但这并不意味着它将永远持续下去。

original: Wouldn't that make our victory pointless?
string: 这样一来，我们的胜利岂不是毫无意义？

original: No! That's not what I meant!
string: 不，我不是这个意思！

original: Look. Everything is meant to end at some point. It's the nature of our universe.
string: 你看，万物都有终结的时候。这是我们宇宙的本质。

original: Anything that lasts too much ends up decaying. What made it once beautiful withers away, and it becomes nothing but a colorless husk.
string: 任何事物，如果经过太长时间，最终都会腐朽。它曾经的美丽逐渐凋零，只剩下一具无色的躯壳。

original: And I think that's the point of the end times. Of Alduin's existence. To remind us of that inevitability.
string: 我认为这就是终末的意义所在。奥杜因的存在提醒我们这种必然性。

original: One day, our world will crumble on itself, and Alduin will come to end it so that Akatosh can create a new one in its place.
string: 总有一天，我们的世界会自我毁灭，奥杜因会来终结它，这样阿卡托什就能在它的位置上创造一个新的世界。

original: But that day obviously isn't today, and certainly not the days of the Merethic Era.
string: 但那一天显然不是今天，也不是精灵纪元的任何一天。

original: Alduin wasn't meant to end the world just yet. Our will to keep on living and courage to fight him are proof of it.
