string: 奥杜因本不应该在今天终结世界。我们继续活下去的意志和与他战斗的勇气就是最好的证明。

original: Even so... Must we live in fear of the end?
string: 即便如此…… 我们必须生活在对末日的恐惧中吗？

original: It's natural to fear it, but obsessing over it will blind you to what life can offer you.
string: 害怕它是很自然的，但纠结于它会让你看不到生活能给你带来什么。

original: Me and my family... We were like that. But the time I spent with you has helped me realize something I forgot long ago:
string: 我和我的家人……我们都是这样。但和你在一起的日子，让我明白了一些我早已忘记的事：

original: The beauty of life doesn't lie in its duration. It's our path. Our choices. Our actions. All those define our worth.
string: 生命之美不在于它能持续多久。而是我们的道路，我们的选择，我们的行动，是这一切决定了我们的价值。

original: It's true that more often than not, we don't have as much time as we wished we had.
string: 确实，我们常常没有像我们希望的那样，有那么多时间。

original: Life doesn't warn us when our time comes, and one way or another, we're going to get hurt.
string: 生活不会在我们的时刻到来时警告我们，但无论如何，我们都会受到伤害。

original: But as long as we don't obsess over it, and focus on what truly brings us joy from time to time, we can still live fulfilling lives.
string: 但只要我们不纠结于此，经常关注真正能给我们带来快乐的事情，我们仍然可以过上充实的生活。

original: With that being said, why are we standing around here? Come on, let's go out there and make some more stories!
string: 话虽如此，我们为什么还站在这里？来吧，让我们一同创造新的故事！

original: Are you alright? What does that note say?
string: 你还好吗？纸条上写了什么？

original: Someone named Miraak sent them. Look.
string: 一个叫米拉克的人送来的，你看。

original: Okay? And what does that tell us?
string: 好吧？这上面说了什么？

original: Not much, but they claim I'm a false Dragonborn.
string: 不多，但他们说我是假龙裔。

original: Oh, I get it. This Miraak is probably just some clown who gained fame by pretending to be a Dragonborn, until you came along and ruined his circus!
string: 哦，我明白了。这个米拉克可能只是一个通过冒充龙裔而出名的小丑，直到你出现并毁掉了他的马戏团！

original: He's probably going to keep sending assassins until you turn out dead, so it may be best if we deal with him as soon as possible.
string: 他可能会一直派刺客来，直到你死为止，所以我们最好尽快解决他。

original: Worst case scenario, he's a conjurer with a couple of deadly spells in his arsenal. Nothing we can't handle.
string: 最坏的情况是，他是个召唤法师，他有几个致命的法术。没有什么是我们对付不了的。

original: If I didn't know you any better, I'd say you were excited about it.
string: 如果我不了解你，我会说你对此很兴奋。

original: I mean... I've never been to Solstheim. Why wouldn't I?
string: 我的意思是……我从来没有去过索瑟海姆。我为什么不呢？

original: I know we have to beat this Miraak guy, but... I mean, come on! Surely we can find some time to explore, can we?
string: 我知道我们必须打败这个叫米拉克的家伙，但是……我是说，拜托！我们肯定能找到时间去探险的，不是吗？

original: This is quite the contrast when compared to Skyrim. I don't know how to describe it, but it's... Exotic. I guess that's what makes it so appealing.
string: 与天际形成了鲜明的对比。我不知道该如何形容，但它……异域风情。我想这就是它如此吸引人的原因。

original: I read a lot about Morrowind's vegetation on our way here. If the Dunmer migrated here, then maybe they brought some of their plants with them.
string: 我在来这里的路上读了很多关于晨风的资料。如果丹莫迁徙到了这里，那么他们可能会带来一些他们的植物。

original: And I just happen to be an alchemy enthusiast!
string: 而我恰好是一名炼金术爱好者！

original: We're just here to deal with Miraak, understand?
string: 我们只是来对付米拉克的，明白吗?

original: Yeah, yeah, I know. But I'm not passing up this opportunity. This is my first time outside Skyrim.
string: 是啊，是啊，我知道。但我不会放弃这次机会的。这是我第一次走出天际。

original: After we're done with Miraak I'll let you do some sightseeing.
string: 等我们处理完米拉克的事，我就让你去观光吧。

original: Have I told you how much I adore you?
string: 我告诉过你我有多喜欢你吗？

original: Don't worry. I'm sure both of us will end up enjoying the experience. Let's deal with our clown, and then the fun begins!
string: 别担心，我相信我们俩都会享受这次经历的。我们先对付我们的小丑，然后乐趣就要开始了!

original: Look at these people. They have been completely stripped of their will.
string: 看看这些人。他们被完全剥夺了意志。

original: They remind me of the thralls vampires usually feed on. Except... On a massive scale.
string: 他们让我想起了吸血鬼平时吸食的奴隶。除了……规模更大。

original: I don't think he's the clown you thought he was.
string: 我不认为他是你想象中的小丑。

original: He will be by the time we're done with him, believe me.
string: 等我们搞定他的时候，他就是了，相信我。

original: That idiot sent his own cultists after you instead of hiring actual assassins. His sloppy execution makes it clear he's not very smart.
string: 那个白痴派自己的邪教徒来追杀你，而不是雇佣真正的刺客。他草率的行动让人觉得他并不聪明。

original: Raw power can only get you so far if you don't use your head. We just need to find a weakness to exploit once we fight him.
string: 如果不使用头脑，单纯的力量只能让你走这么远。当我们与他战斗时，我们只需要找到一个可以利用的弱点即可。

original: Are you alright?! That book is Daedric! Leave it where it was!
string: 你没事吧？那本书是迪德拉的！把它留在原地！

original: Never mind that! Miraak is a real Dragonborn!
string: 别管这个了！米拉克是真正的龙裔！

original: Wait... What? You saw him use a Dragon Shout?!
string: 等等……什么？你看到他使用龙吼了？！

original: But you don't have to be a Dragonborn in order to learn how to use them! He has to be a faker!
string: 但你不必成为龙裔才能学习如何使用它们！他一定是个假冒的！

original: I could feel he had the soul of a Dragon like me! He's the real deal!
string: 我能感觉到他和我一样拥有龙魂！他是个真货！

original: But that doesn't make any sense! Why would Akatosh create two Dragonborns in the same era?!
string: 但这根本说不通！为什么阿卡托什要在同一个时代创造两个龙裔？！

original: Wait, if he had the assistance of a Daedric Prince from that book, then maybe he found a way to extend his lifespan!
string: 等等，如果他从那本书中得到了迪德拉君王的帮助，那么也许他找到了延长寿命的方法。

original: It's okay, Serana. We'll find a way to beat him.
string: 没事的，瑟拉娜。我们会找到办法打败他的。

original: Yeah. I'm just angry at myself for not taking this seriously.
string: 是的。我只是对自己生气，因为我没有认真对待这件事。

original: Anyway, let's follow Frea. She can help us figure out what to do next.
string: 无论如何，让我们跟随芙瑞雅吧。她可以帮助我们弄清楚下一步该做什么。

original: You should take this more seriously from now on.
string: 从现在起，你应该更加认真地对待这件事。

original: I know. I'm sorry I let my enthusiasm get the better of me.
string: 我知道。对不起，我让自己的热情冲昏了头脑。

original: Anyway, let's follow Frea. She can help us figure out what to do next.
string: 无论如何，让我们跟随芙瑞雅吧。她可以帮助我们弄清楚下一步该做什么。

original: You think we're dealing with a Vampire here?
string: 你以为我们在和吸血鬼打交道？

original: There's a chance he may be, but I don't think he's exactly a mastermind to be reckoned with.
string: 他有可能是，但我不认为他是一个不可忽视的策划大师。

original: That idiot sent his own cultists after you instead of hiring actual assassins. His sloppy execution makes it clear he's not very smart.
string: 那个白痴派自己的邪教徒来追杀你，而不是雇佣真正的刺客。他草率的行动让人觉得他并不聪明。

original: Raw power can only get you so far if you don't use your head. We just need to find a weakness to exploit once we fight him.
string: 如果不使用头脑，单纯的力量只能让你走这么远。当我们与他战斗时，我们只需要找到一个可以利用的弱点即可。

original: He also had a Dragon under his command. The mass mind control must be his doing!
string: 他还命令着一条龙。这大规模精神控制肯定是他干的！

original: Are you... Are you sure? Can a mortal really be that powerful?
string: 你……你确定吗？凡人真的可以有这么强大的力量吗？

original: This is worse than I imagined! I take back what I said about the book. Keep it! It may give us some clues about the source of his power!
string: 这比我想象的还要糟糕！我收回我对这本书所说的话。带着它！或许可以给我们一些关于他力量来源的线索！

original: I'm starting to think he wanted you to come. No wonder he sent his cultists with such an obvious clue of his whereabouts.
string: 我开始认为他希望你来了。难怪他送他的信徒们带着如此明显的关于他行踪的线索来。

original: So much for my clown theory... I came here hoping for a vacation and you almost got killed for it!
string: 我的小丑理论就到此为止了……我本来是想来度假的，而你却差点因此丧命！

original: Okay, so everyone keeps saying that Miraak has been dead for millennia and his return is impossible, right?
string: 好吧，大家都说米拉克已经死了几千年，不可能再回来了，对吧？

original: Have you thought that maybe the guy we're looking for is just someone else using his name?
string: 你有没有想过，也许我们要找的那个人只是冒用了他的名字？

original: Maybe so, but how does he control the minds of so many people?
string: 也许是这样，但他是如何控制这么多人的思想的呢？

original: Simple. It's not his power. Something of this magnitude must have been done by an artifact. No mortal, no matter how powerful, could pull this off.
string: 很简单，这不是他的能力。这么大的事一定是神器干的。无论多么强大的凡人都做不到。

original: We're dealing with a Daedra worshiper. At worst. As soon as we get this artifact from him, his whole circus will crumble on itself.
string: 我们要对付的是一个迪德拉信徒。这就是最坏的情况，只要我们从他那里拿到这件神器，他的整个马戏团就会土崩瓦解。

original: I'm not so sure. I can't quite put my finger at it, but I sense...
string: 我不太确定。很难确切形容，但我感觉到……

original: I'm telling you, you're overthinking it!
string: 我告诉你，你想多了！

original: Come on. The sooner we end this, the sooner we'll leave this cave.
string: 走吧。越早结束这一切，我们就能越早离开这个山洞。

original: You got the word? Good, let's hurry back and help those villagers!
string: 你得到那个力量之语了吗？好，我们赶紧回去帮助那些村民吧！

original: Calm down! You're... Oddly anxious.
string: 冷静点！你在……异常的焦虑。

original: Yeah, I... Sorry. I guess I'm still angry at myself for having been so casual about all this.
string: 是的，我……抱歉。我想我还在生自己的气，因为我对这一切如此漫不经心。

original: Some assassins showed up to kill you, and all I could think about is going on a trip!
string: 明明有刺客要来杀你，而我居然还想着去旅行！

original: And when I saw the Skaal village so afflicted by these events I... I began to think I had regressed to my former self!
string: 当我看到斯卡尔村被这些事件折磨得如此痛苦时，我……我开始想起了以前的自己！

original: What do you mean?
string: 你什么意思？

original: You remember how me and my family used to worship Molag Bal, do you? In exchange for our service, he granted us immortality.
string: 你还记得我和我的家人曾经多么崇拜莫拉格·巴尔吗？作为交换条件，他赐予我们永生。

original: Well, most of that service included... Sacrifices. Cruelty. In order to earn his favor we had to prove our commitment to his sadistic practices.
string: 其实那种侍奉大多包含……献祭与暴行。为赢得他的青睐，我们必须证明自己对他施虐仪式的绝对忠诚。

original: It was purely transactional. As such, we never reflected on the weight of our actions, and turned a blind eye to the suffering of our victims.
string: 这纯粹是场交易。正因如此，我们从未反思过自身行为的代价，对受害者的苦难视而不见。

original: I was completely apathetic during my early life, and I ignored the suffering of the people around me. I thought I had stopped being like that, but...
string: 在我以前的生活中，我完全麻木不仁，对周围人的痛苦视而不见。我以为我已经不再这样了，但……

original: Today, I didn't stop to think if the Dunmer from Raven Rock were suffering while under mind control. All I cared about was my "vacation" here.
string: 今天，我没有停下来思考鸦石镇的丹莫在被精神控制时是否在受苦。我只关心我在这里的“假期”。

original: I know I may be overreacting, but I feel ashamed of acting the way I did. I should be better than this!
string: 我知道我可能反应过度，但我为自己的行为感到羞愧。我应该做得更好！

original: For what it's worth, you have shown a lot of empathy since we met.
string: 不管怎么说，自从我们见面以来，你表现出了很多同情心。

original: Yeah. I had a lot of time to reflect on myself and the things I did. I wanted to become a better person.
string: 是的。我有很多时间反思自己和我所做的事情。我想成为一个更好的人。

original: And... Thank you for saying that, instead of judging me.
string: 而且……谢谢你这么说，而不是评判我。

original: Come on. We have a stone to...
string: 走吧。我们还有一块石头要……

original: Shout at?
string: 吼它？

original: Forget I said that. Please.
string: 忘了我说过的话吧。拜托了。

original: Still... I can't believe you did those things.
string: 不过……我还是不敢相信你做了那些事。

original: I guess I wasn't that different from my father in that sense, was I?
string: 我想从这个意义上来说我和我父亲并没有什么不同，不是吗？

original: But I've changed! I looked at myself in the mirror and decided to be better. To make the effort of being more selfless.
string: 但我变了！我看着镜子里的自己，决定变得更好。努力做到更加无私。

original: And trust me. Acknowledging how far you've fallen takes much more courage than you think. It wasn't easy.
string: 相信我。承认自己已经堕落了多远，需要的勇气比你想象的要大得多。这并不容易。

original: Anyway, enough about me. The Skaal need our help.
string: 无论如何，不要再说我的事了。斯卡尔需要我们的帮助。

original: Where did that thing come from?!
string: 那东西是从哪里来的？！

original: Um... From the water?
string: 嗯……从水里？

original: Oh yeah! A ten-feet colossus was just lying in a pool that isn't even knee-deep!
string: 哦，对啊！一个四尺高的庞然大物躺在一个不到膝盖深的水池里！

original: Come on, you can't seriously believe it was there all along! It must have been summoned here!
string: 拜托，你不会真的相信它一直都在那里吧？它一定是被召唤来的！

original: It must have been a warden placed here to protect the stone.
string: 一定是有看守放在这里保护这块石头的。

original: I don't think it was just "placed" there. Something tells me it was summoned as soon as the stone was compromised.
string: 我不认为它是被“放”在那里的。直觉告诉我，石头一被破坏，它就被召唤出来了。

original: It's a good thing it reacted too late to interfere. At least the locals had enough time to evacuate.
string: 幸好它反应得太晚，无法干涉。至少当地人有足够的时间撤离。

original: It reminded me of one of the creatures that was with Miraak when I saw him.
string: 这让我想起了当我看到米拉克时，他身边的一个生物。

original: I should have guessed as much.
string: 我早该猜到的。

original: If we connect this creature to the book we found in the temple, I guess it's safe to assume we just fought a Daedra.
string: 如果我们将这种生物与我们在神庙中找到的书联系起来，我想可以肯定地假设我们刚刚打的是个迪德拉。

original: Which confirms that Miraak is being backed by a Daedric Prince. As if him being a Dragonborn wasn't bad enough.
string: 这证实了米拉克得到了迪德拉君王的支持。好像他是龙裔还不够糟糕似的。

original: There must be a way to sever their connection.
string: 一定有办法切断它们之间的联系。

original: They're not "connected". And even if they were, you really think you could overpower a god?
string: 他们没有“联系”。即使他们是，你真的认为你可以打倒圣灵吗？

original: Maybe they can't be defeated, but if we cleanse the other stones as we did this one, it may be enough to stop them both.
string: 也许他们无法被击败，但如果我们像清理这块石头一样净化其他石头，也许就足以阻止他们俩了。

original: In any case, we should tell Storn that his people are free. He may help us figure out our next step.
string: 无论如何，我们应该告诉斯托恩，他的人民自由了。也许他能帮助我们弄清楚下一步的行动。

original: Would having the support of another Daedric Prince help us?
string: 得到另一位迪德拉君王的支持会对我们有帮助吗？

original: Bad idea. First of all, if you pledge yourself to one, your soul will be bound to them for eternity. Even after death.
string: 馊主意。首先，如果你向一个迪德拉君王宣示忠诚，你的灵魂将永远与他们结合在一起，即便在死后。

original: And second, I don't think starting a Daedric war in Tamriel is exactly what we want. Nothing good ever comes out of it.
string: 其次，我不认为在泰姆瑞尔发动迪德拉战争正是我们想要的。它不会有什么好结果。

original: It's probably best to ask Storn. Besides, he should know that we managed to free his people.
string: 最好问问斯托恩。此外，他应该知道我们成功地解救了他的人民。

original: What if the Divines backed us in turn?
string: 如果圣灵支持我们会怎么样？

original: Well... Even if that was possible, the Daedra are way more powerful. And most of them screw over the Divines for sport.
string: 好吧……即使这是可能的，迪德拉也要强大得多。他们中的大多数都把欺负圣灵当成一种享乐。

original: No, we need Storn's input in this matter. He's proven to be our best lead so far.
string: 不，我们需要斯托恩在这件事上的意见。事实证明，他是我们目前为止最好的指导者。

original: Maybe... The Dragons will see this as a threat and help?
string: 也许……龙族会把这视为一种威胁然后提供帮助？

original: You can't be this naive...
string: 你不会这么天真吧……

original: Let's talk to Storn. We should tell him that his people are free at last.
string: 我们去和斯托恩谈谈吧。我们应该告诉他，他的人民终于自由了。

original: What if I pledged myself to this Daedric Prince? I could replace Miraak.
string: 如果我向这位迪德拉君王宣示忠诚呢？我可以取代米拉克。

original: I'm gonna pretend you didn't even consider the idea.
string: 我就假装你根本没有这么想过。

original: Let's talk to Storn. We should tell him that his people are free at last.
string: 我们去和斯托恩谈谈吧。我们应该告诉他，他的人民终于自由了。

original: That was the last of the stones. At least these people are finally free from Miraak's control.
string: 那是最后一块石头。至少这些人终于摆脱了米拉克的控制。

original: Are you feeling better now?
string: 你现在好一点儿了吗？

original: Yeah! I mean, you did most of the heavy lifting with your shouting, but at least I can say I did something about it too.
string: 是的！我的意思是，大部分重头戏都是你用你的龙吼完成的，但至少我可以说我也为此做了一些事情。

original: Seriously, I hate how self-centered I was acting back then!
string: 说真的，我真恨自己当时表现得太以自我为中心了！

original: Can I ask you something about what we talked about earlier?
string: 我可以问你一些我们之前谈过的事情吗？

original: Oh. Sure. What is it?
string: 哦。当然。是什么？

original: Do you think you don't deserve to be happy?
string: 你认为你不值得幸福吗？

original: W-what was that about?!
string: 那-那是什么意思？

original: I was worried about you after that conversation.
string: 那次谈话之后我很担心你。

original: You got it all wrong! I don't... I-I know how this sounds, but I don't regret having done it!
string: 你搞错了！我不……我-我知道这听起来什么样，但我不后悔这样做了！

original: I know it was wrong, and I do feel guilt over that, but I don't want to insult them by regretting what I gained in exchange for their lives.
string: 我知道这样做是不对的，我确实为此感到内疚，但我不想因为后悔用他们的生命换来的东西而侮辱他们。

original: This is a gift, even if it was earned through blood! If I were to give it up, it would make their deaths meaningless!
string: 这是一份礼物，即使它是用鲜血换来的！如果我放弃它，他们的死就毫无意义了！

original: It's hard for me to come to terms with these feelings. I don't like this side of myself, but... I can't ignore it like I did in my youth!
string: 我很难接受这些感受。我不喜欢自己的这一面，但是……我不能像年轻时那样忽视它！

original: Otherwise, I'll end up like my father.
string: 不然的话，我也会像我父亲一样。

original: You got it all wrong! I don't... I-I know how this sounds, but I don't regret having done it!
string: 你搞错了！我不……我-我知道这听起来什么样，但我不后悔这样做了！

original: I know it was wrong, and I do feel guilt over that, but I don't want to insult them by regretting what I gained in exchange for their lives.
string: 我知道这样做是不对的，我确实为此感到内疚，但我不想因为后悔用他们的生命换来的东西而侮辱他们。

original: That's why part of me feels as if I was spitting on their graves when I gave up my immortality.
string: 这就是为什么当我放弃永生时，我的一部分感觉就像是在向他们的坟墓吐口水。

original: It's hard for me to come to terms with these feelings. I don't like this side of myself but... I can't ignore it like I did in my youth!
string: 我很难接受这些感受。我不喜欢自己的这一面，但是……我不能像年轻时那样忽视它！

original: Othewise, I'll end up like my father...
string: 不然的话，我也会像我父亲一样……

original: So you wouldn't change the past if you could?
string: 所以就算可以，你也不愿意改变过去吗？

original: I don't think I would be who I am if I changed anything. I wouldn't even be here!
string: 如果我改变了什么，我想我就不是现在的我了。我甚至不会在这里！

original: I think... I think that it needed to happen for me to start becoming a better person.
string: 我想……我想，我需要这样做，才能成为一个更好的人。

original: I know it sounds cruel, but I can't make things right by drowning in regret. I have to move forward and prove to myself that I'm a better person now.
string: 我知道这听起来很残酷，但我不能沉浸在悔恨中来弥补过错。我必须向前看，向自己证明我现在是一个更好的人。

original: So you don't need to worry about me. I'm fine. Really.
string: 所以你不用担心我。我很好。真的。

original: As you wish, but... Serana?
string: 如你所愿，但是……瑟拉娜？

original: Yes?
string: 嗯？

original: You deserve to be happy. I wanted you to know that.
string: 你值得幸福。我想让你知道这一点。

original: I don't think it's up to you to decide that.
string: 我认为这不是你能决定的。

original: But... Thank you.
string: 但是……谢谢你。

original: Wait, before we continue, I need you to tell me everything that happened while you were reading that book.
string: 等等，在我们继续之前，我需要你告诉我你读那本书时发生的一切。

original: Well, Hermaeus Mora appeared before me and...
string: 好吧，赫麦尤斯·莫拉出现在我面前，然后……

original: I should have known that he'd try to lure you to his side! This is exactly how most Daedric Princes try to gain followers.
string: 我早该知道他会引诱你加入他的阵营！这正是大多数迪德拉君王获取追随者的手段。

original: But we need the third word of power to defeat Miraak.
string: 但我们需要第三个力量之语来击败米拉克。

original: Yes, and then he'll promise you more words, spells, and ways to cook a sweetroll. And before you realize, you'll be trapped under his servitude!
string: 是的，然后他会向你承诺更多的力量之语、法术和烹饪甜卷的方法。在你意识到之前，你就会被困在他的奴役之下！

original: Listen. As someone who once devoted herself to a Daedric Lord, I need to warn you of what will happen if a Daedra starts taking an interest in you.
string: 听着，作为一个曾经献身于一个迪德拉领主的人，我需要警告你，如果一个迪德拉开始对你感兴趣，会有什么后果。

original: First he'll be nice to you. He'll tell you how special you are and promise you everything you can dream of.
string: 首先他会对你很好。他会告诉你你是多么特别，并承诺你能梦想到的一切。

original: Then, once you are within his clutches, the mask falls, and you'll exist solely to serve his will. Refuse, and you will suffer.
string: 然后，一旦你落入他的掌控之中，假面就会掉落，你的存在将只是为了服务于他的意志。拒绝，你就会受苦。

original: Daedra think of mortals as pets or cattle. We're playthings. Toys, property... And they don't let go once they have their grasp on us.
string: 迪德拉将凡人视为宠物或是家畜。我们是玩物。玩具、财产……它们一旦抓住我们就不会放手。

original: This is exactly the game Hermaeus Mora is trying to play with you. You must be able to see it!
string: 这正是赫麦尤斯·莫拉试图跟你玩的游戏。你一定要看清楚！

original: Besides, look how easily he's willing to dispose of Miraak! If you become his servant, how long will it be until he replaces you in the same way?
string: 再说了，看看他是多么愿意轻易地处理掉米拉克！如果你成为他的仆人，他要多久才能以同样的方式取代你？

original: But what will happen if I defy him now?
string: 但如果我现在违抗他，会发生什么呢？

original: You haven't pledged yourself yet, which means he doesn't own your soul. It will be okay if you just take the word and then ignore him.
string: 你还没有宣示忠诚，也就是说他还不拥有你的灵魂。如果你只是拿了力量之语，然后不理他也没关系。

original: Please, you have to remember that you are not like the rest of the mortals. Your dragon soul is extremely rare and valuable.
string: 请你记住，你与其他凡人不同。你的龙魂极其稀有珍贵。

original: The Princes will try everything to lure you to their side. And once you pledge yourself to one of them, you'll be bound to that oath even after death
string: 迪德拉君王们会想尽一切办法引诱你加入他们的阵营。一旦你向其中一位宣誓，即使在死后你也要遵守那个誓言。

original: I'll be careful. I promise.
string: 我会小心的。我保证。

original: I know you will. Thank you for listening.
string: 我知道你会的。谢谢你听我说话。

original: But there are benefits to it too, are there? It may be worth it.
string: 但它也有好处，不是吗？这也许是值得的。

original: Have you been paying attention to everything I just said?!
string: 我刚才说的话你有仔细听吗？！

original: You know what?! Do what you want! I don't care anymore!
string: 你知道吗？！做你想做的事！我不在乎了！

original: Poor Frea... I wish she didn't have to see that.
string: 可怜的芙瑞雅……我希望她不用看到这个。

original: Damn Mora! This is exactly what I meant earlier! He didn't have to kill Storn in order to take the knowledge! This murder was just out of spite!
string: 该死的莫拉！这正是我之前说过的！他不必为了获取知识而杀死斯托恩！这谋杀纯粹是出于恶意！

original: You have to make his sacrifice count! Go! End Miraak before he becomes too powerful!
string: 你必须让他的牺牲有价值！去吧！在米拉克变得过于强大之前消灭他！

original: I will. And I'll return alive!
string: 我会的。并且我一定会活着回来！

original: I know you will.
string: 我知道你会的。

original: I... I'll stay here and look after Frea while she grieves. And I'll be waiting for you to come back.
string: 我……我会留在这里，在芙瑞雅悲伤的时候照顾她。我会等你回来。

original: I'm not sure if I can do this without you...
string: 我不知道没有你我能不能做的到……

original: You have to. This is a Dragonborn we're talking about. I'll only get in the way.
string: 你必须这么做。我们说的可是个龙裔啊。我只会碍事。

original: Believe me, I really wish I could go with you. But even if I could, I think this is an opponent you have to face on your own.
string: 相信我，我真的希望能和你一起去。但即使可以，我想这也是你必须自己面对的对手。

original: But I know you'll survive this. And I'll be waiting for you right here. I promise.
string: 但我知道你会挺过去的。我会在这里等你。我保证。

original: You're alive! I knew you'd make it!
string: 你还活着！我就知道你能行！

original: Well... That makes one of us. Thanks!
string: 哈哈……我自己都没有信心。谢谢！

original: Hey, no battle is easy. Life should have taught you that already.
string: 嘿，没有容易的战斗。生活应该已经教会了你这一点。

original: But you came through on top, and saved all these people from a lifetime of slavery! I'm proud of you!
string: 但你最终站了出来，把这些人从一生的奴役中解救出来！我为你骄傲！

original: And I made a clown out of him too!
string: 我还把他变成了小丑！

original: Oh yeah, I forgot about that.
string: 哦，是的，我忘记了。

original: Well, all's well that ends well, as they say.
string: 是的，俗话说，笑到最后才是笑得最好。

original: Hermaeus Mora still wants me to serve him, and promises to reward me.
string: 赫麦尤斯·莫拉仍然希望我为他服务，还答应奖励我。

original: I figured as much. This is exactly what I warned you against.
string: 我猜到了。这正是我警告你要注意的。

original: Look, I know you might think I'm trying to decide for you, but I just don't want you to get hurt like I was. What if you make a choice you'll regret?
string: 听着，我知道你可能认为我是在替你做决定，但我只是不想让你像我一样受到伤害。如果你做出了后悔的选择怎么办？

original: But only you can decide what to do with your life. All I can do is warn you against what might happen if you follow a certain path.
string: 但只有你才能决定你的人生。我所能做的就是警告你，如果你走了某条路，可能会发生什么。

original: And I think Miraak was an example of what awaits you if you become obsessed with power. That was the only thing of value he had.
string: 我认为米拉克就是一个例子，如果你沉迷于力量，等待着你的将会是什么。那是他唯一有价值的东西了。

original: It's just like what happened to my father. Allowing power to define you will only make you waste your life, even if you manage to live forever.
string: 就像我父亲的遭遇一样。让力量来定义你，只会让你浪费生命，即使你能永生不死。

original: There's no joy in a life like that. It's much more fulfilling to appreciate what you already have and share it with those you love.
string: 这样的生活毫无乐趣可言。珍惜现有的一切，并与自己所爱的人分享，才会更有意义。

original: Then, when your end comes, I know you'll die with no regrets.
string: 然后，当你的最后到来时，我知道你会没有遗憾的死去。

original: Thank you, Serana. That means a lot.
string: 谢谢你，瑟拉娜。这对我意义重大。

original: And the fact that you care means the world to me.
string: 事实上，你的关心对我来说就是整个世界。

original: Thank you. I mean it.
string: 谢谢。我是认真的。

original: Now, I think we earned some sight-seeing around the island, don't you think?
string: 现在，我想我们应得一次环岛观光，你不觉得吗？

original: Don't worry. I know what I'm doing.
string: 不用担心。我知道我在做什么。

original: I hope you do.
string: 我希望你知道。

original: I really, really do.
string: 我真的，真的知道。

original: Not sure I feel comfortable inside a fungus. The elevator thing is fun though.
string: 不确定我在真菌里是否感觉舒服。电梯的事还是很有趣的。

original: Ha! Good one!
string: 哈！说得好！

original: What? Why?
string: 什么？为什么？

original: Oh, you know... Fun-gus, fun...
string: 哦，你知道……真菌（Fungus）里有趣（fun）……

original: Now I get it!
string: 现在我懂了！

original: What kind of magic makes this possible?
string: 什么样的魔法使这一切成为可能？

original: I don't know. But back in my day, I heard tales of levitation spells that allowed one to walk in the air.
string: 我不知道。但在我那个时代，我听说过悬浮法术的故事，可以让人在空中行走。

original: Nobody seems to use those anymore. Pity.
string: 现在似乎没有人会用了。遗憾。

original: I'm in my early hundreds.
string: 我才100岁出头。

original: Really? Oh yeah, you're an elf!
string: 真的吗？哦，是的，你是一个精灵！

original: Sorry. I keep forgetting that your kind lives up to three hundred years.
string: 对不起。我总是忘记你们的寿命可以长达三百年。

original: I'm actually glad you're that old. At least now I know I'm hanging out with someone as mature as I am.
string: 其实我很高兴你这么大了。至少现在我知道我是在和一个像我一样成熟的人同行。

original: I'm closer to 200 than I'd like to admit...
string: 我比我愿意承认的还要接近200岁……

original: Aww... Approaching the elven third age, are we?
string: 哎呀……快要到精灵生命中的第三纪了，是吗？

original: Hey, don't feel bad! You're pretty good-looking for someone as old as you are. And I've met my fair share of elves, trust me.
string: 嘿，别难过！对于你这个年纪的人来说，你长得很漂亮。我也遇到过不少精灵，相信我。

original: Don't let my youthful appearance fool you. I'm more than 50 years old.
string: 别让我年轻的外表欺骗了你。我已经50多岁了。

original: Oh yeah! Elves do live longer than other mortals.
string: 哦对！精灵确实比其他凡人寿命更长。

original: Lucky you! An average human your age must be growing gray hair, while you're still a teenager, probably.
string: 你真幸运！与你同龄的普通人肯定已经长出了白发，而你还是个青少年，大概吧。

original: Yeah, you look way younger than 30.
string: 是的，你看起来远没有30岁。

original: Okay... Maybe I was closer to 20 than I remember.
string: 好吧……也许我比我记忆中更接近20岁。

original: But I don't want you to start treating me like someone younger than you, okay? We both know I'm much more mature than I look.
string: 但我不希望你开始像对待比你年轻的人一样对待我，好吗？我们都知道我比看上去成熟得多。

original: Anything else?
string: 还有别的事吗？

original: Actually yes. I was expecting you to introduce yourself since, you know, I just told you my name.
string: 实际上有。我正等着你自我介绍，因为，你知道，我刚刚告诉了你我的名字。

original: My name is <alias=player>. Good to meet you.
string: 我叫<alias=player>。很高兴见到你。

original: Likewise.
string: 我也是。

original: And sorry for the sudden request. I know it's a lot to ask of a stranger you just met, but I swear it's important.
string: 很抱歉突然提出这个要求。我知道对一个刚认识的陌生人提出这样的要求很过分，但我发誓这很重要。

original: I promise I don't mean any harm.
string: 我保证我没有任何恶意。

original: I'd rather keep it to myself.
string: 我还是不说的好。

original: Fine. Suit yourself.
string: 好吧。随你便。

original: And sorry for the sudden request. I know it's a lot to ask of a stranger you just met, but I swear it's important.
string: 很抱歉突然提出这个要求。我知道对一个刚认识的陌生人提出这样的要求很过分，但我发誓这很重要。

original: I promise I don't mean any harm.
string: 我保证我没有任何恶意。

original: It's alright. You don't seem like a bad person.
string: 没关系。你看起来不像是个坏人。

original: I hope for your sake it's not because I have a pretty face. What if I'm secretly planning on making you my emergency food, huh?
string: 希望不是因为我长得好看。如果我暗地里打算把你变成我的应急食物呢？

original: I'm kidding, of course. Don't worry, I'll make sure nothing bad happens to you when we get there.
string: 当然了，我只是在开玩笑。别担心，到了那里，我保证你不会出事的。

original: I hope for your sake it's not because I have a pretty face. What if I'm secretly planning on making you my personal thrall, huh?
string: 我希望，你是因为我的内在而非外表才喜欢我。万一我其实正暗自打算把你变成我的专属奴隶呢，嗯？

original: I'm kidding, of course! Don't worry, I'll make sure nothing bad happens to you when we get there.
string: 当然了，我只是在开玩笑。别担心，到了那里，我保证你不会出事的。.

original: This better be worth it.
string: 这最好是值得的。

original: Well, I guess that can be arranged once we get there, but be mindful of your expectations. Hosts can be easily offended.
string: 好吧，我想我们到了那里可以商量，但要注意自己的期望值。那里的主人很容易被冒犯。

original: Oh hey, you're awake! I suppose I should welcome you into our clan.
string: 嘿，你醒了！我想我应该欢迎你加入我们的氏族。

original: I'm honestly impressed that you accepted my father's offer so quickly. It's a lifelong commitment. What convinced you to join our faction?
string: 你如此迅速地接受了我父亲的提议，真的让我感到很惊讶。这是一生的承诺。是什么让你决定加入我们这一派？

original: The Dawnguard is weak. I side with the winning team.
string: 黎明守卫很弱。我支持会赢的一方。

original: I guess wanting to secure a spot at the top of the food chain is natural. You just... Didn't seem to have thought it through though.
string: 我看，想在食物链的顶端占据一席之地是很自然的。你只是……好像还没有想清楚。

original: Your father offered me immortality. How could I say no?
string: 你的父亲给了我永生。我怎么能说不呢？

original: Yeah, living forever is a very tempting deal. I guess it was obvious.
string: 是的，永生是一个非常诱人的交易。我想这很明显。

original: I just hope for your sake that you don't have any regrets when you look back. Eternity can... Change you. A lot.
string: 我只是希望你，当你回首往事时，不要有任何遗憾。永生可以……改变你。很多。

original: The power of a Vampire Lord.
string: 吸血鬼领主的力量。

original: I suppose it's a useful ability to have in your arsenal. I never thought he'd be willing to share it.
string: 我想这是一种有用的能力。我从没想过他会愿意分享它。

original: If you want advice, try not to stand out. If things here are the same as before I was locked away... No one here will take a threat lightly.
string: 如果你想听建议，尽量不要引人注目。如果这里的情况和我被关起来之前一样……这里没人会轻易接受一个威胁。

original: Let's just say I saw an opportunity.
string: 只能说我看到了一个机会。

original: An opportunity for what?
string: 一个什么机会？

original: Actually, don't answer that. Somehow I don't want to know. Just be careful you don't bite off more than you can chew.
string: 实际上，不要回答。我不想知道。只是，小心点，贪多嚼不烂。

original: I couldn't stand being separated from you! I love you!
string: 我无法忍受与你分离！我爱你！

original: You... What?!
string: 你……什么？

original: Oh, you were joking.
string: 哦，你是在开玩笑。

original: Right.
string: 好的。

original: In any case, welcome to Clan Volkihar. Say hello to the court but try not to pick sides. Their squabbles aren't worth it.
string: 无论如何，欢迎来到沃基哈尔氏族。向宫廷打个招呼，但尽量不要选边站队。他们的争斗不值得参与。

original: I need some time to get used to the change myself, so... I'd prefer to be alone for the moment. We can talk later.
string: 我自己也需要一些时间来适应这种变化，所以……我想暂时一个人静一静。我们可以晚点再谈。

original: And thank you for bringing me home. I forgot to tell you earlier.
string: 谢谢你带我回家，我忘了早点告诉你。

original: Are you okay with me inheriting the title of lord?
string: 你继承领主头衔的事，你考虑清楚了吗？

original: Yeah. I'm good, really. I never wanted the title in the first place.
string: 是啊。我很好，真的。我从一开始就不想要这个头衔。

original: I hate to bring it to you, but half the court probably craves the power you have. I don't envy you one bit.
string: 我很不愿意告诉你这个，但宫廷里大概有一半的人都渴望你拥有的权力。我一点也不羡慕你。

original: But don't worry too much about it. The fact that you defeated the strongest vampire of our clan will make them think twice before making a move.
string: 不过也别太担心了。你打败了我们氏族最强大的吸血鬼这件事，会让他们在采取行动前三思而后行的。

original: I just hope you make better use of your power than my father did.
string: 我只希望你能比我父亲更好地利用你的权力。

original: Yeah. I'm good, really. I never wanted the title in the first place.
string: 是啊。我很好，真的。我从一开始就不想要这个头衔。

original: I hate to break it to you, but half the court probably craves the power you have. I don't envy you one bit.
string: 我很不愿意告诉你这个，但宫廷里大概有一半的人都渴望你拥有的权力。我一点也不羡慕你。

original: But don't worry too much about it. The fact that you defeated the strongest vampire of our clan will make them think twice before making a move.
string: 不过也别太担心了。你打败了我们氏族最强大的吸血鬼这件事，会让他们在采取行动前三思而后行的。

original: I just hope you make better use of your new power than my father did.
string: 我只希望你能比我父亲更好地利用你的新权力。

original: Are you okay with me inheriting the title of lady?
string: 你继承女领主头衔的事，你考虑清楚了吗？

original: Is that what you meant earlier? About your family's legacy?
string: 你之前说的就是这个意思吗？关于你氏族的传承？

original: Yeah. Our clan wasn't always like this. I mean, we followed Molag Bal, but we also had values, rules, and commanded respect instead of fear.
string: 是啊。我们氏族并不总是这样的。我的意思是，我们追随莫拉格·巴尔，但我们也有自己的价值观、规矩，我们赢得的是尊重而不是恐惧。

original: But after so many millennia... Well, you've seen what the court has become. It's an easy trap for us vampires to fall into.
string: 但经过这么多千年……唔，你也看到我们的宫廷变成什么样子了。对我们吸血鬼来说，这是个很容易掉进去的陷阱。

original: But I think you can set an example here. Make our clan more respectable, and restore it to its former glory.
string: 但我认为你可以在这里树立一个榜样。让我们的氏族更受尊敬，恢复它昔日的荣光。

original: Assuming you plan on doing that.
string: 假如你真打算那么做的话。

original: Yeah, you're right. We can help them be better.
string: 是的，你说得对。我们可以帮助他们变得更好。

original: I'm glad we're on the same page here.
string: 我很高兴我们在这件事上意见一致。

original: It won't happen overnight. Some will even resist that change, but you... We can help them. In time.
string: 这不会一蹴而就。有些人甚至会抵制这种改变，但你……我们可以帮助他们。假以时日。

original: I haven't decided yet. For now I think we should lay low.
string: 我还没决定好。目前我觉得我们应该保持低调。

original: I suppose you have a point. You should take some time to adjust to your new responsibilities before making long-term decisions.
string: 我想你说得有道理。在做长远决定之前，你应该花些时间适应你的新职责。

original: But promise me you'll think about it. Our clan can be so much more than what my father turned it into.
string: 但答应我你会考虑一下。我们的氏族可以变得比我父亲所塑造的样子好得多。

original: I shouldn't force them to change. The change must come from within themselves.
string: 我不该强迫他们改变。改变必须来自他们自己内心。

original: I didn't say anything about forcing them. That would never end well.
string: 我可没说要强迫他们。那样做绝对不会有好结果。

original: No, I meant be an example. To show them how far they've fallen and to make them see where my father's corruption was taking them.
string: 不，我是要以身作则。让他们看清自己已堕落至何种境地，并明白我父亲的腐败会把他们带向何方。

original: I don't expect them to become paragons of virtue, nor do I think they ever will be. But with your help, they can recover from their fall from grace.
string: 我不指望他们能成为美德的典范，我也不认为他们会变成那样。但在你的帮助下，他们可以从堕落中恢复过来。

original: You were right about one thing though. The change must come from them. For as long as it takes.
string: 不过你有一点说对了。改变必须来自他们自己。不管需要多长时间。

original: Actually, I was planning on taking over Skyrim from the shadows.
string: 说实话，我本来是打算在暗中接管天际的。

original: Have you learned nothing from my father's mistakes?! If you bite off more than you can chew, you can kiss goodbye to our clan's restoration!
string: 你从我父亲的错误中学到了什么吗？！如果你贪多嚼不烂，就可以和我们氏族的复兴说再见了！

original: Seriously, his actions caused the rise of a vampire hunter faction! Those consequences will haunt us for ages!
string: 说真的，他的所作所为导致了吸血鬼猎人派系的崛起！这些后果会困扰我们很长一段时间！

original: Besides, you're literally the youngest member of our clan! I think you need to grow up before you start getting involved in politics!
string: 况且，你简直就是我们氏族里最年轻的成员！我觉得在你开始涉足政治之前，还是先长大点吧！

original: And what will you do when we're not adventuring?
string: 那么当我们不去冒险的时候，你打算做些什么呢？

original: Well... I guess I'll help you restore our clan's legacy. Not as a political advisor, mind you. That's what Vingalmo and Orthjolf are here for.
string: 好吧……看来我得帮忙重振氏族的荣光。先说清楚，可不是以政治顾问的身份。那差事正是文嘉莫和欧兹约夫在这里的原因。

original: But I think I can help you make a difference. It won't be easy for you, so I want to aid you as best I can.
string: 但我想我可以帮你带来改变。这对你来说不会容易，所以我想尽我所能地帮助你。

original: Thank you. I don't think I could handle this on my own.
string: 谢谢你。我想我一个人应付不了这个。

original: Hey, that's what friends are for, aren't we?
string: 嘿，这不就是朋友该做的吗，不是吗？

original: I mean no offense, but... Don't you think you're being delusional?
string: 我不是有意冒犯，但是……你不觉得你有点自欺欺人吗？

original: I... I don't know. I guess I'm still holding onto the past after all.
string: 我……我不知道。我想我还是放不下过去。

original: But even so, I know I'm right. Our clan can heal.
string: 但即便如此，我知道我是对的。我们的氏族是可以痊愈的。

original: And maybe... So can I.
string: 也许……我也可以。

original: You mean... As the lady to my lord?
string: 你的意思是……作为我的夫人？

original: Uhhh... No.
string: 呃……不。

original: Sorry.
string: 对不起。

original: Uhhh... No.
string: 呃……不。

original: Sorry.
string: 对不起。

original: You mean... As my lady?
string: 你是说……作为我的夫人？

original: Do you feel remorse about your clan's extinction?
string: 你对你氏族的覆灭感到懊悔吗？

original: You mean "extermination". You and I both took part in that battle.
string: 你是说"灭绝"。你我都参与了那场战斗。

original: But we had no choice. They wouldn't let us get to my father without a fight. If any of them stepped out of line, he would have killed them himself.
string: 但我们别无选择。他们不会让我们不战而获得接近父亲的机会。如果他们中有谁敢越线，他就会亲自杀了他们。

original: Still... Well, I can't say I was fond of them, but... They were part of the community I grew up with. We shared that much.
string: 不过……嗯，我不能说我喜欢他们，但是……他们是我成长的社区的一部分。我们至少有这一点是共同的。

original: And under better leadership, they wouldn't have fallen so far. My father dragged them all to the doomed fate he was heading towards.
string: 如果有更好的领导，他们也不会沦落至此。我父亲把他们全都拖向了他自己那注定的悲惨命运。

original: Your clan was more dignified?
string: 你的氏族曾经更有尊严？

original: Yeah. Our clan wasn't always like this. I mean, we followed Molag Bal, but we also had values, rules, and commanded respect instead of fear.
string: 是啊。我们氏族并不总是这样的。我的意思是，我们追随莫拉格·巴尔，但我们也有自己的价值观、规矩，我们赢得的是尊重而不是恐惧。

original: In a better world, my mother and I could have healed our clan. Make our family's legacy something more respectable.
string: 在一个更好的世界里，我母亲和我本可以治愈我们的氏族。让我们氏族的传承变得更值得尊敬。

original: But it's too late for that now. Any chance of restoring Clan Volkihar died with my father.
string: 但现在说这些已经太迟了。恢复沃基哈尔氏族的任何机会都随着我父亲的死而消失了。

original: You're still alive, Serana. You can start over.
string: 你还活着，瑟拉娜。你可以重新开始。

original: What, you want me to start biting off people's necks and send them invitations to an extinct vampire clan?
string: 什么，你是想让我开始咬人脖子，然后给他们寄邀请函加入一个已经灭绝的吸血鬼氏族吗？

original: I'm pretty sure I'd need to be a vampire in order to lead a vampire clan. Not that there's anything left to lead anyway.
string: 我很确定要领导一个吸血鬼氏族的话，我得是个吸血鬼才行。不过反正现在也没什么可领导的了。

original: This isn't about your clan. It's about your life.
string: 这与你的部族无关——而与你的人生有关。

original: Oh...
Yeah, I think I get what you mean. Sorry, I just keep living in the past.
string: 是的，我想我明白你的意思。抱歉，我总是活在过去。

original: But you're completely right! The end of Clan Volkihar's legacy doesn't mean the end of mine! I'm free now!
string: 但你说得太对了！沃基哈尔氏族的传承结束并不意味着我的结束！我现在自由了！

original: I could be an alchemist, a court wizard, a librarian... There's so many possibilities in front of me!
string: 我可以成为炼金术士、宫廷法师、图书管理员……我面前有太多可能性了！

original: Adventuring is in high demand these days. And I could use a partner.
string: 这年头冒险者可是很吃香。而且我也正好需要个搭档。

original: Oh, that was at the top of my list of priorities, believe me.
string: 哦，相信我，那可是我优先事项清单上的头等大事。

original: Come on! Let's make some more stories!
string: 来吧！让我们再创造些新故事！

original: Whatever you do, I hope that you live happily.
string: 无论你做什么，我希望你能幸福地生活。

original: Thanks.
string: 谢谢。

original: You too.
string: 你也是。

original: Yeah! You could even start a family!
string: 没错！你甚至可以组建一个家庭！

original: Let's... Not get ahead of ourselves.
string: 我们……别操之过急。

original: Sorry.
string: 对不起。

original: How are you holding up as a mortal?
string: 作为一个凡人，你现在适应得怎么样？

original: The change is a bit harder to adjust to than I thought.
string: 这种变化比我想象的更难适应。

original: First of all, there's the diet. I've been surviving on blood for so long that I almost forgot how to chew. My first meal was an embarrassing episode.
string: 首先，是饮食。我靠血液为生太久了，以至于差点忘了怎么咀嚼。我的第一顿正餐简直是场灾难。

original: But ever since then it's been a colorful experience! Turns out I love apples and hate leeks. That feels sort of nostalgic.
string: 但从那以后，这可真是一场丰富多彩的体验！原来我喜欢苹果，讨厌韭菜。这感觉还挺怀念的。

original: On the other hand, there's also the temperature. Vampires have a high tolerance to cold climates, so... I'm going to need more layers of clothing.
string: 另一方面，还有温度的问题。吸血鬼对寒冷气候有很高的耐受力，所以……我得多穿几层衣服了。

original: To be honest... I feel fragile, you know? Not only could I die from the cold, but any disease could kill me if I'm not careful.
string: 说实话……我感觉很脆弱，你知道吗？不仅寒冷可能会要了我的命，如果我不小心的话，任何疾病都可能杀死我。

original: I know I sound paranoid, but... I mean, these are concerns you've had too, right?
string: 我知道我听起来有点偏执，但是……我是说，这些也是你担心的问题，对吧？

original: Yeah, but I don't obsess over them.
string: 是啊，但我不会对它们太过执着。

original: Yeah, you're right. Besides, I still have my knowledge about magic, alchemy and swordplay. I'm not defenseless!
string: 是啊，你说得对。而且，我还保留着关于魔法、炼金术和剑术的知识。我并非毫无防御能力！

original: Besides, some good things came with the change too. I already mentioned the food, but I noticed that because I have regained my sense of taste.
string: 再说了，这个变化也带来了一些好处。我之前提到过食物，但那是因为我重新获得了味觉。

original: Moreover, just as I can feel the cold now, so can I feel the warmth of my own body, and the rhythm of my heartbeat.
string: 而且，就像我现在能感受到寒冷一样，我也能感受到自己身体的温暖，以及心跳的节奏。

original: I was afraid I would regret giving up my immortality, but I have gained so much more than I could ever dream of!
string: 我本来担心会后悔放弃永生，但我得到的远比我能想象的要多得多！

original: Even if my life has a deadline now... I can finally live it at the same pace as everyone else!
string: 就算我的生命现在有了期限……我终于可以和其他人一样的节奏生活了！

original: I... I wanted to give this to you. I bought it from Falion after he cured me.
string: 我……我想把这个给你。这是我在法利昂治愈我之后从他那里买的。

original: Thank you for supporting me all the way.
string: 谢谢你一路上对我的支持。

original: Care to explain this sudden urge to play detective?
string: 你这突然想当侦探的冲动是怎么回事？能解释一下吗？

original: I thought you were taking me home. Do we really need to play detective right now?
string: 我以为你是要带我回家。我们现在真的有必要玩侦探游戏吗？

original: Remember the reward?
string: 还记得奖励吗？

original: Yeah, I do. I guess it's a better way to make money than scavenging in a dungeon.
string: 是啊，我记得。我猜这比在地下城里捡破烂赚钱要好得多。

original: Still... I don't know. I did notice something strange when we passed by the house. I should come along with you, just in case.
string: 不过……我不知道。我们经过那栋房子的时候，我确实注意到了一些奇怪的事。我应该和你一起去，以防万一。

original: Sorry, but I could use the reward, you know?
string: 抱歉，但你知道的，我可以用到这笔奖励。

original: Fine. Just... Don't take too long, please.
string: 好吧。只是……请别花太长时间，好吗？

original: I may as well come along. I don't know why, but... Something's not right in that house.
string: 我不妨和你一起去。我说不清为什么，但是……那房子里有些不对劲。

original: I don't know, but... I think something's off in that house.
string: 我不知道，但是……我觉得那栋房子里有些不对劲。

original: You know? I've had a similar feeling since we got here.
string: 你知道吗？自从我们到这里，我也有类似的感觉。

original: I can't quite put my finger on it, but I'm coming along with you. We'll get to the bottom of this faster if we work together.
string: 我说不太清楚是什么原因，但我要和你一起去。如果我们合作的话，能更快地查个水落石出。

original: I agree with your hypothesis. Alva has to be a vampire as well. And if she was able to enthrall Helgi's father, she must be a powerful one.
string: 我同意你的推测。阿尔瓦肯定也是个吸血鬼。而且如果她能够蛊惑海尔吉的父亲，那她一定是个很强大的吸血鬼。

original: I wonder if she's working with other Vampires. This whole operation seems too big for just one of them.
string: 我在想她是不是和其他吸血鬼一起行动。这整个行动对于一个吸血鬼来说似乎规模太大了。

original: We have to warn the Jarl immediately!
string: 我们必须立即警告领主！

original: Not without proof! We'll have to break into Alva's house and find evidence before we start making accusations.
string: 没有证据可不行！我们得闯进阿瓦拉的房子找到证据，然后才能开始指控。

original: We need to find proof and deliver it to the Jarl.
string: 我们需要找到证据并把它交给领主。

original: I was about to suggest the same thing. We can't just tell the Jarl without evidence to back up our accusations.
string: 我正想说同样的话。我们不能没有证据就去向领主大人告发，得先找到能支持我们指控的证据。

original: Let's break into Alva's house, but be ready for a fight. If she or her thrall see us, they'll try to silence us.
string: 我们闯进阿尔瓦的家吧，但要做好战斗准备。如果她或她的奴仆看到我们，他们会试图让我们永远闭嘴。

original: Poor thing... I hope she didn't suffer...
string: 可怜的孩子……我希望她没有受苦……

original: But what she said about the "other one"... I'm starting to put two and two together, but I don't have enough evidence to confirm it.
string: 但她说的那个"另一个"……我开始把线索串起来了，但还没有足够的证据来确认。

original: Let's do what she asked us. We're getting to the bottom of this!
string: 我们按她说的做吧。我们要把这件事查个水落石出！

original: I knew it! The one behind this was a feral vampire!
string: 我就知道！在这背后的是个野生吸血鬼！

original: I figured Alva wasn't working alone. She's merely a servant of a more powerful vampire, and there may be more!
string: 我猜到阿尔瓦不是单独行动的。她只不过是一个更强大的吸血鬼的仆从，而且可能还有更多！

original: We need to tell the Jarl right away that a vampire coven is about to overrun the town! I don't know how much time we have left!
string: 我们必须立即告诉领主，一群吸血鬼正要占领这个镇子！我不知道我们还剩多少时间！

original: And in case you ask, no. I doubt I can just convince them to leave. Their kind won't be open to negotiations.
string: 如果你想问的话，答案是不行。我不认为能说服他们离开。他们那种人是不会接受谈判的。

original: "Their kind"? You mean they're not aligned with Clan Volkihar?
string: "他们那种人"？你的意思是说，他们不隶属于沃基哈尔氏族？

original: I doubt it. Our clan may be the province's most powerful, but hardly the only one. This must be another faction trying to secure a territory.
string: 我表示怀疑。我们氏族虽然是这个省最强大的，但绝不是唯一的。这一定是另一个派系在试图确保自己的领地。

original: And they're getting bolder, which means they've been planning this attack for a long time, and have the power and resources to do it.
string: 而且他们变得越来越大胆，这意味着他们策划这次袭击已经很长时间了，他们拥有实施袭击的力量和资源。

original: I may be a vampire myself, but even I have my limits! Turning an entire town into a blood farm is repulsive!
string: 我自己也是个吸血鬼，但即便是我也是有底线的！把整个城镇变成血农场，这太令人作呕了！

original: We have to take them down before they can put their plan in motion!
string: 我们必须在他们实施计划之前把他们干掉！

original: I doubt it. Our clan may be the province's most powerful, but hardly the only one. This must be another faction trying to secure a territory.
string: 我表示怀疑。我们氏族虽然是这个省最强大的，但绝不是唯一的。这一定是另一个派系在试图确保自己的领地。

original: And they're getting bolder, which means they've been planning this attack for a long time, and have the power and resources to do it.
string: 而且他们变得越来越大胆，这意味着他们策划这次袭击已经很长时间了，他们拥有实施袭击的力量和资源。

original: Even when I was a vampire I had my limits! Turning an entire town into a blood farm is repulsive!
string: 即便是在我还是吸血鬼的时候，我也是有底线的！把整个城镇变成血农场，这太令人作呕了！

original: We have to take them down before they can put their plan in motion!
string: 我们必须在他们实施计划之前把他们干掉！

original: Let me tell you something: Vampire clans don't get along with each other, and mine's too clandestine to bother enslaving a little town.
string: 让我告诉你一件事：吸血鬼氏族之间不会和睦相处，而我的氏族太过隐秘，不会费心去奴役一个小镇。

original: These are different. And they're getting bolder, which means they have the power and resources they need to put their plan in motion.
string: 这些是不同的。而且他们变得越来越大胆，这意味着他们已经拥有了实施计划所需的力量和资源。

original: I may be a vampire myself, but even I have my limits! Turning an entire town into a blood farm is repulsive!
string: 我自己也是个吸血鬼，但即便是我也是有底线的！把整个城镇变成血农场，这太令人作呕了！

original: So don't worry. I'm not going to double-cross you and stab you in the back. My enemies right now are the same as yours.
string: 所以别担心。我不会背叛你，在你背后捅刀子。我现在的敌人和你的是一样的。

original: Are you sure? Aren't these vampires friends of yours?
string: 你确定吗？这些吸血鬼不是你的朋友吗？

original: It's done... I hope Helgi can rest in peace now.
string: 事情结束了……我希望海尔吉现在能安息了。

original: You seem more concerned about that girl than the town itself.
string: 你似乎比起整个镇子更关心那个女孩。

original: Well... Yeah. I guess I feel more empathy towards people who die needlessly. Especially when they're young.
string: 嗯……是啊。我想我对那些不必要死去的人更有同理心。特别是当他们还年轻的时候。

original: She deserved better.
string: 她值得更好的。

original: Anyway, let's go tell the Jarl. Morthal can rest easy now that those savages have been dealt with.
string: 不管怎样，我们去告诉领主吧。现在那些野蛮人已经被解决了，莫索尔可以安心了。

original: Seriously? Just the townsfolk? They're gonna tear us apart...
string: 认真的吗？就只是镇上的居民？他们会把我们撕成碎片的……

original: (whine)
string: （呜呜）

original: Aww... Do my eyes scare you? Don't worry. I would never hurt you.
string: 呃……我的眼镜吓到你了吗？别担心，我永远不会伤害你的。

original: What do you say, boy? Wanna be friends?
string: 怎么样，小家伙？想交个朋友吗？

original: Great! Now, we just have to do something about your smell.
string: 太棒了！现在，我们只需要再对你的气味做些什么。

original: What do you say, little pup? Wanna take a bath?
string: 你说呢，小狗？想洗个澡吗？

original: (whine)
string: （呜呜）

original: I was almost executed for being in the wrong place at the wrong time.
string: 我差点因为在错误的时间出现在错误的地方而被处决。

original: Wait, really? How did you get out of there alive?
string: 什么，真的？你是怎么活着逃出来的？

original: A Dragon attacked the town just seconds away from my execution.
string: 就在行刑前的几秒，一头巨龙突然袭击了那个小镇。

original: Wow! Talk about a stroke of luck!
string: 哇！真幸运！

original: I mean... Not that Dragons attacking towns is a good thing, but at least it worked in your favor.
string: 我是说……虽然龙袭击城镇不是一件好事，但至少对你来说算是因祸得福吧。

original: So what else can you tell me? How do you earn a living?
string: 你还能告诉我什么吗？你是做什么行当的？

original: What do you want to know?
string: 你想知道什么？

original: Well, you could start by telling me what you do for a living. Just to give an example.
string: 嗯，举个例子，你可以先告诉我你是做什么的。

original: And what's this little guy doing here? You adopted him?
string: 这个小家伙怎么在这？你收养了它？

original: (bark)
string: （吠叫）

original: Okay... Maybe not now.
string: 可以的……也许不是现在。

original: But I'll get you to bathe. Someday.
string: 但总有一天我会让你洗澡的。

original: What is it, Meeko? You're hungry?
string: 怎么了，米科？你饿了吗？

original: (whine)
string: （呜呜）

original: Aww... Poor thing. But don't worry! I brought some bread for you!
string: 嘿，可怜的小家伙。别担心！我给你带了些面包！

original: What do you say, little guy? You want a treat?
string: 怎么样，小家伙？想吃点东西吗？

original: (bark)
string: （吠叫）

original: Here you go! You did good today, Meeko.
string: 拿去吧！今天你做得很棒，米科。

original: (whine)
string: （呜呜）

original: You're hurt! Fall back!
string: 你受伤了！退后！

original: Yeah, I'll be done in a minute. Thought we could use a potion or two.
string: 稍等，我马上就好。我想我们得用上一两瓶药水。

original: I might need a bigger soul gem...
string: 我可能需要大点的灵魂石……

original: Well, this is just great... You just had to join the College the same day they decided to make a trip to a Nordic tomb, did you?
string: 好吧，这真是太棒了……你刚好在他们决定前往诺德古墓的那天加入学院，是吗？

original: Thank you for bringing me here. There's so much history within these walls...
string: 谢谢你带我来这里。这些墙里有太多的历史了……

original: Should we tell the Jarl that the dragons are being resurrected? Because they have a giant dragon skull displayed here. I'm just saying.
string: 我们应该告诉领主龙正在复活吗？因为他们在这里展示了一个巨大的龙头骨。我只是说说而已。

original: My eyes are up here, you know?
string: 我的眼睛在这里，你知道吗？

original: Please, don't look at me like that.
string: 请不要用那样的眼神看着我。

original: Aren't you cold with that?
string: 你不觉得冷吗？

original: What is it?
string: 怎么了？

original: Yes?
string: 嗯？

original: What?
string: 什么意思？

original: The black Dragon is getting away!
string: 黑龙跑了！

original: Oh, come on!
string: 喂，拜托!

original: Come on, we can do this! I know we can!
string: 加油，我们能行的，一定可以！

original: Get'em, Meeko!
string: 上啊，米科！

original: A dragon! Get away from it, Meeko!
string: 龙！快跑，米科！

original: Meeko, no!
string: 米科，不要！

original: Are you hurt, little guy?
string: 你受伤了吗，小家伙？

original: That'll teach them. Right, Meeko?
string: 这会教训他们的。对吧，米科？

original: You're gonna think I'm crazy, but... This is the most excited I've been in a long time!
string: 你可能会认为我疯了，但是……这是我很长时间以来最兴奋的一次！

original: No one will ever know...
string: 没有人会知道……

original: I'm honestly impressed the guests didn't hear all the commotion...
string: 我真的很惊讶客人们没有听到所有的骚动……

original: Oh hey, it's...! What was her name again?
string: 哦嘿，这是……！她叫什么名字？

original: I knew someone was missing from the court. Probably for the best, though. She was... A little "special", if you know what I mean.
string: 我知道宫廷里少了一个人。不过，这也许是最好的选择。她……有点“特别”，如果你明白我的意思的话。

original: Wait a minute, isn't that...?
string: 等一下，那不是……吗？

original: Wait a minute, isn't that...?
string: 等一下，那不是……吗？

original: Aww... Look at you! You made a new friend!
string: 噢……看看你！你交了一个新朋友！

original: Even though... He just tried to... Kill us...
string: 尽管……他刚才想……杀了我们……

original: You better not make a habit of this...
string: 你最好不要养成这种习惯……

original: So you become a vampire and suddenly they forget all you have done for them?
string: 所以你变成了吸血鬼，而他们就突然忘记了你为他们所做的一切？

original: This is ridiculous! You've proven your loyalty more than enough. They have no right to treat you like an animal!
string: 这太荒谬了！你已经证明了你的忠诚。他们没有权利把你当成动物一样对待！

original: They don't seem to leave me a choice...
string: 他们似乎没有给我选择…

original: Are you serious? You're giving your vampirism up just because they say so?
string: 你是认真的吗？就因为他们这么说你就要放弃吸血鬼身份？

original: Most people would kill for the gift you gained! It's not a curse! Can't you appreciate it?!
string: 大多数人会为了你获得的天赋而杀人！这不是诅咒！难道你就不能珍惜它吗？！

original: Honestly, I'm relieved that there's a cure.
string: 说实话，我很高兴有治愈方法。

original: Oh. So that's what this has been for you, huh?
string: 哦。所以这对你来说就是这样的，是吧？

original: Fine. Get your cure. And remind me to keep my distance from you while you're at it. Wouldn't want you to catch my "disease".
string: 好吧。去拿药吧。同时提醒我离你远点。我可不想让你感染我的“疾病”。

original: I don't know! I need to think about it.
string: 我不知道！我需要考虑一下。

original: What is there to think about? It's your problem, not theirs! You don't have to suffer their intolerance in exchange for their help!
string: 有什么可想的？这是你的问题，不是他们的问题！你没必要忍受他们的狭隘心胸来换取他们的帮助！

original: Let's just leave!
string: 我们走吧！

original: So... You're going through with it after all.
string: 所以……你终究还是要坚持下去。

original: Why did you get so upset earlier? I'm the one who's getting cured.
string: 你刚才怎么这么生气了？我才是被治愈的人。

original: I know. I'm sorry, it's just that... It just felt personal for me.
string: 我知道。抱歉，只是……我觉得这对我来说太私人了。

original: You know what I had to... What I was forced to go through to gain this gift. And the price that me and my family had to pay for it.
string: 你知道我必须……我被迫经历了什么才得到这份天赋。我和我的家人为此付出了什么代价。

original: Many would go through even worse lengths to gain this power. But you didn't. You didn't have to give up anything!
string: 许多人会付出更大的努力来获得这种力量。但你没有。你不需要放弃任何东西！

original: I... I wish I had it that easy! So seeing you throw it away just like that... I felt like you didn't appreciate what I gave you!
string: 我……我希望我也能这么容易做到！所以看到你就这样把它扔掉……我觉得你不珍惜我给你的东西！

original: I'm sorry, but you know Isran won't make any more exceptions.
string: 对不起，但你知道伊士冉不会再破例了。

original: Yeah. Considering you returned from the enemy castle as a vampire, I can't really blame him for being suspicious of your loyalty.
string: 是的。考虑到你从敌人的城堡回来时已经是个吸血鬼了，我实在不能责怪他怀疑你的忠诚。

original: Look, I won't complain over this anymore. You did what you needed to do in order to fulfill our mission. And I said I wouldn't judge you back then.
string: 听着，我不会再抱怨这件事了。你做了你需要做的事情，以完成我们的使命。我当时就说过我不会评判你。

original: I have no right to tell you what to do with your life. You're my friend, and I will support you no matter what. I promise.
string: 我没有权利告诉你该如何度过你的一生。你是我的朋友，无论发生什么我都会支持你。我保证。

original: In fact, I actually grabbed a filled black soul gem from my mother's laboratory. You can have it.
string: 事实上，我从妈妈的实验室里拿到了一颗装满灵魂的黑色宝石。你可以拿走它。

original: Thanks. I really appreciate it, Serana.
string: 谢谢。我真的很感激，瑟拉娜。

original: Right... Here you go.
string: 好的……给你。

original: Don't worry, I'll manage. You might need it eventually.
string: 别担心，我会搞定的。你最终可能会需要它。

original: If you say so...
string: 如果你这么说的话……

original: So... It's done. How are you feeling?
string: 那么……完成了。你感觉怎么样？

original: Better. I feel like my heart is beating again after a long time.
string: 好多了 我感觉我的心脏在很久之后又开始跳动了。

original: That... Somehow sounds about right.
string: 那……听起来有点道理。

original: In any case, I'm glad it worked out for you.
string: 无论如何，我很高兴这件事对你有帮助。

original: Strange... As if I was less aware of my surroundings.
string: 奇怪…好像我对周围的环境不那么敏感了。

original: I thought you'd feel that way. We vampires have heightened senses, after all.
string: 我就知道你会这么想 毕竟我们吸血鬼的感官很敏锐

original: In any case, I'm glad it worked out for you.
string: 无论如何，我很高兴这件事对你有帮助。

original: I'm fine. Just a little fuzzy, is all.
string: 我很好。只是有点意识模糊，仅此而已。

original: Take it easy! Your body just went through a radical change! It'll probably be that way for a while!
string: 放松点！你的身体刚刚经历了一次彻底的改变！这种情况可能还会持续一段时间！

original: In any case, I'm glad it worked out for you.
string: 无论如何，我很高兴这件事对你有帮助。

original: You sound sad, though. Are you alright?
string: 不过，你听起来很伤心。你还好吗？

original: Well, I... To tell the truth, I wasn't completely honest with you when we spoke earlier.
string: 嗯，我……说实话，之前我们谈话时我并没有完全坦诚。

original: I just didn't feel right about speaking my mind after the way I behaved. I've been too selfish in this matter.
string: 我只是觉得，在经历了那样的行为之后，我不应该说出自己的想法。在这件事上，我太自私了。

original: Serana, you said you wouldn't judge me. I promise I won't either.
string: 瑟拉娜，你说过你不会评判我的 我保证我也不会

original: Thank you.
string: 谢谢。

original: All this frustration, and one of the reasons I wanted you to become a vampire is... Because I don't want you to die.
string: 所有这些挫折，以及我希望你变成吸血鬼的原因是——因为我不想你死。

original: You're the first true friend I ever had. I never met anyone with whom I actually felt comfortable spending time. Not since I became a vampire.
string: 你是我交到的第一个真正的朋友。自从变成吸血鬼后，我再没遇到过能让我自在相处的人。

original: In a way, sharing my gift with you was my way of expressing that. I'm bound to live for ages, but... You're not.
string: 从某种程度上说，与你们分享我的礼物就是我表达的方式。我注定要长生不老，但…… 你却不是。

original: Part of me is afraid of deteriorating with time, but when we're together, I know that I'll still be me no matter what!
string: 我的一部分害怕随着时间的流逝而变得更糟糕，但当我们在一起时，我知道无论如何我都还是我！

original: I finally found something that makes my hurt go away! I don't want to lose this!
string: 我终于找到了可以让我不再受伤的东西！我不想失去它！

original: So you don't think you'll be able to let go when I die?
string: 所以你认为我死了之后你就放不下了？

original: No. I don't think I will. I don't want to.
string: 不，我想我不会，我不想。

original: But that's selfish! I have no right to make a choice of this magnitude for you!
string: 但那太自私了！我没有权利替你做出如此重大的选择！

original: I'm sick of how every time I let my guard down I end up becoming apathetic or possessive!
string: 我很讨厌每次我放松警惕，最终变得冷漠或占有欲极强！

original: I need to stop that. To accept that I can't control everything. That's the one thing that led my family down this path in the first place!
string: 我必须停止这种行为。接受我无法控制一切的事实。这正是让我的家人走上这条道路的根本原因！

original: So I owe you an apology for my behavior. Making you feel bad to manipulate you was childish of me.
string: 所以我应该为我的行为向你道歉。让你感到难过并操纵你，这是我的幼稚行为。

original: It's alright, Serana. I know how hard your life has been.
string: 没关系，塞拉娜。我知道你的生活有多艰难。

original: I suppose that's why I couldn't accept your mortality. I don't want to lose another family.
string: 我想这就是我无法接受你死亡的原因。我不想再失去一个家人。

original: But this is how life is. I should just cherish whatever time we have left.
string: 但生活就是这样。我应该珍惜我们剩下的时间。

original: If you can do that, then I promise I'll make it as joyful as possible.
string: 如果你能做到这一点，那么我保证我会让它尽可能地快乐。

original: Thank you.
string: 谢谢。

original: I'm glad you're the one who woke me up that day.
string: 这感觉...很不错。谢谢。

original: Maybe you can turn me again once this ends. I don't want this to end either.
string: 也许这一切结束后，你可以再次把我变成这样。我也不想结束这一切。

original: I don't want to talk about this anymore. Let's just leave. Please.
string: 我不想再谈这个了。我们走吧。拜托。

original: Do you realize how impractical this armor is?
string: 你知道这件盔甲有多么不实用吗？

original: Something tells me you like what you're seeing.
string: 有东西告诉我你喜欢你所看到的。

original: Ugh... Enjoying yourself?
string: 呃……玩得开心吗？

original: Right behind you.
string: 我跟着你走。

original: That's it?
string: 就这样吗？

original: Right. Lead the way.
string: 好的，带路吧。

original: "Creature of the night"? That's a new one. I like it!
string: “夜行生物"？这是个新词，我喜欢！

original: I'm honestly surprised you could tell so quickly. Not bad!
string: 说实话我很惊讶你能这么快就看出来。不错！

original: "Creature of the night"? That's a new one. I like it!
string: “夜行生物"？这是个新词，我喜欢！

original: But to answer your question, no. Not anymore.
string: 但回答你的问题，不。现在不会了。

original: I've had encounters with your kind before. None seemed to be civilized like you though. I suppose that's a good sign.
string: 我以前也遇到过你们这种人。不过似乎没有人像你们这样文明。我想这是个好兆头。

original: I thought as much. Your eyes do seem normal, but I just wanted to be sure.
string: 我也是这么想的。你的眼睛确实看起来很正常，但我只是想确定一下。

original: So... We're good?
string: 那么……我们很好吗？

original: I didn't expect I'd ever hang out with a creature of the night.
string: 我没想到我会与夜行生物混在一起。

original: Your skin is rather pale. You're not a creature of the night, are you?
string: 你的皮肤很苍白。你不是夜行动物，对吧？

original: Aye. Although I'll be keeping an eye on you for the time being. I hope you understand.
string: 是的。不过我暂时会关注你的。希望你能理解。

original: Yeah, no problem. In fact, that just makes you more reliable than our friend here.
string: 是的，没问题。事实上，这让你比我们这里的朋友更可靠。

original: Ha! Are you really that susceptible to a pretty face?
string: 哈！你真的那么容易被美丽的脸蛋所吸引吗？

original: Anyway, if you're an ally, then I say well met. You may call me Mjoll.
string: 总之，如果你是我的盟友，那我就说 “幸会 ”了。你可以叫我穆月尔。

original: And you may call me Serana. Nice to meet you.
string: 你可以叫我瑟拉娜，很高兴见到你。

original: Let's get indoors. Or in a cave. Anywhere, Just out of this.
string: 我们回到室内或是找个洞穴吧。哪里都行，可以避开太阳都好。

original: How can you say that? The weather is incredible today!
string: 你怎么能这么说呢？今天的天气真是太棒了！

original: Of course you'd say that...
string: 你当然会这么说……

original: You haven't traveled much, have you, Serana?
string: 你没有去过很多地方旅行，是吗，瑟拉娜？

original: Is it that obvious?
string: 那么明显吗？

original: I can tell by your look. You're like a little girl who's discovering something new everyday. It's rather adorable to be honest!
string: 我从你的表情就看出来。你就像一个每天都在发现新事物的小女孩。说实话，这相当可爱！

original: I guess it is... What about you?
string: 我想是的……那你呢？

original: I've been adventuring across Tamriel since I was a fresh-faced young woman barely able to swing a blade.
string: 自从我还是一个稚气未脱的小女孩，甚至很难挥舞一把剑的时候我就开始在泰姆瑞尔冒险了。

original: My travels have taken me from High Rock to Valenwood, Elsweyr to Morrowind and all points in between.
string: 我的旅程途径高岩和威伦森林，艾斯维尔和晨风之间的所有地方。

original: Aww, don't be like that! You have your whole life ahead of you! Commit to your passions, woman! You only get to live once!
string: 别这样！你还有大好人生等着你！投入你的激情吧，女人！人生只有一次！

original: Well, now I'm jealous.
string: 好吧，现在我嫉妒了。

original: I will. Thanks, Mjoll.
string: 我会的。谢谢，穆月尔。

original: Anytime, friend.
string: 随时欢迎，朋友。

original: Ahh... It feels good to adventure with Grimsever again. Just like the old times.
string: 啊……再次和无情切割者一起冒险感觉真好。就像以前一样。

original: What's so special about your sword anyway? I mean, I know glass is a rare material, but couldn't you just buy a new sword and call it a day?
string: 你的剑有什么特别之处？我的意思是，我知道玻璃是一种稀有材料，但你就不能买把新剑就算完事了吗？

original: You don't understand! I've been wielding Grimsever since my early adventuring days. It's special to me.
string: 你不明白！自从我冒险以来，我就一直使用无情切割者。它对我来说很特别。

original: Oh please, I've been sleeping with a dagger since the First Era and I don't go around calling it my irreplaceable partner.
string: 哦，拜托，自从第一纪元以来，我就一直和一把匕首一起睡觉，我不会到处称它为我不可替代的伙伴。

original: Look, it's not easy to explain, but giving a name to your sword gives meaning to your journey. Like an oath to an ideal when you begin your adventure
string: 听着，这很难解释，但给你的剑起个名字会给你的旅程带来意义。就像你开始冒险时对理想的誓言一样 。

original: Oh. I see.
string: 哦，明白了...

original: You know what? You should try it! Why don't you give your dagger a name?
string: 你知道吗？你应该试试！为什么不给你的匕首起个名字呢？

original: Uhh... No. Sorry.
string: 呃…不，抱歉。

original: Oh well... Suit yourself.
string: 哦好吧……随你便吧。

original: Here, Mjoll. I made you a few potions.
string: 给，穆月尔。我给你做了一些药水。

original: Thank you! How thoughtful!
string: 谢谢！太贴心了！

original: It's nothing. Alchemy is one of my strong suits, anyway, so I may as well put it to good use.
string: 没什么。无论如何，炼金术是我的强项之一，所以我必须好好利用它。

original: Now you're beginning to think like a true adventurer! Use your skills selflessly for the benefit of others.
string: 现在你开始像一个真正的冒险家一样思考了！无私地运用你的技能造福他人。

original: No, I just... Thought it would be more practical if you had them.
string: 不，我只是……认为如果你有它们的话会更实用。

original: "Selfless" just isn't exactly a word you'd associate with... Someone who once worshipped a... A Daedra, would you?
string: “无私”这个词根本不适合用来形容…… 曾经崇拜过…… 迪德拉的人，你会这么说吗？

original: Well if that's the case, then why did you give them to me in the first place?
string: 如果是这样的话，那你为什么一开始要把它们给我呢？

original: Well... I just thought you should have them. You fight in the front lines, so you'll need all the help you can get.
string: 嗯……我只是觉得你应该有它们。你在前线作战，所以你需要尽可能多的帮助。

original: So you were worried about my wellbeing and gave them to me expecting nothing in return. That's selflessness in its purest form, if not kindness.
string: 所以你担心我的幸福，所以把它们给了我，不求回报。这可以说是最纯粹的无私，甚至可以说是仁慈。

original: And that is the core principle of an adventurer in my book. You're a good person, Serana, and don't let anything make you doubt it.
string: 在我看来，这就是冒险家的核心原则。瑟拉娜，你是个好人，不要让任何事情让你怀疑这一点。

original: Yeah... Thanks.
string: 啊，谢谢……

original: Huh?
string: 嗯？

original: Well, aren't you the pretty one. I bet all men chase after you.
string: 嗯，你真漂亮。我敢打赌所有男人都会追你的。

original: Jealous much, sister? Or is there something else you want to tell me?
string: 吃醋了吗，姐妹？或者你还有什么想告诉我的？

original: You're not supposed to be here.
string: 你不该出现在这里......。

original: I know you for what you are. This town's blood is ours! Leave it! Now we must return to our roles, lest the sheep suspect the wolves.
string: 我知道你是什么生物，整个城镇的血都是我们的，先放下！我们先做正事以免羊群产生怀疑...

original: Yeah, yeah, I'll--
string: 是的，是的，我会——

original: Wait, "ours"?
string: 等等，“我们的”？

original: I'm warning you! Back off!
string: 我警告你。别过来！ !

original: You have the subtlety of a drunken skeever, you know that?
string: 你知道吗，你的狡猾程度就如同醉鬼一般？

original: You're not the first Volkihar I've faced, girl! And you won't be the last!
string: 你不是我遇到的第一个沃基哈尔，姑娘！而且你也不会是最后一个！

original: Don't underestimate the enemy vampire! She's a Volkihar!
string: 不要低估敌人的吸血鬼！她是一个沃基哈尔！

original: You are new, yes?
string: 你是新来的吧？

original: In the College? No, not really. I learned magic on my own long ago, so I'm not here to attend to class.
string: 在学院？不，不是。我很久以前就自学了魔法，所以我不是来上课的。

original: I am. You're a mage, are you? A student from Winterhold, for what I can see.
string: 我是。你是法师吧？看样子是来自冬堡的学生。

original: It's good to have another mage in the team. I wonder if modern magic can keep up with mine.
string: 队伍里多一位法师总是好的。不知当代的魔法能否与我的法术媲美。

original: Ha! Finally, a worthy rival for J'zargo!
string: 哈！终于，杰'扎格有了一个值得尊敬的对手！

original: You sure about that? I thought you were an apprentice.
string: 你确定？你不是学徒吗？

original: Perhaps, in a school or two. But when it comes to destruction, J'zargo could challenge the Archmage himself!
string: 在某两种派系方面，也许是的。但论毁灭系，杰'扎格可以挑战学院大法师本人！

original: Okay, then let's call 'em! Like, right now.
string: 好的，那我们现在就去找他！

original: No! I-I mean... J'zargo wouldn't want our good Archmage to get hurt.
string: 不！我，我是说……杰'扎格不想让我们尊敬的大法师受伤。

original: That's fine, whiskers. I'm sure the average bandit will do.
string: 没问题，胡须儿。我相信一般的强盗都可以做到。

original: Don't call J'zargo "whiskers". It's humiliating!
string: 不要叫杰'扎格“胡须儿”。这听起来太丢人了！

original: Right. Sorry, J'zargo. And nice to meet you. I'm Serana.
string: 好的。抱歉，杰'扎格。很高兴认识你。我是瑟拉娜。

original: Nice to meet you as well. J'zargo's name is--
string: 我也很高兴认识你。杰'扎格的名字是——

original: Hold up! How do you know J'zargo's name is J'zargo?!
string: 等等！你怎么知道杰'扎格的名字是杰'扎格？！

original: Ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈！

original: I like him! He breaks the monotony.
string: 我喜欢他！他打破了沉闷。

original: By the moons, it's cold!
string: 月亮在上，这可真够冷的！

original: You have fur all over your body. How are you cold?
string: 你浑身都是毛，怎么会感觉冷啊？

original: J'zargo was born in the warm lands of Elsweyr. His fur can't handle this cold Oblivion!
string: 杰'扎格出生在艾斯维尔的温暖土地上。他的皮毛无法承受这寒冷的湮灭！

original: Um... What do you mean by "the warm lands of elsewhere"?
string: 嗯……你说的“别处的温暖土地”是什么意思？

original: No! The warm lands of Elsweyr.
string: 不！艾斯维尔的温暖土地。

original: That's what I said. Elsewhere.
string: 那正是我说的，别处。

original: Elsweyr! J'zargo is talking about his homeland, dammit!
string: 艾斯维尔！杰'扎格正在谈论他的家乡，该死！

original: Yeah, I'd figure your homeland would be elsewhere.
string: 是的，我认为你的家乡会在别处。

original: Are you messing with J'zargo?!
string: 你是在跟杰'扎格捣乱吗？！

original: Mmmmmaybe.
string: 嗯，也许吧。

original: What is Elsweyr?
string: 艾斯维尔是什么？

original: Hey, look! I found an amethyst!
string: 嘿，看！我发现了一块紫水晶！

original: What?! No! Give it to J'zargo! He saw it first!
string: 什么？！不！把它给杰'扎格！他先看到的！

original: Too late, whiskers!
string: 太迟了，胡须！

original: So how's your progress on the expert level destruction spells, J'zargo?
string: 那么，杰'扎格，你在专家级毁灭法术方面的进展如何？

original: J'zargo is close to reaching his goal. Our enemies make for excellent practice, after all.
string: 杰'扎格已经接近目标了。毕竟，我们的敌人是极好的练习对象。

original: See, that's what I wanted to talk about. You almost hit me during our last battle!
string: 瞧，这就是我想说的。上次战斗时你差点打到我！

original: He did? J'zargo never noticed...
string: 他注意到了吗？杰'扎格从来没注意到……

original: That's the problem. You lose control when you fight! You need to learn to hold back.
string: 这就是问题所在。打架的时候你会失去控制！你需要学会克制。

original: But J'zargo has to fight at full power! How will he ever defeat his enemies otherwise?
string: 但杰'扎格必须全力以赴！否则他怎么能打败敌人呢？

original: That's what the rest of us are here for, J'zargo! You need to remember that you're part of a team now!
string: 这就是我们其他人在这里的目的，杰'扎格！你需要记住，你现在是团队的一员！

original: We look after each other, and we are careful with our attacks. Wielding magic requires a great sense of responsibility.
string: 我们互相照顾，并且小心谨慎地进行攻击。使用魔法需要很强的责任感。

original: Now you sound just like Tolfdir...
string: 现在你听起来就像托夫迪尔……

original: Well, if two people have told you already, then there must be some truth to it. Wouldn't you agree?
string: 好吧，如果已经有两个人告诉你了，那么其中肯定有一定道理。你难道不同意？

original: Maybe... J'zargo sees your point, friend. He will try to be more careful with his spells in the future.
string: 也许……杰'扎格明白你的意思，朋友。他以后会更小心地使用咒语。

original: And J'zargo apologizes for any harm that may have befallen you due to his recklessness.
string: 杰'扎格对由于他的鲁莽行为给您造成的任何伤害表示歉意。

original: Serana accepts your apology.
string: 瑟拉娜接受你的道歉。

original: You're traveling with us too, right?
string: 你也和我们一起旅行吧？

original: Yeah. My name is Serana. It's a pleasure to meet you.
string: 是的。我叫瑟拉娜。很高兴认识你。

original: Oh, the pleasure is all mine. I am Erandur. Priest of Mara.
string: 噢，我很荣幸。我是依兰杜尔。玛拉的祭司。

original: Oh...
Is something wrong?
string: 有什么问题吗？

original: No, sorry. It's nothing. I...
string: 不，对不起。没什么。我……

original: You used to worship a Daedric Prince?
string: 你曾经崇拜过迪德拉君王吗？

original: Well... Yes. How could you tell?
string: 嗯……是的。你怎么看出来的？

original: You had the look of remorse as soon as the divines were brought up. We carry the same weight, you and I.
string: 一提起圣灵，你就一脸懊悔...我们肩负着同样的重担，你和我。

original: You mean... You used to worship one too?
string: 你的意思是……你以前也崇拜过一个？

original: I did. Which is why I know the strength and courage it takes to abandon that way of life.
string: 是的。因此我知道放弃这种生活方式需要多大的力量和勇气。

original: So don't let my devotion to the divines get in the way. We're all friends here.
string: 所以，不要让我对圣灵的虔诚妨碍你。我们都是朋友。

original: That's good to know. Thanks.
string: 很高兴知道。谢谢。

original: Here. Have some gold, Erandur.
string: 给。拿点金子，依兰杜尔。

original: What? No, no! I can't accept it.
string: 什么？不，不！我不能接受。

original: You're almost out of coins! What are you spending them on, anyway?
string: 你的钱快花光了！你都用这些金币买什么了？

original: Charity.
string: 慈善。

original: I thought as much... But you're giving away too much!
string: 我想也是……但是你送得太多了！

original: I can get by with the bare minimum. Just enough to eat and rent a room.
string: 我只需要最低限度的生活费，够吃饭和租屋就好。

original: And what about maintenance? You'll need that gold to keep your equipment in good condition!
string: 那保养呢？你需要钱来是你的装备处于良好状态！

original: I am a healer first, and a fighter second, Serana. I barely use my weapon in combat anyway, so it would be a waste.
string: 我首先是个治疗师，其次才是战士，瑟拉娜。反正我很少在战斗中使用武器，所以这太浪费了。.

original: And what if our enemies figure our formation out and corner you? That mace won't do you any good without maintenance!
string: 如果敌人看透了我们的阵型，把你逼入绝境怎么办？如果不好好保养，这把钉锤对你一点用都没有！

original: I know your intentions are good, but your charity will hurt our cause if you don't save up for yourself! So just take the coins, alright?
string: 我知道你的意图是好的，但如果你不为自己存钱的话，你的慈善事业就会损害我们的事业！所以就拿硬币吧，好吗？

original: I can't accept them, Serana. I understand what you're telling me, but those coins will be better served by those who really need them.
string: 我不能接受它们，瑟拉娜。我明白你的意思，但这些硬币更适合真正需要它们的人。

original: If you have no use for them either, then give them away. And in return, I promise to save up more Septims for myself from now on.
string: 如果你也用不着它们，那就把它们送给别人吧。作为回报，我保证以后会为自己存更多的塞普汀。

original: Fine. I'll join your charity initiative. But you better keep your end of the deal!
string: 好吧。我会加入你的慈善活动。但你最好遵守约定！

original: Don't take it as a defeat, my daughter. You'll find that helping an unfortunate soul have a brighter day is a gratifying experience.
string: 别把这当成失败，我的女儿。你会发现，帮助一个不幸的人度过美好的一天，是一种令人欣慰的经历。

original: Um... Erandur?
string: 呃……依兰杜尔？

original: Yes, my daughter? What is it I can help with?
string: 啊，我的姑娘，有什么可以帮你的吗？ ?

original: Well, I... Can I ask you something personal? I know we just met and all, but...
string: 嗯，我……我可以问你一些私人问题吗？我知道我们才刚认识，但是……

original: Of course, Serana. I don't have anything to hide from my friends.
string: 当然，瑟拉娜。我没什么可对我的朋友隐瞒的。

original: Well, I just wanted to know... After all you did as a priest of Vaermina, how did you manage to face the divines?
string: 好吧，我只是想知道……作为瓦尔迷纳的牧师，你做了这么多，之后是如何面对圣灵的？

original: It wasn't an easy choice. For a long time I was... Lost. Disoriented. I struggled a lot with my own sense of self-worth.
string: 这不是一个容易的选择。很长一段时间我都……迷失了方向。我为自己的自我价值感而苦苦挣扎。

original: The priest of Mara who found me simply opened a path for me, but it was one I had to walk down on my own.
string: 找到我的玛拉牧师只是为我开辟了一条道路，但这条道路我必须独自走下去。

original: It took me a long time to face my regrets and acknowledge my wrongdoings, but in the end, I found the courage to move forward.
string: 我花了很长时间才面对自己的遗憾并承认自己的错误，但最终，我还是鼓起勇气继续前进。

original: It must have been difficult for you.
string: 对你来说这一定很困难。

original: It was. But the divines have as much faith in us as we have on them. That is why they grant second chances to those who seek to right their wrongs.
string: 确实如此。但圣灵们对我们的信任程度与我们对他们的信任程度一样高。这就是为什么他们给予那些试图改正错误的人第二次机会。

original: I doubt it's that easy.
string: 我怀疑这是否那么容易。

original: It's not, but that's what makes the journey worth the effort. It's a test of your willingness to change.
string: 这并不，但正因为如此，这段旅程才值得付出努力。这是对你改变意愿的考验。

original: You don't have to take the step right away. Like I said, it's not an easy choice.
string: 你不必立即采取行动。正如我所说，这不是一个容易的选择。

original: So I want you to know that whenever you feel ready to move forward, I'll gladly lend you my support.
string: 所以我想让你们知道，无论何时，只要你们准备好继续前进，我都会很乐意给予你们支持。

original: I... I appreciate it. Thank you, Erandur.
string: 我……我很感激。谢谢你，依兰杜尔。

original: There's no need to thank me, Serana. That's what friends are for.
string: 没有必要感谢我，瑟拉娜。朋友就是这么存在。

original: I'd like to borrow some history books.
string: 我想借一些历史书。

original: And I would like you to be more specific. Tamriel has over six thousand years of history, you know.
string: 我希望你能说得更具体一些。你知道，泰姆瑞尔有六千多年的历史。

original: It's for my friend here. She wants to catch up on recent history.
string: 这是给我朋友的。她想了解一下最近发生的历史。

original: Does she now? Well, in that case, I can think of a few books that explore the events of the late Third Era. More or less, anyway.
string: 她想了解？好吧，既然如此，我能想到几本书，它们探讨了第三纪元末期的事件。无论如何，或多或少。

original: I can point you towards four merchants that probably have those. It'll be quite the trip through the province though.
string: 我可以告诉你四个可能有这些东西的商家。不过，这是穿过整个省的旅途。

original: Hold up! Don't you have them in the library?
string: 等等！你们图书馆里没有吗？

original: I do, but these books are meant to be used exclusively by members of the college. And your friend here is not.
string: 有，但这些书是专门供学院成员使用的。而你的朋友并不是。

original: I'm sorry, but there's nothing I can do about it. Archmage's orders.
string: 抱歉，我无能为力。这是大法师的命令。

original: Fine. Where can I find these merchants?
string: 好的。我在哪里可以找到这些商家？

original: I know you're probably sick of hearing this, but it is all in this note.
string: 我知道你可能听烦了这些，但这一切都在这张纸条里。

original: You do know I'm the Archmage, do you?
string: 你知道我是大法师，对吧？

original: Oh yeah. I guess I forgot that the Psijic Order suddenly appeared out of nowhere and said:
string: 哦，是的。我猜我忘了赛伊克教团突然不知从哪里冒出来并说道：

original: "Hey! See that kid that joined the College last week? Yeah, put 'em in charge!"
string: “嘿！看到上周加入学院的那个孩子了吗？对，让他们负责！”

original: Here you go, all four of them. Tell her to be careful.
string: 给你，四本都给你。告诉她要小心拿。

original: Do you have the book "A Brief History of the Empire, v4"? (20 gold)
string: 您有《帝国简史·卷4》这本书吗？（20 金币）

original: Of course.
string: 当然。

original: Do you have the book "Where were you when the Dragon Broke"? (20 gold)
string: 你有《龙破时你在何方》这本书吗？（20 金币）

original: Of course.
string: 当然。

original: Do you have the book "Battle of Red Mountain"? (20 gold)
string: 你有《红山之战》这本书吗？（20金币）

original: Of course.
string: 当然。

original: Do you have the book "The Oblivion Crisis"? (20 gold)
string: 你有《湮灭危机》这本书吗？（20金币）

original: No! Now go away!
string: 不！现在走开！

original: Ha ha ha ha ha ha! Yeah, uh... That's-that's... That's a little joke.
string: 哈哈哈哈哈哈！是的，呃……那是……那是个小玩笑。

original: Don't look at me like that! Here you go!
string: 别用那种眼神看着我！给你！

original: Remind me why we're taking a field trip into a nordic crypt. I think I had enough with the one in which I was locked away.
string: 提醒下我，为什么我们又要去钻诺德墓穴。我觉得之前关我的那个已经够受了。

original: Sorry. But I have a job to do here for the Jarl of Whiterun.
string: 抱歉。但我得完成白漫领主交给我的任务。

original: Oh, you didn't tell me that. I assume you have to retrieve something?
string: 哦，你没告诉我。我猜你是要去拿什么东西吧？

original: Yes, a stone tablet. It might help us learn more about the Dragons.
string: 是的，一块石板。它也许能帮助我们更多地了解龙。

original: And you're certain it's there?
string: 你确定它在那里吗？

original: The guy who hired me was pretty vague about it, to be honest.
string: 说实话，雇我的那人说得挺含糊的。

original: Oh, so we're chasing rumors. Wonderful...
string: 哦，所以咱们是在追查传闻啊。真棒……

original: Yesss...?
string: 是吗……？

original: Oh yeah, that really fills me with so much confidence...
string: 哦是啊，这话可真让人信心百倍呢……

original: That claw has ancient nordic totems engraved in it. It could be important. Hold onto it.
string: 那只爪子上刻有古老的诺德图腾。那可能很重要。抓着它 。

original: So the tablet was here, after all. At least this wasn't a wasted trip.
string: 原来石板就在这里。至少没有白跑一趟。

original: Fus...
string: 伏斯……

original: Umm... What?
string: 嗯……啥？

original: Fus...
string: 伏斯……

original: What are you mumbling about?
string: 你在嘟囔什么？

original: Oh! Sorry! I spaced out for a second.
string: 哦！对不起！我刚才有点走神了。

original: Not the best place to be absent-minded, wouldn't you agree?
string: 这可不是个适合心不在焉的“好”地方，你说呢？

original: Come on. Let's get out of here.
string: 快点，我们离开这里吧。

original: Are you sure you're ready to fight a dragon? This is no ordinary beast. We're talking about nigh divine being!
string: 你确定自己准备好和龙战斗了吗？这可不是普通的野兽。我们面对的近乎九圣灵般的存在！

original: I'm not sure... The memory of Helgen is still fresh.
string: 不好说……海尔根的惨剧我依旧记忆犹新。
