original: I can't imagine how traumatic something like that must have been like. I hope you're not forcing yourself to do this.
string: 我无法想象那件事给你留下了多深的创伤。希望你不是在勉强自己这样做。

original: But don't worry! I'll be there with you. We can do this!
string: 但别担心！我会和你在一起。我们可以做到！

original: Yes. And if that's the same dragon as Helgen's, then it's time for reckoning!
string: 是的。如果这是和海尔根那时一样的龙，那么就到了算账的时候了！

original: I know this is personal for you, but if you rush into battle without a plan, you won't achieve anything!
string: 我知道这对你来说很重要，但是如果你没有计划就仓促投入战斗，那么你将一事无成！

original: Just promise me you'll be careful! Dragons are as cunning as they're mighty!
string: 答应我你会小心的！龙既狡猾又强大！

original: You are no ordinary fighter either. We can do this if we work together!
string: 你也不是普通的战士。只要我们齐心协力，我们就能做到！

original: I'm glad you find me reliable, but I don't really get along with fire. Remember?
string: 我很高兴你觉得我很可靠，但我真的不太喜欢火。记得吗？

original: We defeated Durnehviir back in the Soul Cairn. This shouldn't be any different.
string: 我们在灵魂石冢击败了杜耐维尔。这次应该也没什么不同。

original: Yeah, although back then we fought alongside my mother, and she's much more powerful than I am.
string: 是啊，不过当时是和我妈妈并肩作战，她可比我要强大得多。

original: I hope that the city guards can make up for that, but I don't think they'll live up to the standard. Many will die.
string: 但愿城里的卫兵们能弥补这个差距，但我觉得他们达不到那种水准。会死很多人。

original: Don't worry! That's what I'm here for.
string: 别担心！这就是我来这里的目的。

original: I appreciate it, but try not to get roasted on my account, okay?
string: 谢了，不过可别为了我变成“烤肉干”呀，好吗？

original: Come on, we can do this! I know we can!
string: 加油，我们能行的，一定可以！

original: So... Dragonborn, huh? Now there's an interesting turn for you.
string: 所以……龙裔，嗯？你身上可算有个有趣的转变了。

original: No kidding! I'm still trying to process this...
string: 别开玩笑了！我还在努力处理这件事……

original: Yeah, I suppose it's a lot to take in, but that doesn't necessarily make it a bad thing.
string: 是啊，我想这确实需要点时间消化，但这未必是件坏事。

original: Unless you hate being the center of attention, because if that's the case... I have some bad news for you.
string: 除非你讨厌成为众人瞩目的焦点，要真是这样……那我可有个坏消息要告诉你。

original: Anyway, let's get back to Whiterun. I... I need to cool down after this whole ordeal.
string: 不管怎样，我们还是先回白漫城吧。我……我需要冷静一下。

original: I know! This is so cool!
string: 我知道！这太酷了！

original: Um... Good for you?
string: 嗯……这对你有好处么？

original: Anyway, let's get back to Whiterun. I... I need to cool down after this whole ordeal.
string: 不管怎样，我们还是先回白漫城吧。我……我需要冷静一下。

original: That explains why I was able to read that word on the wall.
string: 这也解释了为什么我能够读懂墙上的那串文字。

original: Wait, you mean what you were muttering earlier? Interesting. I wonder if other nordic tombstone walls will have the same effect on you.
string: 等等，你是说你之前嘀咕的那句话吗？有意思。 不知道其他诺德碑墙会不会对你产生同样的效果。

original: Anyway, let's get back to Whiterun. I... I need to cool down after this whole ordeal.
string: 不管怎样，我们还是先回白漫城吧。我……我需要冷静一下。

original: I always admired the nord heroes of old! To think I'd become one myself...
string: 我一直很崇拜古代的诺德英雄！没想到我也能成为其中的一员……

original: You did? Well, lucky you!
string: 你做到了？好吧，你真幸运！

original: Although I hope that you plan on proving that. Having powers alone doesn't make you a hero, you know?
string: 不过我希望你能证明这一点。光有力量可成不了英雄，你懂的吧？

original: Come on! We can figure this whole thing later. Let's get back to Whiterun.
string: 来吧！我们可以稍后再弄清楚这件事。先回白漫城吧。

original: So this is what Durnehviir meant when we last spoke.
string: 这就是我们上次谈话时杜耐维尔所指的意思。

original: Oh yeah, he did call you "fellow Dovah". I guess that makes you family, huh?
string: 哦对，他确实叫你“同胞杜瓦”。看来你们算是一家人了，对吧？

original: In a... Weird way, I guess?
string: 某种……意义上来说，我想？

original: Forget I said anything. Let's get back to Whiterun.
string: 忘掉我说的吧。咱们得回白漫城了。

original: Really? You gave me some good reasons to kill him. I thought you'd disagree.
string: 真的吗？你给了我充分理由去杀掉他。我以为你会不同意。

original: No! I just tried to think about this situation from Delphine's perspective. That doesn't mean I agreed with it.
string: 不！我只是试着从戴尔芬的角度考虑这个问题。但这并不意味着我同意她的观点。

original: What concerns me are the Blades. If Delphine's leadership indoctrinates them into killing Dragons indiscriminately, they'll become fanatics!
string: 我担心的是刀锋会。如果戴尔芬的领导向他们灌输滥杀龙族的思想，他们就会变成狂热分子！

original: Not to mention that they will discourage any Dragons from following Paarthurnax's example.
string: 更何况，他们还会阻止其他龙族效仿帕图纳克斯的道路。

original: History would repeat itself...
string: 历史将会重演……

original: I don't think they can accomplish that without me. I'm done with them.
string: 我不认为他们在没有我的情况下能做到这一点。我和他们已经结束了。

original: It's not impossible to kill a dragon without your help, and without Alduin to bring them back, they may as well die forever.
string: 没有你的帮助，杀死一条龙也不是不可能，而且如果没有奥杜因让它们复活，它们可能会永远死去。

original: But, then again, Paarthurnax has managed to survive for this long, so maybe they just need to lay low to avoid them.
string: 但是，话又说回来，帕图纳克斯能存活这么久，也许它们只是需要低调地避开它们。

original: In any case, I agree with you. Nothing good comes out of having an ally that refuses to listen. Let's get out of here.
string: 无论如何，我同意你的观点。有一个不听劝告的盟友是不会有好结果的。我们走吧

original: They serve me. It will take time, but I'll make them understand.
string: 他们为我服务。这需要时间，但我会让他们明白。

original: I hope you're right. Your authority might help you to keep Delphine and Esbern in check. Ensure that the future generations are more open-minded.
string: 我希望你是对的。你的权威也许能帮你管住戴尔芬和伊思本。确保后辈们的思想更加开放。

original: At least the dilemma was resolved peacefully. We can leave it be for now.
string: 至少，这个难题得到了和平解决。我们可以暂时不去管它。

original: Is something the matter?
string: 有什么问题吗？

original: Yeah. Now that we've... Well, dealt with my father, I think that it's safe for my mother to return to our world.
string: 是啊。既然我们已经……处理了我父亲的事，我想我母亲应该可以安全返回我们的世界了。

original: We have to go to the Soul Cairn and tell her. She doesn't have a way of knowing what's going on out here.
string: 我们必须去灵魂石冢告诉她。她根本不知道这里发生了什么。

original: Besides, who knows what the Ideal Masters will do to her this time if we don't get her out of there soon.
string: 此外，如果我们不尽快把她救出来，谁知道理想之主这次会对她做什么。

original: Yes. It is done.
string: 是的，已经完成了。

original: I see.
string: 明白了。

original: I hoped that you wouldn't have to do it yourself. You didn't have to.
string: 我希望你不必亲自去做这件事。你没必要这么做。

original: No, I did have to! This was my responsibility as much as it was...!
string: 不，我必须这么做！这对我来说是责任……！

original: Mine?
string: 开采 ?

original: You should have come with us...
string: 你应该和我们一起去……

original: Even if we managed to defeat father by ourselves... It would have been easier for me if you had been there!
string: 就算我们能靠自己打败父亲……但有你在场的话，对我来说会轻松得多！

original: A part of me was still afraid of him. And even if my friend helped me face him... I needed you there.
string: 我心里还是有点怕他。即使我的朋友帮我面对他……我还是需要你在身边。

original: I am sorry. I didn't want you to face this ordeal on your own. I just couldn't face him.
string: 抱歉。我本不想让你独自面对这场磨难。只是我实在无法面对他。

original: But for what it's worth, I commend your courage. You went through lengths I did not dare to go.
string: 尽管如此，我仍钦佩你的勇气。你走过了我不敢涉足的艰险之路。

original: I know I can't fix the damage for which I am responsible. But I will make it up to you. Things will be different from now on. I promise.
string: 我知道我无法弥补我所造成的损失。但我会补偿你的，从今往后，一切都会不同。我保证。

original: You mean it?
string: 你是认真的吗？

original: Of course, dear. You deserve that much.
string: 当然，亲爱的。你值得拥有这一切。

original: We'll talk later.
string: 我们稍后再谈。

original: You think things will get better between you and your mother?
string: 你认为你和你母亲之间的关系会变得更好吗？

original: I think so, yeah. I can tell she regrets all she put me through, so there's no point in holding a grudge against her any longer.
string: 是的，我想是的。我能看出来她很后悔让我经历的一切，所以再对她怀恨在心也没意义了。

original: I admit things still feel a little awkward between us, but I think it'll go away soon. We just need a little time to re-adjust.
string: 我承认我们之间仍然有些隔阂，但我想很快就会消散。我们只是需要一点时间来重新调整。

original: So you're not going to live with her?
string: 那么你不打算和她一起住吗？

original: Hmm... Not yet. I mean, what kind of adult lives with her mother in this day and age?
string: 嗯……还没有。我的意思是，现在哪个成年人会和母亲住在一起？

original: Even still, I'd appreciate it if we went to visit her from time to time. She's a better alchemist than I am, so maybe she'll have something for us.
string: 尽管如此，如果我们能时不时去看她，我还是会很感激的。她的炼金术比我高明，所以也许她能给我们带来一些东西。

original: Ah, Serana! Welcome back! How have you been?
string: 啊，瑟拉娜！欢迎回来！你过得怎么样？

original: Oh, you know. Me and my friend against the world. A simultaneously stimulating and stressful experience.
string: 哦，你知道的。我和我的朋友对抗世界。既刺激又紧张的体验。

original: I don't envy you one bit. The outside world is something I'd like to stay away from for the time being.
string: 我一点也不羡慕你。外面的世界是我暂时想远离的东西。

original: Besides, with the Soul Cairn's resources, I may consider setting up shop sometime in the future. And I could use an associate.
string: 此外，有了灵魂石冢的资源，我可能会考虑将来开店。而且我还需要一名合伙人。

original: I appreciate the offer, but you know I can't stay at one place for too long, mother.
string: 我很感激你的好意，但是妈妈，你知道我不能在一个地方呆太久。

original: No need for that, you can--
string: 没必要，你可以——

original: And I am NOT becoming your delivery girl.
string: 而且我不会成为你的送货女郎。

original: Shame.
string: 可惜。

original: By the way, I have some spare potions and soul gems for the two of you. Help yourself to whatever you need.
string: 顺便说一下，我给你们俩留了一些药水和灵魂石。你们需要什么就拿去吧。

original: Don't mind if we do.
string: 如果我们这样做了，请不要介意。

original: I hope mother can return the courtyard to the way it was. You'll love it when you see it.
string: 希望妈妈能把这个院子恢复原来的样子，你看了一定会喜欢的。

original: Serana?
string: 瑟拉娜？

original: Ah, Serana! You're back! How was your journey?
string: 啊，瑟拉娜！你回来了！你的旅途怎么样？

original: Mostly fun... Except for the times we go dungeon-delving. He has a tendency to keep his head underground.
string: 大部分时间都很有趣……除了我们去地牢探险的时候。他倾向于把头埋在地下。

original: Mostly fun... Except for the times we go dungeon-delving. She has a tendency to keep her head underground.
string: 大部分时间都很有趣……除了我们去地牢探险的时候。她倾向于把头埋在地下。

original: This is why you come to visit?! To replenish supplies?! Am I that irrelevant in your life?!
string: 这就是你来找我的理由吗？！补充物资？！我在你的生活里就这么无关紧要吗？！

original: What?! No! That's not what I...!
string: 什么？！不是这样的！我不是这个意思…！

original: I jest, dear! Of course I have supplies for you! For me it's enough to be able to talk to you from time to time.
string: 开玩笑的，亲爱的！我当然为你准备了物资！对我来说能跟你时常见面聊天就够了。

original: Um... Thanks.
string: 嗯……谢谢。

original: My mother's not the joking type! Should I be worried?
string: 我妈妈可不是会开玩笑的人！我是不是该担心？

original: Speaking of which, we're a little short on resources. I was hoping we could borrow some potions and soul gems.
string: 说起来，我们的物资有点短缺。我希望能借一些药水和灵魂石。

original: Of course, dear. What is--
string: 当然，亲爱的。什么是——

original: Oh my...!
string: 噢天哪……！

original: I suppose you can tell by looking at my eyes, can you?
string: 我想你只要看我的眼睛就能看出来，对吗？

original: You're mortal.
string: 你是凡人。

original: How could you do this?! After all we sacrificed, you're throwing away your gift of immortality?!
string: 你怎么能这样做？！我们做出了这么多牺牲，你却要抛弃你永生的天赋？！

original: Look, if you just let me explain...!
string: 听着，如果你让我解释一下……！

original: And what now?! I spent an eternity separated from you, and now that we're finally together I have to watch you die?!
string: 现在怎么办？！我和你分开了这么久，现在我们终于在一起了，我却要看着你死去？！

original: I'm not going to die right away, mother! I--
string: 我不会马上死的，妈妈！我——

original: They are blue...
string: 它们是蓝色的……

original: What?
string: 什么意思？

original: Your eyes. They are blue. I had forgotten.
string: 你的眼睛。它们是蓝色的。我忘记了。

original: Yeah. So did I.
string: 是的。我也是。

original: And why didn't you consult with me first?
string: 那你为什么不先跟我商量呢？

original: You should have told me beforehand! I didn't want to learn about it like this!
string: 你应该提前告诉我！我不想以这种方式得知这件事！

original: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to hurt you.
string: 对不起。我不是有意伤害你的。

original: But I needed to do this! Being a vampire was choking me so slowly that I wouldn't have noticed until I was dead.
string: 但我必须这么做！当吸血鬼的日子让我渐渐窒息，若不是及时醒悟，恐怕到死都浑然不觉。

original: I couldn't live a frozen life while the world around me kept moving on. All that made me who I am would wither away one way or another.
string: 我不能过着一成不变的生活，而周围的世界却在不断变化。所有成就我的东西都会以某种方式消亡。

original: Even if you don't approve... I hope you understand why I had to do this.
string: 即使你不同意……我希望你能理解我为什么必须这样做。

original: I do understand, Serana. I just wish you trusted me enough to tell me beforehand. I would have supported you, you know?
string: 我理解，瑟拉娜。我只是希望你能足够信任我，提前告诉我。我会支持你的，你知道吗？

original: You're right. I have been unfair to you.
string: 你说得对。我对你不公平。

original: Don't worry about it, dear. But... Promise me you'll come to visit every now and then. If our time together is limited...
string: 亲爱的，别担心。但是……答应我，你会时不时来看我。如果我们在一起的时间有限……

original: Of course! I promise!
string: 当然！我保证！

original: You know? Blue does suit your eyes. They're beautiful!
string: 你知道吗？蓝色确实适合你的眼睛。它们很漂亮！

original: I'm sure they'd have the same effect on you, mother. Thank you.
string: 我相信它们会对你产生同样的影响，妈妈。谢谢你。

original: Ahhh... Praise Mara for this fire! The cold outside was creeping into my bones.
string: 啊……感谢玛拉赐予这团火！外面的寒气都快渗进骨头里了。

original: Aw, don't be so whiny, Erandur! You get used to it, eventually.
string: 噢，别这么爱发牢骚，依兰杜尔！你最终会习惯的。

original: Easy for you to say! You're a Nord!
string: 你说得轻松！你是一个诺德人！

original: He makes a good point there. You're being a little unfair, Mjoll.
string: 他的观点很正确。你有点不公平，穆月尔。

original: Heartless is what she is! You Nords will never understand J'zargo's struggles!
string: 她真是冷酷无情！你们诺德人永远不会理解杰'扎格的挣扎！

original: Ohhh no. You don't get to complain, Khajiit. You have fur all over your body!
string: 哦不。你没有资格抱怨，卡吉特。你浑身都是毛！

original: Ha ha!
string: 哈哈！

original: Ugh... Nords.
string: 呃……诺德人。

original: J'zargo is going to sit over there to read, if you'll excuse him.
string: 如果你不介意的话，杰'扎格将坐在那边看书。

original: Really? I didn't take you for the reading type.
string: 真的吗？我可没把你当成爱读书的人。

original: Why not? Every good mage should have the habit of reading.
string: 为什么不呢？每个优秀的法师都应该有阅读的习惯。

original: Well said. In fact, I fancy a bit of reading myself. May I borrow a book?
string: 说得好。事实上，我自己也喜欢读书。我可以借一本书吗？

original: Unfortunately, J'zargo only brought one book.
string: 不幸的是，杰'扎格只带了一本书。

original: Good enough for me. We can read at the same pace if we share it.
string: 对我来说已经够好了。如果我们分享的话，我们可以以相同的速度阅读。

original: No, ah... J'zargo prefers to read alone.
string: 不，啊……杰'扎格更喜欢独自阅读。

original: Come on, don't be selfish! What are you even reading, anyway?
string: 拜托，别自私了！你到底在读什么书？

original: "The Lusty Argoni--?"
string: “元气满满的阿尔贡——？”

original: NO!!
Just leave J'zargo alone!
string: 别再管杰'扎格了！

original: What was that all about?
string: 这到底是怎么回事？

original: You don't want to know.
string: 你不想知道。

original: Alright. I'll ask the innkeeper for some mead. You guys want anything?
string: 好吧。我会向旅店老板要一些蜜酒。你们想要什么吗？

original: Alright. I'll ask the innkeeper for some mead. You guys want anything?
string: 好吧。我会向旅店老板要一些蜜酒。你们想要什么吗？

original: J'zargo would love to have some alto wine. He hasn't had any since he left the college.
string: 杰'扎格很想喝点阿尔托酒。自从离开大学后，他就没喝过酒了。

original: J'zargo would love to have some alto wine. He hasn't had any since he left the college.
string: 杰'扎格很想喝点阿尔托酒。自从离开大学后，他就没喝过酒了。

original: Aye. Erandur?
string: 是的。埃兰德尔？

original: Aye. Erandur?
string: 是的。埃兰德尔？

original: Nay, I don't drink anymore. But thank you.
string: 不，我不再喝酒了。不过还是谢谢你。

original: Nay, I don't drink anymore. But thank you.
string: 不，我不再喝酒了。不过还是谢谢你。

original: If you say so. And you, Serana?
string: 如果你这么说的话。你呢，瑟拉娜？

original: If you say so. And you, Serana?
string: 如果你这么说的话。你呢，瑟拉娜？

original: Yeah, I could use a drink, now that you mention it.
string: 是的，既然你提到了这一点，我就可以喝一杯。

original: Well, what would that be?
string: 那么，那会是什么呢？

original: Oh, no need to dwell on the details. You already have plenty of what I need.
string: 哦，没必要纠结于细节。你已经有足够我所需要的东西了。

original: Me? I don't have any--
string: 我？我没有——

original: WAIT, NO!
string: 等一下，不！

original: Ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈！

original: Yeah, yeah. Very funny.
string: 是啊，是啊。非常有趣。

original: Heheheheh!
string: 呵呵呵呵！

original: Oh, right! I can have normal drinks now!
string: 哦，对了！我现在可以喝普通饮料了！

original: Why don't you have the same as I? I would be honored to share your first cup of mead with you.
string: 为什么你不和我一样呢？我很荣幸能和你分享你的第一杯蜜酒。

original: I'm not sure if I want to start with such a strong drink...
string: 我不确定是否要喝这么烈的酒……

original: I think I'll just have a jug of milk and call it a day.
string: 我想我只需要喝一罐牛奶就可以了。

original: Are you sure about this, Serana? The local Nords will start calling you a milk-drinker.
string: 你确定吗，瑟拉娜？当地的诺德人会开始叫你“喝牛奶的人”。

original: Then she'll be a proud milk-drinker! In fact, make it two jugs of milk!
string: 然后她就会成为一个自豪的牛奶爱好者！事实上，喝两罐牛奶！

original: Egh.
I'm surrounded by milk-drinkers!
string: 我周围都是喝牛奶的人！

original: Never thought I'd see you humming, Erandur.
string: 从来没想过会看到你哼歌，依兰杜尔。

original: Aah! Sorry, I-I forgot you guys were here!
string: 啊啊！抱歉，我忘了你们在这里！

original: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈哈哈！

original: Ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈！

original: Hehehehe!
string: 呵呵呵呵！

original: This is embarrassing...
string: 这太尴尬了……

original: Oh.
string: 噢。

original: We're bringing her along? J'zargo thought we were killing vampires.
string: 我们要带她一起去？杰'扎格以为我们要杀吸血鬼。

original: Not all vampires are inherently evil, J'zargo. And if we kill someone for what they are, are we any better?
string: 并非所有吸血鬼都是天生邪恶的，杰'扎格。如果我们因为某人的本性而杀了他，我们会变得更好吗？

original: J'zargo sees your point.
string: 杰'扎格明白你的意思。

original: Still... J'zargo would rather keep his distance from the vampire.
string: 尽管如此……杰'扎格还是宁愿与吸血鬼保持距离。

original: No offense.
string: 无意冒犯。

original: Some taken.
string: 已经有点了。

original: *Humming*
string: *哼歌*

original: Ahh... J'zargo feels warm inside this cave. This is good.
string: 啊……杰'扎格在这个洞穴里感觉很温暖。这很好。

original: Won't that make the cold harsher in contrast once we exit?
string: 一旦我们出去，天气不是会变得更加寒冷吗？

original: You just had to ruin this for J'zargo, didn't you?
string: 你必须为杰'扎格毁掉这一切，不是吗？

original: At least you have fur on your face! The rest of us are going to grow ice on our cheeks!
string: 至少你的脸上还有毛！我们其他人的脸颊上都会长出冰！

original: Then enjoy the warmth while it lasts.
string: 然后尽情享受这份温暖。

original: Watch your step. I don't think this place is called "Darkfall Cave" for nothing.
string: 小心脚下。我觉得这个地方被称为“暗瀑洞穴”是有原因的。

original: Huh. That... Actually does make sense!
string: 嗯。那……确实有道理！

original: I feel terrible for that Snow Elf. To live as the last of his kind...
string: 我为那位雪精灵感到难过。他是这个种族中最后一个活着的人……

original: Even I'll admit that the ancient Nords had no right to drive them to extinction. Not even after what the Elves did to them in the Night of Tears.
string: 即使是我也承认，古代诺德人无权将他们赶尽杀绝，即使精灵在 “泪之夜 ”对他们做了那样的事也不行。

original: You don't think he holds a grudge against us, do you?
string: 你不认为他对我们怀恨在心吗？

original: I think we'd know if he did.
string: 我想如果他这么做的话我们就会知道。

original: There's no point in rekindling the wars of our ancestors. They do nothing but spark new wars. And the cycle never ends.
string: 重新点燃我们祖先的战争毫无意义。它们只会引发新的战争。而且这种循环永无休止。

original: Besides, he's not the last of his kind! There's plenty of Falmer in Skyrim!
string: 此外，他不是同类中最后一个！天际有很多伐莫！

original: Which... Actually makes it more sad.
string: 这……实际上让事情变得更加悲伤。

original: Forget J'zargo said anything.
string: 忘记杰'扎格说过的任何话。

original: Mara be praised! I didn't think I'd see such beauty in Skyrim!
string: 赞美玛拉！我没想到在天际能看到如此美丽的景色！

original: Even I haven't seen anything like this back in my adventuring days. I'm glad I didn't retire yet!
string: 在我冒险的日子里，我也没见过这样的事。我很高兴我还没有退休！

original: Retire? J'zargo didn't know you were so old.
string: 退休？杰'扎格不知道你这么老了。

original: I'm not old! And retiring has nothing to do with age, J'zargo!
string: 我还没老！而且退休和年龄没关系，杰'扎格！

original: Don't be mad! J'zargo was just teasing you!
string: 别生气！杰'扎格只是在逗你！

original: Sorry, what was that?
string: 抱歉，你说什么？

original: Hehehehe! Worth it.
string: 呵呵呵呵！值得。

original: Besides, you're not even the oldest person among us.
string: 此外，你甚至不是我们当中最年长的人。

original: What do you guys make of this?
string: 大家对此有什么看法？

original: I don't know. Daedric magic, maybe?
string: 我不知道。也许是迪德拉魔法？

original: I'm not so sure. With the barriers that protect us from Oblivion, the Daedra shouldn't be able to pull something of this magnitude.
string: 我不太确定。有了保护我们免遭湮灭的屏障，迪德拉应该无法做出如此规模的破坏。

original: Those very same barriers haven't been that reliable in the past. Remember the Oblivion crisis?
string: 同样的屏障在过去也并不那么可靠。还记得湮灭危机吗？

original: Oh, right.
string: 哦，对的。

original: Even so, I wouldn't rule out the possibility of this being the result of some kind of Snow Elf magic. Because if Vyrthur has access to it...
string: 即便如此，我也不排除这是某种雪精灵魔法的结果的可能性。因为如果 维苏尔可以使用它……

original: Who cares what caused this?! Look how much treasure they've got!
string: 谁在乎这是什么原因造成的？看看他们有多少宝藏！

original: No!
string: 不！

original: Wait, you fool!
string: 等一下，你这个傻瓜！

original: Don't touch it!
string: 别碰它！

original: Oh, come on! This isn't stealing! They're blind, for Lorkhaj's sake! Why would they want jewelry?!
string: 哦，拜托！这不是偷窃！洛克哈在上，他们是瞎子！他们为什么想要珠宝？！

original: That's not the point, J'zargo! What if it is a trap?! They could come to life at the slightest touch!
string: 这不是重点，杰'扎格！如果这是陷阱怎么办？！只要轻轻一碰，它们就会复活！

original: Ha ha! Yeah, right! Tell J'zargo one time you've seen something like that happening!
string: 哈哈！是的，没错！如果你看到过类似的事情，就告诉杰'扎格！

original: Gargoyles.
string: 石像鬼。

original: Oh...
Come. We mustn't tarry!
string: 快来。我们不能耽搁！

original: We need better friends. These guys never let J'zargo have nice things!
string: 我们需要更好的朋友。这些家伙从不让杰'扎格拥有好东西！

original: J'zargo doesn't understand. Why would Alkosh turn his back on Vyrthur when he was infected? So much of this mess could be avoided!
string: 杰'扎格不明白。为什么阿尔科什在维苏尔被感染后会背弃他？很多这样的麻烦事是可以避免的！

original: The Divines reward virtuous acts and punish misdeeds.
string: 圣灵奖励善行，惩罚恶行。

original: Maybe Vyrthur had always been a rotten man, and his true colors emerged when he became infected.
string: 也许维苏尔一直都是一个腐烂的人，当他被感染时，他的真面目才显露出来。

original: Instead of humility, he chose pride, and thus proved himself unworthy of His mercy.
string: 他没有选择谦卑，而是选择了骄傲，从而证明自己不配得到他的怜悯。

original: Shame that so many people were caught in the middle. All this suffering, and for what?
string: 真可惜，这么多人被夹在中间。这么多苦难，到底是为了什么？

original: Isn't vengeance a cruel trickster? It promises peace of mind, yet all it does is bring unnecessary pain to anyone who gets caught in its dark web.
string: 复仇难道不是一个残忍的骗子吗？它许诺让人心安理得，然而它所做的只是给任何陷入其黑暗蛛网的人带来不必要的痛苦。

original: J'zargo gives you his deepest sympathies for your loss, Serana.
string: 杰'扎格对你的损失表示最深切的同情，瑟拉娜。

original: We're here if you ever need anything. You know that.
string: 如果你需要任何东西，我们都会在这里。你知道的。

original: If I may, I'm acquainted with a priest of Arkay. If you want her to pray for your father's soul, we can...
string: 如果可以的话，我认识一位阿尔凯的牧师。如果你想让她为你父亲的灵魂祈祷，我们可以……

original: No. I... I don't think my father deserves that kind of blessing. He never expressed regret, even as he died.
string: 不。我……我觉得我父亲不值得这样的祝福。他从未表达过遗憾，即使他去世了。

original: He was determined to kill me until his last breath...
string: 直到他的最后一口气，他也决心要杀死我……

original: I understand, my daughter. Forgiveness cannot be granted to those who do not regret their wrongdoings.
string: 我明白，我的女儿。那些对自己的错事不后悔的人是不会得到宽恕的。

original: Even so, we will all pray for your happiness. You earned that much.
string: 即便如此，我们都会为你的幸福祈祷。这是你应得的。

original: Thank you.
string: 谢谢。

original: All of you.
string: 你们所有人。

original: This was a waste of J'zargo's time!
string: 这浪费了杰'扎格的时间！

original: I just saw you sneak a soul gem into your pocket! Quit complaining!
string: 我刚看到你偷偷把一颗灵魂宝石放进口袋里！别再抱怨了！

original: Is he always like this?
string: 他一直都这样吗？

original: Every time.
string: 每次。

original: J'zargo doesn't! J'zargo welcomes the challenge!
string: 杰'扎格可不这么想！杰'扎格正渴望着这场挑战！

original: If what Delphine said was true, then there's a chance we may end up fighting two dragons at once. I have a bad feeling about this.
string: 如果戴尔芬所言属实，我们很可能要同时迎战两条龙。我对此有种不祥的预感。

original: No, don't do that. Don't jump into battle assuming you'll win, J'zargo.
string: 别，别这样。别抱着必胜的盲目信念投入战斗，杰'扎格。

original: That is the kind of mistake that will cost you your life and the lives of your companions.
string: 这样的错误将会使你和你的同伴丧命。

original: I agree. Let's follow Delphine's lead and tread carefully.
string: 我同意。让我们跟随戴尔芬的脚步，谨慎行事。

original: Sorry, whiskers.
string: 抱歉啦，大脸胡。

original: Try to lay low. This is the Thieves Guild's headquarters. We don't want any trouble.
string: 尽量低调行事。这里是盗贼公会的总部。我们不想惹麻烦。

original: It disgusts me to think that Mara's place of worship is so close to this lair of sinners!
string: 想到玛拉的圣所离这个罪犯的巢穴如此之近，我就感到恶心！

original: At least Mara doesn't have to smell this. It's insufferable!
string: 至少玛拉不用闻到这种味道。这太让人受不了了！

original: Insufferable, you say? Try having the smell of a Khajiit!
string: 你说难以忍受？试试闻一闻卡吉特的味道吧！

original: Oh...
You're with the Dragonborn, I take it?
string: 我猜你是和龙裔一起的人吧？

original: Yes, we've been travelling together for a while.
string: 是的，我们已经一起旅行了一段时间了。

original: You got a problem with that?
string: 你对此有什么问题吗？

original: I suppose you can come with us. We'll need all the help we can get.
string: 我想你可以和我们一起去。我们需要尽可能多的帮助。

original: But don't make me regret bringing you along. I'll be watching you.
string: 但别让我后悔带你一起来。我会看着你的。

original: It's alright! We don't want any trouble.
string: 没关系！我们不想惹麻烦。

original: Someone's got trust issues...
string: 有人有信任问题……

original: No. Not for the moment, at least.
string: 不，至少目前还不是。

original: Is there a chance you can get another invitation for me?
string: 您还能帮我获得另一份邀请吗？

original: Oh, what am I? The imperial courier? Do you have any idea how hard is it to get just one?
string: 哦，难道我是帝国的信使？你知道得到一个有多难吗？

original: This is an infiltration, lady! Not a ball!
string: 这是潜入，女士！不是舞会！

original: Don't get so worked up about it! I just thought I could help.
string: 别太激动！我只是想帮忙而已。

original: And how exactly are you planning on doing that?
string: 那您具体打算怎样做呢？

original: I used to be royalty, you know? If anyone can make sure he doesn't blow his cover at the party, it's me.
string: 你知道吗，我曾经是皇室成员？如果有人能确保他在派对上不暴露身份，那就是我。

original: Besides, someone's gotta bail him out if things go south.
string: 此外，如果事情变糟，总得有人来救他。

original: I used to be royalty, you know? If anyone can make sure she doesn't blow her cover at the party, it's me.
string: 你知道吗，我曾经是皇室成员？如果有人能确保她在派对上不暴露身份，那就是我。

original: Besides, someone's gotta bail her out if things go south.
string: 此外，如果事情变糟的话，必须有人来救她。

original: I suppose having you on board might benefit the mission.
string: 我想有你加入可能会对任务有益。

original: Look, I'll think about it. But I can't guarantee I can get you another invitation.
string: 听着，我会考虑的。但我不能保证能给你另一份邀请函。

original: It's alright. I just want to be helpful.
string: 没关系。我只是想帮忙。

original: I know. I'm sorry I yelled at you like that.
string: 我知道。我很抱歉那样对你大喊大叫。

original: And you, young maiden? You arrived with this guest, did you not?
string: 你呢，小姑娘？你不是和这位客人一起来的吗？

original: Indeed, my lady. My name is Serana. It is a privilege to meet you.
string: 确实，女士。我叫瑟拉娜。很荣幸见到您。

original: Oh, how polite! I didn't think Nords could achieve such high standards of etiquette and beauty.
string: 哦，多么有礼貌啊！我没想到诺德人能达到如此高的礼仪和美貌标准。

original: You do me too much honor, my lady.
string: 夫人，您给了我太大的荣幸。

original: Quite the contrary, young maiden, you truly are a diamond in the rough. Please, if there's anything you require, you have but to ask.
string: 恰恰相反，年轻的姑娘，你真是一颗未经雕琢的钻石。如果你需要什么，请尽管开口。

original: I will. It's been a pleasure, lady Elenwen.
string: 我会的。我很荣幸，爱琳温女士。

original: Oh, the pleasure is all mine.
string: 噢，我很荣幸。

original: "A diamond in the rough", she says. Good to know I stand out among the dirt...
string: 她说我是 “未经雕琢的钻石”。很高兴知道我能在泥尘中脱颖而出……

original: So... What were those Akaviri guys again?
string: 那么……那些阿卡维尔家伙又是什么呢？

original: According to a book I read, they were some sort of immortal snake-men from another continent.
string: 根据我读过的一本书，他们是来自另一个大陆的某种不朽的蛇人。

original: Aerin told me they were... Man-eating vampires I think?
string: 艾灵告诉我他们是……食人吸血鬼，我想？

original: If I may, I'm quite well versed in the Akaviri's impact in Tamrielic history.
string: 如果可以的话，我非常了解阿卡维尔对泰姆瑞尔历史的影响。

original: They launched an invasion during Reman Cyrodiil's rise to power. Joining forces with the Colovians, he defeated them in the battle of Pale Pass.
string: 他们在雷曼·希罗帝尔崛起期间发动了入侵。他与科洛文人联手，在苍白隘口战役中击败了他们。

original: Then, to everyone's astonishment, Reman chose to pardon the invaders and appoint them as high-ranking advisors in his empire.
string: 然后，让所有人惊讶的是，雷曼选择赦免入侵者，并任命他们为帝国的高级顾问。

original: Let me guess. They betrayed him?
string: 让我猜猜。他们背叛了他？

original: No! Far from it! They realized he was the Dragonborn they were looking for, and pledged themselves as his protectors, known as the Dragonguard.
string: 不！远非如此！他们意识到他就是他们要找的龙裔，并宣誓成为他的保护者，被称为龙卫。

original: They were instrumental in the foundation of the Second Empire of men, and their descendants would become the first members of the Blades.
string: 他们在人类第二帝国的建立中发挥了重要作用，他们的后代成为了刀锋会的第一批成员。

original: Honor-bound to serve and protect the Dragonborn!
string: 光荣地服务和保护龙裔！

original: Fascinating! Thank you for taking the time to explain this to me.
string: 太棒了！谢谢您花时间向我解释这一点。

original: Oh, don't worry about it. It was my pleasure!
string: 哦，别担心。这是我的荣幸！

original: You certainly know your history, elder.
string: 长老，您当然了解自己的历史。

original: That's the Blades archivist for you.
string: 这就是刀锋会的档案管理员。

original: Now he's not going to stop talking.
string: 现在他不会停止讲话了。

original: Run.
string: 逃跑。

original: Yeah, very funny, Delphine.
string: 是的，非常有趣，戴尔芬。

original: Ha ha!
string: 哈哈！

original: So... After you're done with the Elder Scroll, could you possibly let J'zargo have it? It might help him become a powerful mage.
string: 那么……你用完上古卷轴后，可以把它给杰'扎格吗？这能会帮助他成为一名强大的法师。

original: Yeah. And a lunatic one! Have you seen what it did to this Septimus guy?
string: 是的。而且是个疯子！你看到它对赛普蒂莫斯做了什么吗？

original: Well, J'zargo is already kinda crazy. It might not be so bad.
string: 好吧，杰'扎格已经有点疯狂了。也许情况没那么糟。

original: Hm...
I was joking, J'zargo!
string: 我开玩笑的，杰'扎格！

original: So was J'zargo. Heh heh heh heh!
string: 杰'扎格也是。呵呵呵呵！

original: Or was he?
string: 或者他是？

original: Are you hungry, Serana? J'zargo smells blood nearby.
string: 你饿了吗，瑟拉娜？杰扎戈闻到了附近的血腥味。

original: I don't drink from the blood stains on the floor, J'zargo! That's disgusting!
string: 我不会喝地板上的血迹，杰'扎格！太恶心了！

original: Also, aren't you worried that the first thing you smell when you walk in here is blood?
string: 另外，你不担心走进这里时第一闻到的气味就是血腥味吗？

original: Can't say I feel comfortable heading into a Dwemer ruin. They always give me bad memories.
string: 进入矮人遗迹让我感觉很不舒服。它们总是给我留下不好的回忆。

original: You're not alone this time. We'll make it back alive. I promise.
string: 这次你不再孤身一人。我们会活着回来。我保证。

original: Yes! Cower before the might of J'zargo! Bwahahahah!
string: 是的！在杰'扎格的威力面前畏缩吧！哈哈哈哈！

original: Don't antagonize him, dimwit! We barely survived the battle!
string: 别惹他，笨蛋！我们好不容易才从这场战斗中幸存下来！

original: Let him have this, Erandur! You've got to admit he fought competently. And against the World Eater? That's no easy feat!
string: 让他拿下这个吧，依兰杜尔！你得承认他打得不错。而且对抗世界吞噬者？那可不是一件容易的事！

original: Fine. But I don't think this is over.
string: 好吧。但我不认为这已经结束了。

original: Anyway, is anyone in need of my healing arts?
string: 无论如何，有人需要我的治疗技术吗？

original: Um... J'zargo could use some healing, now that you mention it.
string: 嗯……既然你提到了这一点，杰'扎格需要一些治疗。

original: Adrenaline's going down, eh?
string: 肾上腺素正在下降，是吗？

original: This is it. We'll help you fight your way through. No matter what.
string: 就是这样。不管怎样，我们都会帮助你渡过难关。

original: Easier said than done... That's a lot of Draugr out there.
string: 说起来容易做起来难……那里有很多尸鬼。

original: No one said it's going to be easy. But if we fail, the world and everyone in it will cease to be!
string: 没人说这会很容易。但如果我们失败了，这个世界和世界上的每个人都将不复存在！

original: Have courage, my friends! Sovngarde awaits!
string: 鼓起勇气吧，我的朋友们！松加德正在等着你！

original: Wait, isn't that what Nords say when they're gonna die?
string: 等等，这难道不是诺德人临死前说的话吗？

original: Dammit, that's not what I meant!
string: 该死，我不是那个意思！

original: Heheheheh!
string: 呵呵呵呵！

original: Ha ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈哈！

original: Heh heh ha ha ha ha!
string: 哈哈哈哈哈哈！

original: Okay, I guess that did lift our spirits. Thank you, J'zargo.
string: 好吧，我想这确实让我们精神振奋了。谢谢你，杰'扎格。

original: J'zargo was serious about his question, though...
string: 不过，杰'扎格对他的问题很认真……

original: We made it! We actually made it to Sovngarde!
string: 我们成功了！我们真的到达了松加德！

original: And alive, which is... Unconventional, to say the least.
string: 而且还活着，这……至少可以说是非常规的

original: A prayer, Erandur? Just in case?
string: 祈祷，依兰杜尔？以防万一？

original: No need, my friend. Because we're going to win!
string: 没必要，我的朋友。因为我们会赢！

original: Ha! Spoken like a true hero, Erandur!
string: 哈！依兰杜尔，你说话真像个真正的英雄！

original: No foolish sacrifices either! We're all coming back home! Understand?
string: 也不要做出愚蠢的牺牲！我们都会回家！明白吗？

original: Don't worry, Serana. We'll live to hear the songs of our triumph!
string: 别担心，瑟拉娜。我们会活着听到胜利之歌！

original: We need to come up with a name for our group if we survive.
string: 如果我们生存下来的话，我们需要为我们的团队想出一个名字。

original: I only dreamed about seeing Blackreach with my own eyes. I never thought I'd actually make it here!
string: 我只是梦想着亲眼看看黑旗镇。我从来没想过我实际上能来到这里！

original: J'zargo wishes he didn't have to. Those Falmer will forever haunt his nightmares! What good came out of this journey?
string: 杰'扎格希望他不必这么做。那些伐莫将永远困扰着他的噩梦！这次旅行有什么好处？

original: Treasure?
string: 宝藏？

original: Fair enough.
string: 有道理。

original: I defeated Alduin, the World Eater.
string: 我击败了奥杜因，世界吞噬者。

original: Yeah, right! Now tell me another one.
string: 是啊，对！现在再给我说一个吧。

original: I wasn't lying, Serana. I'm a Dragonborn.
string: 我没骗你，瑟拉娜。我是龙裔。

original: Wait. You mean it? Like the legend of a mortal with the soul of a dragon?
string: 等等。你是说真的？就像传说中那样，拥有龙魂的凡人？

original: And you're telling me you defeated the Firstborn of Akatosh?
string: 所以你是说你战胜了阿卡托什的长子？

original: Okay, I'm going to need the full context. Can you give me the short version?
string: 好吧，我想听听完整的背景。你能不能给我个简短版本？

original: I was at Helgen when Alduin attacked, but I escaped and...
string: 当奥杜因袭击时，我就在海尔根，但我逃脱了，然后……

original: I... I must say I'm impressed!
string: 我……不得不说，你让我印象深刻！

original: I suppose I should thank you for saving the world? I don't know. This is a lot to take in at once.
string: 我想我该谢谢你拯救了世界？但是说实话，这些信息来得太突然了，我一时有点反应不过来。

original: Kinda makes me wish you had woken me up earlier. It's a shame it happened just before we met!
string: 真希望你能早点叫醒我。可这偏偏发生在我们见面之前，太可惜了！

original: So what else can you tell me? How do you earn a living?
string: 你还能告诉我什么吗？你是做什么行当的？

original: Did Serana arrive? We were suppossed to meet here.
string: 瑟拉娜到了吗？我们约好在这里碰面的。

original: Ohh, our last minute guest? Yes, she's right behind you.
string: 噢，我们那位踩点儿到的客人？她就在你身后呢。

original: Remind me to give that old hag a piece of my mind later...
string: 待会儿记得提醒我找那个老巫婆算账……

original: Really? You thought a bandit would keep his word?
string: 真的吗？你居然相信一个强盗会信守承诺？

original: I have a bad feeling about this...
string: 我有种不祥的预感……

original: You wouldn't happen to have smuggled something for me in the chest, right?
string: 你不会碰巧在箱子里给我偷运了什么东西吧？

original: We got what we wanted. Let's get out of here.
string: 我们如愿以偿了。我们走吧。

original: I'm not gonna lie, I'm a little nervous... Do I look good?
string: 不瞒你说，我有点紧张……我看起来好看吗？

original: Party-crashing time!
string: 闯入时刻！

original: Wait a minute, we're going to a place called "the Ratway"?
string: 等一下，我们要去一个叫“鼠道”的地方吗？

original: I have a bad feeling about this...
string: 我有种不祥的预感……

original: What's that book you're carrying?
string: 你拿着什么书？

original: Just some useless spell tome I've found in my old room. I can't even get it to work.
string: 不过是我在旧房间里找到的一些没用的法术书，连我自己都施展不出来。

original: You know what? Take it. I've been meaning to get rid of it, anyway.
string: 你知道吗？拿去吧。反正我早就想把这玩意儿处理掉了。

original: I'd like to keep track of you at all times.
string: 我想随时掌握你的行踪。

original: Oh. Wow... Alright, well...
string: 哦。哇……好吧，那么……

original: Suit yourself.
string: 随你便。

original: I was adopted and raised by the Imperial City Arena's Battle Matron.
string: 我是被帝都竞技场的战母收养带大的。

original: That's actually kind of sweet. I suppose she's the one who taught you how to fight, wasn't she?
string: 其实这样还挺温馨的。想必你的战斗技巧也是她传授的吧？

original: Did you become a gladiator?
string: 你后来成为角斗士了吗？

original: For a time, yes, but then I realized that life just wasn't for me.
string: 没错，我曾做过一阵子角斗士，但后来发现那终究不是我想走的路。

original: Believe me, I get what that feels like.
string: 相信我，我明白那种感受。

original: I mean... I know we had different upbringings, but I understand what it's like to feel like you're not meant to be what you were raised for.
string: 我想说的是……虽然我们成长环境不同，但我明白那种感觉——觉得自己注定无法成为被培养成的那种人。

original: Yes, but I was a sore looser. One time I cheated and... She expelled me.
string: 是的，但当时我是个输不起的人。有次我作弊……结果被她赶出了门。

original: What you did wasn't right, but... I can imagine how much it must have hurt to part on such bad terms.
string: 你做得确实不对，但……我能想象这样不欢而散该有多痛心。

original: I'm sorry things ended so badly between you two.
string: 很遗憾你们俩的关系会以这样的方式收场。

original: No. That life wasn't for me, but she was understanding and let me go.
string: 是的，那种生活不适合我。但她很理解，让我离开了。

original: I'm glad you two parted on good terms. You were lucky to have her.
string: 真高兴你们能好聚好散。有她是你的幸运。

original: You don't have to be afraid of changing. You're a good person.
string: 不必害怕改变。你本就是个善良的人。

original: I guess I am now.
string: 我想我现在是了。

original: But thank you for listening.
string: 还是谢谢你愿意听我讲。

original: What's so funny about doing a pointless trip?
string: 跑这一趟毫无意义，这有什么好笑的？

original: Oh, come now! There's nothing pointless about seeing new places. Don't be so lazy!
string: 哎呀别这样！去看看新风景怎么会没意义呢。别这么懒嘛！

original: Doesn't change the fact that I was made a fool of...
string: 但这改变不了我被耍得团团转的事实……

original: Because you have to go back to the south to reclaim the horn? Alright. Let's look at it this way:
string: 因为你要回南方取回号角？好吧。我们换个角度想：

original: Whoever took it could have waited for you in Ivarstead or right here, but instead they went out of their way to travel north and then back south.
string: 拿走它的人本可以在伊瓦尔镇或者就在这里等你，但他们却不辞辛苦地往北又往南走。

original: I mean, if they knew you were after the horn, then I'm sure they knew you would deliver it to the Greybeards eventually.
string: 我的意思是，如果他们知道你在找号角，那么我肯定，他们知道你最终会把它交给灰胡子。

original: So you may have been made a fool of, but... Who's the actual idiot who went through unnecessary lengths just to contact you?
string: 所以你可能被愚弄了，但是……那个为了联系你而大费周章的白痴到底是谁？

original: Now quit complaining and let's get out of this tomb already, okay?
string: 现在别抱怨了，让我们离开这个坟墓，好吗？ ?

original: That doesn't look good. Can you heal yourself?
string: 情况不妙。你能治疗自己吗？

original: Seriously, what's with these people? It's as if they were trying too hard not to speak in prose!
string: 说真的，这些人怎么回事？简直像在刻意避免说人话似的！

original: Okay, I'm not going to THIS afterlife when I die! I don't want to get whatever disease makes them talk like this.
string: 好吧，我死后可不去这个来世！我可不想得什么让他们这么说话的病。

original: Doesn't he speak a little weird to you?
string: 他跟你说话的样子是不是有点奇怪？

original: Um... Hello! You're accompanying my client, are you?
string: 呃……你好！你是陪着我的客户一起来的吗？

original: Very observant. Nice to meet you. My name is Serana.
string: 真是敏锐。幸会，我叫瑟拉娜。

original: It's a pleasure to meet you. I'm Erik the Slayer! Oh, but you can just call me Erik.
string: 很高兴认识你。我叫“嗜杀者”艾瑞克！不过叫我艾瑞克就好。

original: Figured as much. Let's see if you live up to your title.
string: 我猜也是。让我们看看你是否配得上这个称号。

original: I won't let you down, lady Serana.
string: 我不会让你失望的，瑟拉娜女士。

original: You can drop the formalities, kid.
string: 用不着这么拘谨，小伙子。

original: Right! I'm sorry.
string: 好的！真抱歉。

original: So, um... Are you married?
string: 那么，呃……你结婚了吗？

original: Excuse me?
string: 不好意思？

original: Well, um... I just thought a lady like yourself would be engaged by now, or...
string: 啊这……我只是觉得像您这样的淑女应该早就订婚了，或者……

original: Look, I know what you're trying, kid. You better drop it.
string: 听着，小家伙，我知道你在打什么主意。最好就此打住。

original: What?! No! I wasn't trying to...
string: 什么？！不是的！我没有想……

original: I'm sorry. I just wanted to start a conversation. I didn't mean to offend you.
string: 对不起。我只是想找个话题聊聊，不是有意冒犯的。

original: Don't worry about it, kid. Just try not to ask such a personal question to someone you just met. It gave me the wrong idea about you.
string: 别担心，小家伙。只是刚见面就问这种私密的问题不太妥当。这让我误会你的为人。

original: I know. I'm sorry. I guess I got nervious. There aren't girls my age where I live, so...
string: 我明白。抱歉，大概是我太紧张了。我住的地方没有同龄姑娘，所以……

original: You don't have much experience talking to women. I get it.
string: 你不怎么擅长和女性交谈，我懂了。

original: You know, if you want advice on how to talk to girls, I don't mind helping you.
string: 其实如果你想学怎么和女孩聊天，我不介意帮你。

original: You would? I-I don't want to be unprofessional!
string: 真的吗？可...可我不想显得不够专业！

original: It's fine, Erik. I never liked business-like relationships in the first place.
string: 没关系，艾瑞克。我本来就不喜欢公事公办的关系。

original: Great! Thank you so much, Serana!
string: 太好了！太感谢你了，瑟拉娜！

original: Gods, it really feels good to finally leave Rorikstead behind!
string: 天哪，终于把洛利斯泰德抛在身后，感觉真好啊！

original: You didn't get to travel much?
string: 瑟拉娜？能请教你件事吗？我在白漫城遇见一位令我想搭话的女士...

original: No. Well, I've been to Whiterun a few times, but it was always while accompanying my father.
string: 好啊。你本来打算和她说什么？

original: I was never given the chance to leave on my own.
string: 我从未有机会独自离开。

original: You sound frustrated...
string: 我本想先跟她聊聊从希罗帝尔听来的传闻。比如说这件事：

original: Oh, you have no idea. Ever since I wanted to be an adventurer, my father kept making up excuses.
string: 我不确定这是不是个好主意……

original: "I need you here to work the farm", and that kind of thing. He knew I was meant for more!
string: “我需要你在这里帮忙耕种农场”，诸如此类的话。他知道我应该有更好的归宿！

original: Don't you think he might have been worried?
string: 不行吗？那这个怎么样？

original: Yeah, but I'm no longer a child! Do you have any idea what it feels like to be held back like that?
string: 艾瑞克。别说了。这么说太吓人了。没人会喜欢听陌生人突然讲些莫名其妙的传闻。

original: No. But I know that you're all that he has left.
string: 是吗？天啊，我闲聊的本事真的这么差吗？

original: Oh...
Hey, Serana? Can I ask for your opinion about something?
string: 那个，瑟拉娜？能再请教你件事吗？

original: Sure. Which girl is this about?
string: 当然。这次是关于哪家姑娘的事？

original: What? No! It's about fighting!
string: 啊？不是的！是关于战斗技巧的事！

original: Oh? How come? You seemed pretty good with the blade as far as I saw.
string: 哦？怎么说？就我所见你的剑术相当不错啊。

original: Yeah, but it's not enough! I thought that if I learned magic, I'd become even deadlier.
string: 可是还不够！我想着要是再学点魔法，战斗力就能更上一层楼。

original: You're pretty adept at magic yourself, so I wanted to ask you which school I should start with.
string: 你本身就很精通魔法，所以我想请教该从哪个学派开始学起。

original: I'd advise you to stick to sword and shield.
string: 我建议你还是专注练好剑盾。

original: Why? You think I don't have what it takes?!
string: 为什么？你觉得我没那个天赋吗？！

original: Don't put words in my mouth!
string: 别曲解我的意思！

original: I know that being a jack of all trades may sound appealing, but focusing on so many areas will make you a master of nothing.
string: 我明白成为多面手听起来很吸引人，但涉猎过多领域只会令你一事无成。

original: If instead you hone your talents, you'll become way more reliable in your area of expertise, while others make up for your weaknesses.
string: 精进所长才能让你在专业领域更可靠，短板自有同伴来弥补。

original: Ohhh, I get it! That's why you don't wield a claymore in battle!
string: 噢，我懂了！难怪你战斗时从来不用双手巨剑！

original: Exactly! Remember that you're part of a team now, so when we need a swordsman...
string: 正是！别忘了你现在是团队一员，当我们需要剑士时……

original: I'll be ready! Thank you for your input, Serana.
string: 交给我吧！谢谢你指点，瑟拉娜。

original: Nope. Sorry...
string: 不。抱歉……

original: So we're walking away empty-handed. Brilliant...
string: 所以我们空手而归。真棒……

original: I think it was caused by a Dwemer construct that... Well, broke time.
string: 我认为是某个锻莫构造体……怎么说呢，扰乱了时间流造成的。

original: Somehow you gave me much more specific information than this book.
string: 不知怎么的，你提供的信息比这本书详细得多。

original: Which isn't even that much...
string: 这根本不算什么……

original: Thanks. When were you born?
string: 谢谢。你出生在什么时代？

original: In the year 2478 of the First Era. I'm surprised I still remember!
string: 第一纪元2478年。真意外我居然还记得！

original: As for how old I am now, I think I was a decade away from turning two hundred when I was locked away.
string: 至于现在的年龄，我被囚禁时，距离两百岁还差十年。

original: I've been researching how long each era lasted, and... Turns out I've been sleeping for 1785 years. Probably more.
string: 我查过每个纪元持续的时间……结果发现自己沉睡了1785年。可能还不止。

original: Was this book helpful? I couldn't find anything about their fall.
string: 这本书有用吗？我没找到任何关于他们衰落的记载。

original: Yeah! Most of what is written here happened before I was born, but I can't say I knew the full story. I learned a lot with this book!
string: 没错！书里记载的大多是我出生前的事，不过就连我也不知道完整经过。这本书让我受益良多！

original: Here. I'll show you a few tricks on conjuration. Best school of magic in my opinion. Who needs items when you can just bring them out of thin air?
string: 来，我来给你演示几招召唤法术。这是我认为最好的魔法类型。当你可以凭空变出东西时，谁还需要物品呢？

original: What are you waiting for? Talk to her!
string: 你还等什么？快去和她说话呀！

original: What?! No! What am I supposed to say?
string: 什么？！不行！我该说什么啊？

original: Just do it like we practiced. You'll do great!
string: 按我们排练的来就行。你肯定能做好！

original: Alright... Here goes nothing!
string: 好吧……豁出去了！

original: Um... Hi! Are you a bard by any chance?
string: 那个……你好！请问你是个吟游诗人吗？

original: I am. Did my lute give it away?
string: 是啊，是我的鲁特琴暴露了吗？

original: Yeah! My father runs a tavern himself, back in Rorikstead. Though we never had a bard to lighten the mood.
string: 没错！我父亲在洛利克镇经营酒馆，可惜从没有吟游诗人来活跃气氛。

original: Really? That's such a shame. Music can do wonders for a broken spirit.
string: 是吗？太遗憾了。音乐最能抚慰受伤的灵魂了。

original: I couldn't have said it better myself!
string: 这话说得太对了！

original: Say, would you be interested in changing location? My father would be happy to hire you!
string: 对了，你有兴趣换地方演奏吗？我父亲很乐意雇佣你！

original: That's so sweet of you! But I'm happy working here. Thanks for offering, though.
string: 你真贴心！不过我很喜欢现在的工作。还是谢谢你的好意。

original: If you want to hear me play the lute, just let me know.
string: 想听我弹鲁特琴的话，随时告诉我。

original: I will. It's been a pleasure, my lady.
string: 我会的。能为您效劳是我的荣幸，女士。

original: Likewise.
string: 我也是。

original: So... What do you think?
string: 那么……你觉得呢？

original: You actually handled yourself pretty well. I'd say it was almost perfect! Good job!
string: 你表现得很不错，堪称完美！真棒！

original: Almost? Did I do something wrong?
string: 堪称？我哪里做得不好吗？

original: You forgot to ask her name.
string: 你忘了问她的名字。

original: Dammit!
string: 该死！

original: Should I try what we practiced with her?
string: 我该用我们练习过的方法和她聊聊看吗？

original: Yeah! She's gorgeous! Come on. You can do this!
string: 对呀！她美极了！来吧，你能行的！

original: Um... Hello. Are you a bard?
string: 呃……你好。你是吟游诗人吗？

original: That I am. Trained in the Bards College to become Dawnstar's finest.
string: 我正是。在吟游诗人学院学习，要成为晨星最好的诗人。

original: In that case, I'd love to see you play!
string: 既然如此，我真想看看你的表演！

original: Why, of course! Can't go around making bold claims without proving them, now can I?
string: 当然啦！不能光顾着信口开河，却不拿出证据来证明吧？

original: Although I still pale in comparison to my mother. She was truly the greatest...
string: 虽然我仍无法与母亲相提并论。她才是真正最了不起的……

original: Oh... You lost yours too...
string: 噢……原来你也失去了……

original: I'm so sorry! I didn't mean to bring back a bad memory.
string: 真抱歉！我不是故意让你想起伤心事的。

original: Oh, don't apologize... I was just a babe when it happened, anyway. If anything, you had it worse. I'm sorry for your loss.
string: 哦，不用道歉……发生那件事时我还是个婴儿。要说难受的话，其实你比我更痛苦。请节哀。

original: Say, do you want to go for a walk to the shore? Sunsets in Dawnstar are really something else.
string: 要不要去海边走走？晨星城的日落风景可是独一无二的。

original: Yeah! I'd love to!
string: 好啊！我非常愿意！

original: Hey, you there! What do you think you're doing?!
string: 哎！你！在这儿干什么呢？！

original: Father! Don't scare me like that! We're just talking!
string: 父亲！别这样吓人！我们只是在聊天！

original: She's got work to do, sellsword! If you want something, you talk to me!
string: 她还有活要干，佣兵！有事就找我谈！

original: Yeah, I... I'll just leave.
string: 嗯，我……我还是走吧。

original: Goodbye. It's been nice talking to you!
string: 再见！和你聊天很开心！

original: I'm so sorry, Erik. You were doing so well too!
string: 对不起，艾瑞克。你刚才明明表现得很好的！

original: Yeah... I guess I was unlucky.
string: 确实……看来我运气不太好。

original: I swear that guy sounded just like my father...
string: 我发誓那家伙的声音简直和我的父亲一模一样……

original: Father?
string: 父亲？

original: Not now, dear. I am much too busy.
string: 亲爱的，现在不行，我正忙着呢。

original: Spare me your sarcasm, girl. Such childishness is unbecoming of our family.
string: 别冷嘲热讽了，姑娘。这样幼稚的行为，可配不上我们家族的身份。

original: And to answer your question, I am planning the next steps in our clan's ascension. Conquering the sun is merely the first.
string: 至于你的问题，我正在规划我们家族登临巅峰的下一步计划。征服太阳仅仅是个开始。

original: When the other vampire clans realize the opportunity I presented, they'll try to seize our rewards. I must make sure Clan Volkihar stays on top.
string: 等其它吸血鬼氏族发现我创造的良机，定会来抢夺我们的成果。我必须确保沃基哈尔氏族始终立于不败之地。

original: All of us must play our parts, dear. I trust you'll play yours when the time comes.
string: 亲爱的，我们每个人都要各司其职...我相信关键时刻你不会让我失望的。

original: Busy with what? Staring at the chimney?
string: 忙什么呢？盯着烟囱发呆吗？

original: Yes, father...
string: 是的，父亲……

original: One more thing, dear.
string: 还有一件事，亲爱的。

original: Yes, father...
string: 是的，父亲……

original: Did that traitor you call mother ever tell you where she was going to hide?
string: 你那个叛徒母亲可曾告诉过你，她打算躲到哪儿去？

original: *sigh* No, father. I don't know where she hid her Elder Scroll.
string: *叹气* 没有，父亲。我不知道她把上古卷轴藏在哪里了。

original: She wouldn't keep it out of her sight. If we find her, we'll find the scroll. Come to me when you find a clue.
string: 她绝不会让它离开自己的视线。找到她，就能找到卷轴。有了线索，就马上来找我。.

original: And don't let her poisonous influence prevent you from making the right choice.
string: 别让她那些蛊惑人心的话影响你做出正确选择。

original: Right...
string: 好吧……

original: And you, lady? I assume you're accompanying my patron, yes?
string: 这位女士，你呢？我猜你是陪着我的雇主一起来的，对吗？

original: That's right. My name is Serana. It's a pleasure.
string: 没错。我叫瑟拉娜。很高兴认识你。

original: The pleasure is all mine... Assuming that pale skin of yours doesn't come with fangs.
string: 我也很高兴……只要你这苍白的皮肤下没有藏着獠牙就好。

original: So you noticed.
string: 你察觉到了。

original: Well, not anymore. But I guess I can't really hide what I've been, have I?
string: 嗯，现在不是了。但我想我终究无法掩饰自己曾经的模样，是吧？

original: I did. You don't seem the feral type, so I see no cause for alarm.
string: 是的，我注意到了。你看起来不像那种野性难驯的人，所以我没觉得有什么可警惕的。

original: But be warned. I've met many of your kind. And survived.
string: 但要当心。我见过许多像你这样的人。而且活了下来。

original: Apologies. I didn't mean to open an old wound. I just wanted to be sure.
string: 抱歉。我并非有意揭你伤疤，只是想确认清楚。

original: Don't worry about me, sellsword. I know how to avoid trouble.
string: 不必担心我，佣兵。我自有避开麻烦的法子。

original: It's alright, sellsword. It never hurts to be too careful.
string: 没关系，佣兵。谨慎些总没有坏处。

original: As long as we're clear about that. The name's Teldryn Sero, by the way.
string: 只要我们互相理解就好。顺便说一句，我叫泰卓因·赛罗。

original: Thank you for understanding. The name's Teldryn Sero, by the way.
string: 感谢理解。顺便说一句，我叫泰卓因·赛罗。

original: Nice to meet you.
string: 很高兴见到你。

original: Hey, Teldryn? You hail from Morrowind, don't you? What's it like?
string: 泰卓因，你来自晨风省对吧？那里是什么样的？

original: Not too different from southern Solstheim, I'm afraid. Most of our land is in a sorry state.
string: 恐怕和索瑟海姆南部没什么两样。我们的大部分土地都满目疮痍。

original: Oh, but you should have seen it before the Red Year! Volcanic terrains and lush coastal areas. It was beautiful!
string: 哦，但你们真该在红色之年之前看看它！火山地貌与葱郁海岸交相辉映，那才叫壮美！

original: What happened during the Red Year?
string: 红色之年期间发生了什么？

original: Oh, it all goes way back to the 2nd Era. A meteorite almost fell in Vvardenfell, but the living god Vivec stopped it before colliding.
string: 说来要追溯到第二纪元。有颗陨石险些坠落在瓦登费尔，但活神维威克在撞击前阻止了它。

original: Now, the smart thing to do would be to get rid of it. But in his divine wisdom, Vivec decided to leave it hanging on top of his city.
string: 明智的做法本该是彻底消除隐患。但维威克以他神性的智慧，决定让陨石悬停在城市上空。

original: Then the Nerevarine Prophecy happens, the Tribunal gods die... And surprise surprise! The meteorite crashes and devastates Vvardenfell!
string: 后来尼瑞瓦因预言应验，审判席三神陨落……结果可想而知！陨石坠毁彻底摧毁了瓦登费尔！

original: Oh, dear...
string: 哦，天哪……

original: And it gets worse! The impact triggered the eruption of the Red Mountain, which left Morrowind uninhabitable.
string: 更糟的是！陨石撞击引发红山喷发，整个晨风省从此彻底不复宜居。

original: Add the Argonian Invasion, which to be fair, we sort of had coming, and Tamriel's most prosperous civilization literally turns to ashes!
string: 再加上阿尔贡的入侵——说实话这也是我们咎由自取——泰姆瑞尔最璀璨的文明就此化为灰烬！

original: I'm so sorry your people had to go through that.
string: 真为你们那儿的人不得不经历那一切感到遗憾。

original: It happens to all civilizations, lady. Just look at the Empire. No one's safe from the lapidation of time.
string: 每个文明都难逃此劫，女士。看看帝国就知道了——在时间的碾磨下谁都无处遁形。

original: You know, lady? At first I had you figured for a taskmaster, but you actually do get the job done when battle rages.
string: 您知道吗，女士？起初我还以为您是个苛刻的监工，但真到了刀光剑影的时候，您确实能把事情办妥。

original: What, you thought I was a girl who sits in her castle all day? I've been fighting my own battles far longer than you have, you know?
string: 什么？你以为我是整天坐在城堡里的小姑娘？要知道，我在独自战斗的日子可比你要长得多呢。

original: Is that so? Then how about a wager?
string: 是这样吗？那要不要打个赌？

original: Pardon?
string: 什么？

original: Let's count our kills next time we raid a dungeon. The loser will have to give the winner a hundred gold!
string: 下次扫荡地牢时我们来计数杀敌数。输的人要给赢家一百金币！

original: Um... S-sure!
string: 呃……好、好的！

original: Please, tell me you have a hundred gold...
string: 拜托，你身上总该带了一百金币吧……

original: Sorry, what was your name again?
string: 抱歉，你刚才说，你的名字是？

original: I am Frea of the Skaal. And you?
string: 我是斯卡尔村的芙瑞雅。你呢？

original: I'm Serana of the... Never mind. It's good to meet you.
string: 我是瑟拉娜，来自……算了。很高兴认识你。

original: Likewise.
string: 我也是。

original: And I appreciate your timely assistance. I was fearing I would have to face this Miraak alone.
string: 很感谢你的及时相助。刚才我还在担心要独自面对米拉克。

original: Likewise.
string: 我也是。

original: Don't worry about it. We'll wrap this up quickly.
string: 放心吧。我们速战速决。

original: I do not believe it is wise to underestimate him. The magics at work here are... Unnatural. We must be cautious.
string: 我觉得低估他并不明智。这里的魔法运作方式……很不寻常。我们必须谨慎行事。

original: Right. Sorry.
string: 好的。抱歉。

original: Very well.
string: 很好。

original: I'm inclined to agree. You're being... Awfully casual about this.
string: 我倾向于赞同。你对待这事的态度……实在太过随意了。

original: Look! That woman over there doesn't seem to be enthralled. She might know something about what's going on.
string: 看！那边那个女人似乎没有被迷惑。她可能知道一些事情。

original: I am grateful for this journey. This may be the only adventure I can ever hope to have.
string: 很感激这段同行。这可能是我此生唯一能体验的冒险了。

original: Why is that? You can explore whenever, you know?
string: 为什么？你随时都可以去探索啊，对吧？

original: A shaman doesn't get the luxury of abandoning her responsibilities whenever she pleases.
string: 身为萨满，可不能随心所欲地抛下自己的职责。

original: Don't you get a choice?
string: 难道你别无选择吗？

original: This isn't a matter of choice, Serana. I have a duty to my people.
string: 这不是选择的问题，瑟拉娜。我对族人有应尽的责任。

original: No, Frea. You don't have to become a shaman if you don't want to. If you let other people's expectations dictate your life, you'll...
string: 不，芙瑞雅。如果你不愿意，不必非当萨满不可。如果让别人对你的期望支配了你的人生，你会……

original: But this isn't about what my people may think of me. It's about responsibility.
string: 但这与他们如何看待我无关。这是责任所在。

original: My people need a spiritual guide. I am drawn to adventure, but I can't just abandon them.
string: 我的族人需要精神向导。我虽心向冒险，但不能就这样抛下他们。

original: Sometimes, the needs of the people you care about outweigh your own.
string: 有时，你所关心之人的需求要比你自己的更重要。

original: I can't deny this isn't a path I chose. But it is a rightful one, and I am honored to become my father's successor.
string: 我无法否认这并非我选择的道路。但这是条正当的道路，能成为父亲的继任者，我感到很荣幸。

original: I see... Sorry I misunderstood your situation.
string: 我明白了……是我误解了你的处境。

original: Don't be. Your question came from genuine concern, and I am grateful, friend.
string: 不必如此。你的问题源于真诚的关切，我对此心怀感激，朋友。

original: If this is to be my only adventure before I fulfill my duty, then I am honored to share it with you.
string: 若这注定是我履行使命前唯一的冒险，那么能与你共同经历，我深感荣幸。

original: Thanks, Frea.
string: 谢谢，芙瑞雅。

original: If you don't mind me asking, have you ever visited the Dunmer settlements of Solstheim before, Frea?
string: 若你不见怪，容我问一句——芙瑞雅，你可曾去过索瑟海姆岛上的丹莫聚居地？

original: Me? No, I have never had any contact with our elven neighbors until now.
string: 我吗？没去过，直到现在我都没和那些精灵邻居打过交道。

original: Really? Not even to trade with food, or weapons, or...?
string: 真的吗？连食物、武器之类的贸易往来都没有过？

original: There wasn't any need for me to do so. The land provides me with all that I need.
string: 我从不需要那么做。这片土地已馈赠我所需的一切。

original: You Skaal are surprisingly self-sufficient. It sounds... Stressing. At least from an outside perspective.
string: 你们斯卡尔村的自给程度真令人惊讶。听起来……挺辛苦的。至少在外人看来是这样。

original: Your way of life is equally incomprehensible to me, Serana. We come from entirely different worlds, after all.
string: 你们的生活方式同样令我费解，瑟拉娜。毕竟我们来自完全不同的世界。.

original: You have no idea. And trust me. We're both dwelling on alien territory here.
string: 你无法想象。相信我，此刻我们都身处异域。

original: Wait, wasn't that the name of the guy you talked to in the Soul Cairn?
string: 等等，你在灵魂石冢交谈的那个人，名字不就是这个吗？

original: What?
string: 什么意思？

original: What?
string: 什么？

original: You just hate fun!
string: 你简直讨厌欢乐！

original: First time in Solstheim, lady? You seem to be having a good time.
string: 初次来索瑟海姆吗，女士？您看起来玩得很开心。

original: Is it that obvious?
string: 那么明显吗？

original: Come to think about it, this island used to be Nord territory, right?
string: 说起来，这座岛原本是诺德人的领地吧？

original: Yes, and then Imperial, and then Nord again, and then it was given to the Dunmer after the desolation of Morrowind.
string: 是啊，后来归属帝国，再回到诺德人手里，到晨风荒芜后又转给了丹莫。

original: An admittedly kind gesture from your people, given our history. As you can see, this island has exchanged hands time and time again.
string: 鉴于我们的历史，这确实是你们族人的善意之举。如你所见，这座岛经历了几度易主。

original: I, for one, hope to get out of this damned rock. Wouldn't mind if you dragged me with you to Skyrim.
string: 我个人倒是盼着早点离开这鬼地方。要是你能捎上我去天际，我求之不得。

original: We'll think it over.
string: 我们会考虑一下。

original: Quite the particular choice of decoration. Whoever ran this place certainly had a penchant for torture.
string: 这装饰风格真是别具一格。当年经营此处的人肯定有刑讯癖好。

original: Is everything alright?
string: 一切都还好吗？

original: Yes. Sorry, I just spaced out for a moment.
string: 是啊。抱歉，刚才我走神了片刻。

original: Is this "circus" too much for you, lady?
string: 这场"马戏表演"让您受惊了吗，女士？

original: I'm fine! Let's continue.
string: 我没事！继续吧。

original: To build your houses inside fungi... You Dunmer will never cease to amaze me!
string: 把房屋建在蘑菇里……你们丹莫总能让我大开眼界！

original: Not sure if that's a compliment, but I'll take it.
string: 不知这是不是夸赞，不过我心领了。

original: It boggles the mind. What possessed your people to choose a mushroom of all things?
string: 真是不可思议，你们族人当初究竟怎么想的，居然选了蘑菇这种东西？

original: You know what? I stopped asking myself that question ages ago.
string: 知道吗？我早就不琢磨这个问题了。

original: I've never been at the foot of the mountain before. I'm surprised life can thrive here!
string: 我从没到过山脚下。没想到这里居然生机勃勃！

original: If I were a betting woman, I'd say we have the ash coming out of that volcano as the culprit.
string: 若我是个爱打赌的人，八成会赌是火山喷发的火山灰在作祟。

original: Right on the money, lady! Where the Dunmer go, ash follows.
string: 完全正确，女士！丹莫所至，灰烬相随。

original: The eruption of the Red Mountain brought terrible consequences to the island.
string: 红山喷发给这座岛带来了灾难性的后果。

original: You wouldn't believe how green the landscape was during the Third Era. Every single native life form was driven to extinction in the blink of an eye.
string: 你绝对想象不到第三纪元时这里的葱茏景象。转眼间，所有原生生命都被彻底灭绝。

original: On the bright side, it made it easier for us to import Morrowind's flora and fauna without causing an ecosystem collapse.
string: 换个角度看，这样反而方便我们引进晨风的动植物，还不会破坏生态平衡。

original: Hah! Well, at least not on our account.
string: 哈！至少不是我们的责任。

original: It's ironic that the northern tundra is a more habitable environment.
string: 讽刺的是，北边的苔原反而更适宜居住。

original: A sick joke is what it is...
string: 这简直就是个恶意的玩笑……

original: Ugh... All this for a book...
string: 唉……折腾半天就为了一本书……

original: You can say that again.
string: 那还用说。

original: Somehow, I know the Dwemer laugh whenever someone visits their ruins.
string: 不知为何，我总觉得每当有人造访他们的废墟时，锻莫都会暗自发笑。

original: Hah! Then that would make the Red Year the punchline!
string: 哈！这样一来红色之年就成了笑点！

original: Frea.
string: 芙瑞雅。

original: My condolences.
string: 我向你表示哀悼。

original: Thank you, friend.
string: 谢谢你，朋友。

original: What you three did for my tribe means the world to me. I won't forget it.
string: 你们三位为我的村子所做的一切，对我而言意义非凡，我会永远铭记在心。

original: Aw, don't get all mushy on me. You know they paid me to be here!
string: 哎呀，别这么肉麻嘛。你明知道他们可是付钱让我来的！

original: Well, we certainly didn't pay you to show empathy.
string: 没错，我们可没付钱让你表现同情心。

original: And Frea? If you ever need anything, just tell us, okay?
string: 芙瑞雅呢？要是有什么需要，随时告诉我们，好吗？

original: And Frea? If you ever need anything, just tell us, okay?
string: 芙瑞雅呢？要是有什么需要，随时告诉我们，好吗？

original: I know what you're going through.
string: 我明白你正在经历什么。

original: I'll be fine, but... Thank you, friend. From the bottom of my heart.
string: 我会没事的，但是……谢谢你朋友，我发自内心地感激你。

original: You saved my home, and so it shall be your home as well. You are all Skaal-Friends now.
string: 你们拯救了我的家园，这里也将永远是你们的家。从今往后，你们都是斯卡尔的朋友。

original: Whatever you want. But don't tell anyone I know.
string: 随你便。不过可别到处说我知道这件事。

original: Ha ha!
string: 哈哈！

original: I suppose the temple opened some old wounds as well, didn't it?
string: 看来这座神殿也让你想起了些不愉快的往事，对吧？

original: I thought as much. I didn't mean to sound insensitive back there. My apologies.
string: 我早有预料。刚才无意冒犯，我向你致歉。

original: It's fine. Let's go back to the Skaal.
string: 没关系。我们回斯卡尔村吧。

original: Serana?
string: 瑟拉娜？

original: You did good. I appreciate your help.
string: 你做得很好，很感谢你的帮助。

original: It was the least I could do. Especially after not taking this seriously enough.
string: 这至少是我能做的。尤其是在我当初不够重视这件事之后。

original: Come now, lady. Don't beat yourself over that! Even I didn't care much about the mind control. And I live here!
string: 好啦姑娘，别为这事苛责自己了！连我都没太在意精神控制这回事呢！我可是本地人！

original: For what it's worth, I agree with what he said. Whatever you did in the past shouldn't determine whether or not you deserve happiness.
string: 要我说，我同意他的说法。无论你过去做过什么，都不该成为你能否获得幸福的决定因素。

original: Your empathy for our plight proves you're a good person.
string: 你对我们的困境能感同身受，这足以证明你心地善良。

original: For what it's worth, I agree with what she said. Whatever you did in the past shouldn't determine whether or not you deserve happiness.
string: 要我说，我同意她的说法。无论你过去做过什么，都不该成为你能否获得幸福的决定因素。

original: Your empathy for our plight proves you're a good person.
string: 你对我们的困境能感同身受，这足以证明你心地善良。

original: Sometimes, that's not good enough.
string: 有时，这样是不够的。

original: But... thank you.
string: 但是……谢谢你。

original: You heard the old man. Let's hurry there! I don't think their barrier will hold on for much longer.
string: 你听到那个老头说的了。我们赶紧过去！我觉得他们的屏障撑不了多久了。

original: That book... I knew it. It has to be the reason behind the mass mind control. Kind of stupid of him to leave it behind.
string: 那本书……我就知道。它一定就是大规模精神控制的原因。他把它留在这里有点蠢。

original: We should clense those stones as soon as possible. I can't imagine what those poor souls are going through!
string: 我们应该尽快净化那些石头。我无法想象那些可怜的灵魂正在经历什么！

original: That roar is making my skin crawl... It's daedric, alright.
string: 那声吼叫让我全身发麻……这绝对是迪德拉的声音。

original: Alright... Here goes nothing.
string: 好吧……这儿什么都没有。

original: Be careful, alright?
string: 小心点，好吗？

original: I used to live in Helgen... Until a dragon destroyed it.
string: 我以前住在海尔根……直到一条龙毁灭了它。

original: Oh...
I'm so sorry. I can't imagine what it feels like to lose your home like that..
string: 我很抱歉。我无法想象以那种方式失去家园是什么感受。

original: I hope life gets better for you in the future.
string: 希望你未来的生活能越来越好。

original: What have you been doing since then? How do you earn a living?
string: 从那以后你一直在做什么？靠什么谋生？

original: Mother? Can we talk?
string: 妈妈，我们可以聊聊吗？

original: Do we really need to be here?
string: 我们真的需要来这里吗？

original: Whatever you have to do here, do it quickly.
string: 无论你在这里需要做什么，快点行动吧。

original: Let's get out of this temple. Please...
string: 我们离开这个神庙吧。拜托了……

original: Look, I'm not saying that chasing your dream is wrong. It's good you stood up for yourself.
string: 听着，我并不是说追求梦想是错的。你为自己挺身而出是好事。

original: But I think you should at least make an effort to understand why he wanted to keep you close to him for so long.
string: 但我认为，你至少应该努力去理解，他为何想让你长时间待在他身边。

original: Yeah, I... I know.
string: 是的，我……我知道。

original: He did end up being supportive when he changed his mind. I don't think I showed my appreciation to him as much as I should have.
string: 当他改变主意时，他最终还是支持我的。我觉得我并没有像应该的那样向他表达出我的感激之情。

original: Look, um... Thanks. And I'm sorry if you and your family are...
string: 你看，嗯……谢谢。如果你和你的家人因此感到不愉快，我深感抱歉。

original: It's fine, Erik. Thank you.
string: 没关系，艾瑞克。非常感谢。

original: I need to trade some things with you.
string: 我要和你交换物品。

original: Let's do this quietly.
string: 我们悄悄地做这件事。

original: Is this the best time for that?
string: 现在做这个是最合适的时间吗？

original: Who is Miraak, really?
string: 米拉克到底是谁？

original: Lord of the Volkihars
string: 沃基哈尔领主

original: Find Valerica in the Soul Cairn
string: 在灵魂石冢寻找瓦蕾莉卡

original: The yelling of the Graybeards
string: 灰胡子之吼

original: Meeko
string: 米科

original: Meeko
string: 米科

original: Mjoll
string: 穆月尔

original: J'zargo
string: 杰'扎格

original: Erandur
string: 依兰杜尔

original: No more "Moveto Player". You're welcome! :D
string: 再也不用“移动到玩家处”了。不客气！ :D

original: Greetings, Serana
string: Greetings，Serana

original: From Arena to Oblivion
string: 从竞技场到湮灭

original: Serana asked me to find her books related to the events that led to the Dragonborn Prophecy. In return, she'll teach me a few lessons on skills she's good at. I'm sure I can find something for her in the College of Winterhold.
string: 瑟拉娜委托我寻找与引发龙裔预言事件相关的书籍，作为回报，她将传授几项她擅长的技能。已知有四本书可能符合要求。

original: Serana asked me to find her books related to the events that led to the Dragonborn Prophecy. I brought her four books and she seemed satisfied with them.
string: 瑟拉娜委托我寻找与引发龙裔预言事件相关的书籍。我已为她找到四本书，她对此感到满意。

original: Ask Urag-gro-Shub for books
string: 找到《帝国简史·卷4》并交给瑟拉娜

original: Find "A Brief History of the Empire V.4" and give it to Serana
string: 找到《龙破时你在何方》并交给瑟拉娜

original: Find "Where were you when the Dragon Broke?" and give it to Serana
string: 找到《红山之战》并交给瑟拉娜

original: Find "The Battle of the Red Mountain" and give it to Serana
string: 找到《湮灭危机》并交给瑟拉娜

original: Find "The Oblivion Crisis" and give it to Serana
string: 向乌拉格·格洛-舒布索要书籍（可选）

original: Talk to Serana
string: 和瑟拉娜交谈

original: Lord of the Volkihars
string: 沃基哈尔领主

original: Say your Goodbyes... Or not.
string: 说再见……或者不说。

original: Serana Map Marker
string: 瑟拉娜地图标记

original: Serana Map Marker
string: 瑟拉娜地图标记

original: Mjoll
string: 穆月尔
